loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is the mother of a 3-year-old son. She owns quarry land in Kitengela town. She has been in this business for the last year. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. With this loan Winfred plans to buy another piece of land for quarry mining work. 

The anticipated profits will be used to buy a lorry for transportation. She desires to be a prominent businesswoman and support her son.

loans.use: To purchase another place for quarry mining.

loans.name: Bidhala

texts.en:
Bidhala is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Bidhala has been operating a mat weaving business and a coconut sales business to earn a living. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Bidhala dreams of expanding her business in the future to meet her customers' needs.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000, Bidhala wants to purchase palm leaves for use as mat weaving materials for her business. She joined Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost her living standards.

loans.use: buy palm leaves to weave mats

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada el “fortín”.
Su negocio es una tienda ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda.
Empezó con esta actividad haces 3 años,  ya que tenía poco capital ella pensaba ponerse otra clase de negocio, en la actualidad le va  bien con este negocio. 
Su  trabajo lo realiza sola, el horario es de lunes a domingo, desde las 8:00am hasta las 20:00pm.
No tiene dificultad, es soltera.
Tienen 2 hijos uno de 12 y el otro de 16 años,  estudian  en escuelas públicas.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: leches, bebidas, arroz, azúcar, etc.
Su sueño es hacer su casa de cemento y agrandar muchos más su negocio y poder ayudar a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32, single, and lives in the area of the city called "Fortin." Her business is a store located in the rear part of her house. 

She started this business three years ago. Since she had a little working capital, she thought of setting up some kind of business. Currently her business is going well. She works on her own, and her hours are 8:00am to 8:00pm, Monday to Sunday. Her life is good. She has two children, 12 and 16. They go to public schools. 

She is applying for this loan to buy merchandise such as milk, drinks, rice, sugar, etc. Her dream is to have a house made of cement, and greatly expand her business, in order to be able to help her children complete their education.

loans.use: To buy drinks, milk, tuna, rice etc.

loans.name: Gloria Narcisa

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos que tienen 12, 10 y 2 años de edad. Vive con su familia en Latacunga en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador. Gloria se describe como una persona trabajadora, alegre y cariñosa con sus hijos.

Gloria trabaja sola en la venta de productos de alinio para comida, ella trabaja en las calles como vendedor ambulante. Es el primer crédito que le solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que será invertido en la compra de productos como canela, aliños y condimentos para comida; inversión que será de mucha ayuda para Gloria ya que podrá seguir aumentando sus productos y lograr tener buenas ventas y buenos ingresos lo cual ayudará para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de los suyos.

Su sueño es poder tener un local donde pueda adecuar una tiendita y seguir creciendo como comerciante ya que las calles son muy peligrosas, pero tiene que trabajar por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 32 years old.  She is married and has three children who are 12, 10 and 2 years old.  She lives with her family in Latacunga, Sierra Centro, Ecuador.  Gloria describes herself as a hard-working and happy person who is loving with her children.

Gloria works alone selling spices for food.  She works as a street vendor.  This is the first loan she has requested from Fodemi, and it will be invested in the purchase of products like cinnamon, spices and seasonings for food.  The investment will be a great help to Gloria since it will allow her to increase her inventory and to have bigger sales and better income.  This will help to improve her quality of life and that of her loved ones.

Gloria's dream is to have a space to open a small store and continue to grow as a store keeper.  The streets are very dangerous but she has to work for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to purchase products like cinnamon, spices and seasonings for food.

loans.name: Faxruz

texts.ru: Faxruz ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Alixanli vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Faxruz zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Faxruz is married with children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli, currently living in the town of Alixanli, Fuzuli region, together with his family. Faxruz raises livestock - specifically, sheep. At the moment he needs 2,000 AZN to buy sheep, to increase the number of animals he owns, for future resale.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells maize and cassava at Eguafo, and she has been in this business for 12 years. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer. She is responsible for assisting her husband in educating their children. Adjoa will use her loan to buy maize and cassava in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize and cassava in bulk.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with five school going children. He lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

James has operated a vegetable stall for the past three years and his potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and onions for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and onions for resale.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 50-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of seven children. 

Dalal trades in clothes from her home and is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase clothes for trading purposes. 

Dalal started her business with a small amount of capital, then she expanded her project, and now she is looking to expand her home-based project and open a shop for her products.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба мать четверых детей, которой 33 года. Она вместе со своим старшим сыном занимается откормом и продажей мелкорогатого скота. Муж Насибы на заработках в России, и каждый месяц присылает семье деньги на семейные расходы. На каждый получаемый кредит Насиба покупает скот и корм для него. Условия для содержания скота у нее хорошие и откорм скота позволяет ей получать больше дохода и возможность расходовать их на семейные расходы. На текущий кредит она планирует закупить 10 баранов и откормив их продать подороже в сезон дорожания скота.
texts.en: Nasiba is a 33 year-old mother of four children.  She and her oldest son are involved in fattening up and selling small livestock.  Nasiba's husband works in Russia and sends money home every month for family expenses.  Nasiba has used each one of her loans to purchase livestock and animal feed for it.  She has good conditions for keeping livestock, and fattening up livestock allows her to earn a higher income and have an opportunity to spend it for family expenses.  Nasiba plans to use this loan to purchase ten sheep, fatten them up and sell them at higher prices during the season of rising livestock prices.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Jesús acaba de ser padre y quiere la seguridad y comodidad de su familia en la casa. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para el techo del cuarto de lavado y el vitropiso de la casa.
Con las instalación del victopiso podrán tener mayor comodidad y pensando el bienestar de su familia; y colocar el techo ya que estamos en la temporada de lluvia están maltratando los muebles y hay humedad en la casa y le afecta en la salud a su bebe. 
Don Jesús trabaja desde hace casi dos años en una empresa en la que se dedica a instalaciones eléctricas, y su esposa se dedica a los labores domesticas y al cuidado de su bebe ya que tiene pocos días de nacido.
El señor Jesús es una persona muy trabajadora que desea darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Jesús has just become a father and wants to ensure the security and comfort of his family at home. This is why he is asking for a loan to install a roof in laundry room and lay glazed tiles on the floors of the house.
 
Thinking to the welfare of his family, they will be more comfortable with the installation of tiles. He wants to install a roof as it is the rainy season and the furniture is getting spoilt, the house is damp and it is affectingthe baby's health.

Don Jesus has worked for nearly two years in a company that does electrical installations. His wife does the housework and cares for the baby as it is only a few days old.

Señor Jesús is a hardworking person who wants to give his family the best.

loans.use: to install a roof in one of the rooms and lay glazed tiles on the floors in the house.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo es chofer propietario de un taxi. El crédito lo necesita para la compra del motor de su vehiculo para continuar trabajando y mantener su nivel de ingresos. Es casado,  tiene tres  hijos y vive en anticretico  ubicada en la zona  San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz.  Es la décima cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO. Y la quinta vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a taxi driver, and he has his own car.  He needs the loan to buy a motor for his vehicle in order to continue working and maintaining his level of income.

He is married and has three children.  He lives in “anticretico” (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) in the San Martín zone in the city of La Paz.  

This is the 14th time he has worked with IMPRO and the fifth time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a 1600 c.c. motor for his taxi.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is single and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Regina is a successful businesswoman. She runs a store selling fabric, accessories, shoes, and personal care products in Cape Coast. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Regina uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Regina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of goods, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of goods, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Pierina Briyith

texts.es:
Pierina es una joven de 23 años, nació en el Municipio de San José de Chiquitos de Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia, vive en la casa de su tía y se encuentra cursando el último año de  la carrera de Enfermería para posteriormente iniciar su año de internado el cual es indispensable para culminar sus estudios y poderse titular, para lo cual solicita un crédito educativo ya que el dinero que le envían sus padres solo le alcanzan para apoyar en los gastos del hogar.  

Pierina menciona que pese a sus limitaciones económicas, su mayor motivación en la vida, es poder superarse día a día hasta haber cumplido su sueño de ejercer su profesión en un Hospital de tercer nivel, ocupando un cargo de mando medio, que le permita tener una buena remuneración económica y así de esta manera darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres que aún viven en el campo con muchas limitaciones.

Pierina se siente agradecida con aquellas personas que brindan su apoyo a estudiantes de escasos recursos y les dan una oportunidad de cumplir sus sueños, los cuales en un principio parecían inalcanzables.

loans.use: para pagar la carrera de enfermeria

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 50 years old, dynamic and worker, she is married and has two sons and all work together in this familiar business. Since 10 years ago she started her business selling tacos, she began in a little car where her clients bought her delicious tacos and eaten standing, then with all family work and dedication they could grow their business, so now she has one established place where her clients can enjoy her delicious tacos seated and in tables. Araceli is requesting for a loan of US$ 925 to invest in fix her business and be more competitive. She will pay this loan in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Araceli es una mujer de 50 años de edad, muy dinámica y trabajadora, ella está casada y tiene dos hijos y todos juntos trabajan en el negocio de la familia. Hace casi 10 años que inició su negocio de venta de tacos, en aquél entonces tenían un pequeño carrito movible en donde los clientes compraban sus sabrosos tacos y los consumían de pie, posteriormente con el trabajo y dedicación de toda la familia fueron haciendo crecer el negocio hasta contar con un local establecido en donde los clientes pueden disfrutar de sus ricos tacos sentados en sus mesas. En estos momentos ella requiere de un crédito de $ 925 USD para poder hacer algunas mejoras en las instalaciones físicas y poder estar mas acorde con el crecimiento que se viene dando en su negocio. El plazo que solicita para liquidar su préstamo es de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To invest in repair her business

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.en:
Maria Jacinta T. S. is from the village of Nofoalii. She has four children: two are in school, and two are at home. Jacinta's husband is also working, and he is very happy about the small business that his wife is running. Jacinta and her husband are both delighted about this project because it gives them extra cash -- it really helps them meet the needs of their family.

The project that Jacinta is working on is ice-cake. Jacinta's small business is favored by the kids, and she said that she does more than three par-rows of ice-cake a day. That means that she is selling more than thirty ice-cakes a day at her village school and to the people of her village. Jacinta plans to use the loan to purchase additional ingredients and serving materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and serving materials for her ice cake business

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem V. lives with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Her husband (pictured here) is a motorcycle taxi driver and can make about $4.00 per day. Two of the couple's daughters work at a local restaurant, while their son works in Thailand. V. is currently unemployed, but she has an idea to expand the family's house in order to use it as a rental property. To do this, she is requesting a $1000 loan. She will use this loan to repair the house and also to add new rooms.  Eventually, V. hopes that she will be able to build a second house, which she would use exclusively as a rental property.

loans.use: To repair and expand house in order to rent out rooms

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria lives in Monterrey, Santo Domingo. She has five brothers and sisters, none of whom could attend school on account of the family's precarious finances. Maria herself only attended first grade before she left to work in the cotton fields. At nineteen she married Pablo Esquipulas, who died nine years ago of an epileptic seizure. They had seven children together--the eldest daughter is 31 and married. The second daughter is 30 and also married. The third daughter is single at 29. The fourth child, a son, died at the age of 25 of a heart attack. The fifth and sixth children are sons, 23 and 25, both married, and lastly, the youngest girl, Elisa, 19, is unmarried. The family is very close-knit and hard-working. Maria is confident that with this loan she will be able to help her business by selling clothing in the market of Mazatenango succeed.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria vivió en el parcelamiento Monterrey, Santo Domingo, tiene 5 hermanos, ella dice que todos sus hermanos no pudieron estudiar por problemas económicos, ella estudió primero primaria, desde pequeña trabajaba en el campo con sus padres cortando algodón, ella se casó a los 19 años con Pablo Esquipulas quien falleció hace 9 años de epilepsia y tuvieron 7 hijos, la primera tiene 31 años, es casada, la segunda 30 años casada, la tercera 29 años, soltera, el cuarto de 25 años quien falleció de un infarto, quinto hijo de 25 años casado, otro de 23 años casado y Elisa de 19 años soltera, son una familia muy unida y trabajadora, ella se siente bien trabajado un crédito, ya que ha podido salir adelante y hacer que su negocio crezca, solicitando para su próximo crédito unos Q7,000.00 su negocio es venta de ropa en la terminal del mercado de Mazatenango.

loans.use: Clothing sales.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Manzura K. sells canned foods and costume jewelry. She is married and has 3 children. Manzura K. has high school education. Her husband is in Russia working as a seasonal laborer and her children are in school. Manzura K. has been in business for 14 years. She began with $100. When she joined MicroInvest in 2004, Manzura K. was selling only costume jewelry. After repeated borrowing and targeted reinvestment of loaned funds, Manzura K. hired a salesperson and purchased a trading spot at a local food market. Now Manzura K. also sells canned food. In the future, she plans to purchase a store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Манзура- занимается продажей консервных изделий и бижутерией. Замужем, имеет двоих детей, образование среднее. Муж на заработках в РФ, дети учатся в школе. Опыт работы в этой деятельности 14 лет. Начала свою деятельность с 100$. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2004году, тогда она торговала только бижутерией. После неоднократного кредитования и целевого использования она наняла продавщицу, и приобрела торговую точку продуктовом рынке. Сейчас она реализует консервные изделия. В будущем планирует приобрести магазин.

loans.use: To purchase a store

loans.name: Jero Puri

texts.id:
Ms. Jero Puri, a mother works hard to help her husband I Gst Made Rupa who works as a tenant farmer. Jero raises pigs to increase her income, since she is responsible for education expenses for her 3 school aged children. With an initial capital of Rp800,000 (about US$88), Jero bought 1 mother pig. After raising for 6 months, it gave birth to 8 piglets. Price per piglet could reach up to Rp250,000 (about US$27.50). Jero Puri fed her pigs 2x/day, mornings and evenings. Before feeding, the pigs are cleaned, also the stalls are watered until clean. Besides feeding rice shell clippings, Jero Puri also fed greeneries like banana and tals leaves, and banana tree trunk. Profit were used to pay for daily expenses and education of her 3 school aged children. Her house is build on own land, and the building is quite permanent. Her hope is that with Dinari's loan ger business could increase, also the family could have a better life.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ibu Jero Puri ,seorang Ibu Rumah tangga yang ulet bekerja sambil membantu suaminya I Gst Made Rupa yang bekerja sebagai petani, Jero memelihara babi untuk tambahan pendapatannya,karena Jero harus menanggung pendidikan ketiga anaknya yang masih sekolah. Dengan modal awal Rp.800.000 Jero membeli 1 induk babi ,setelah 6 bulan dipelihara, babinya mempunyai anak sebanyak 8 ekor. Harga per ekor anak babinya mencapai Rp.250.000. Jero Puri memberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari pada pagi hari dan sore hari,sebelum diberi makan babinya dibersihkan dan juga kandangnya disiram sampai bersih.Disamping memberi dedak ,Jero Puri juga memberikan hijauan seperti daun pisang, daun talas dan batang pisang. Keuntungannya dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan juga pendidikan ketiga anaknya yang masih sekolah.Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen .Harapannya dengan pinjaman dari Dinari usahanya lebih meningkat dan juga kehidupan keluarganya lebih baik.

loans.use:
To buy pig feed

Membeli pakan babi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bale of assorted second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Phạm Thị Luận is 44. She lives in Ý Yên district with her husband and 2 children. She is a TYM member since 1998. The loans from TYM were used to buy copper/bronze to cast. She produces religious objects (that are displayed on an altar) and sells to the locals. Previously, she only applied for small loans just to preserve the handicraft skill, her income was about 70 USD a month. Today, this region is well known for its copper/bronze casting handicrafts. These products are sold in other provinces as well. This time Ms Luận would like to obtain a loan of 575 to buy copper/bronze thus to increase her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Luận năm nay 44 tuổi, hiện đang sống tại Ý Yên cùng chồng và hai con. Chị là thành viên tham gia vào Quỹ tư năm 1998. Nguồn vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị Luận sử dụng chủ yếu vào việc mua đồng về đúc các đồ cúng, lễ cho người dân địa phương. Các năm trước chị vay vốn thấp về làm chủ yếu giữ nghề với mức thu nhập hàng tháng từ công việc này là 70USD. Đến nay thì nghề đúc đồng của địa phương phát triển tốt, các mặt hàng làm ra đã có mặt trên nhiều tỉnh thành, chị Luận muốn vay mức vốn cao hơn. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 575USD để mua thêm đồng đúc nhằm nâng cao thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy bronze to cast

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Three years ago, Leonor began selling clothes to her relatives,since her income was not enough to cover her children’s expenses being that she is a single mother. That was how she got a taste of the business and was convinced that it left her sufficient revenue. Currently, she works in this business full-time, and thanks to her enthusiasm, she has made a name for herself in her community.

However, her clients request more and more things each day, which is why Leonor is requesting a loan for $525, which she is willing to repay in a 4-month term. With this money, Leonor will be able to purchase more clothing and therefore give her business a boost. With your help, Leonor will be able to help her children prosper so that they may one day go to college.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace tres años que Leonor comenzó a vender ropa a sus familiares. Puesto que con lo que ganaba como obrera no era suficiente para pagar los gastos de sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Y fue así como probó un poco este negocio y se convenció que si dejaba ganancias suficientes. Actualmente ya se dedica por completo a este negocio y gracias a su entusiasmo a logrado darse a conocer en su comunidad.

Sin embargo sus clientes cada vez le van pidiendo más y más cosas. Es por eso que Leonor está solicitando un crédito de US $525 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Leonor podrá comprar más ropa para así darle más vida a su negocio. Con tu ayuda Leonor podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Prek Svay Group

texts.en:
This loan will be shared between twenty-one members of the Prek Svay Village Bank in Kandal province, Cambodia.

Mr. Sophat T., age 59, is a Village Bank president. He is married with five children, two of whom are married. One is a factory worker and the others are students. He and his wife can make an income of around $10 to $14 per day. He would now like to request a loan to buy a pump to support his farm, and to buy jasmine and fertilizer for growing jasmine trees. He would also use the loan to buy fuel for the pump.

loans.use: To buy a pump, jasmine seed, fertilizer, and fuel to support his farm.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Silvia Sánchez is a hair stylist. When she was a child, she enjoyed playing around with make-up and putting make-up on her friends so she decided to become a beautician. Her father was out of work, and as she had to stay at home to be with her many brothers and sisters it seemed like a good idea to open a small beauty salon in the house. She started by cutting and colouring hair only—this was about 9 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, the salon has done well and she has many clients. Like many single women she is responsible for paying the bills and the education of her 4-year old son.

She is now seeking a loan of US$675, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can offer other services in her salon. In order for this to happen, she needs to buy supplies to build somewhere more permanent. Together we can help this enterprising woman realise her business plan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia Sánchez, es estilista. Cuando era mas joven le gustaba mucho maquillarse y también maquillaba a sus amigas por lo que decidió estudiar belleza. Su papa se quedo sin empleo y la necesidad en la casa por ser muchos hermanos le dio valor para poner una pequeña estética en su domicilio iniciando solo con cortes de pelo y tintes, esto fue hace aproximadamente 9 años, gracias a su esfuerzo actualmente esta bien acondicionado y tiene una buena cantidad de clientes. Como muchas mujeres se hace cargo sola de los gastos y educación de su niño de 4 años, es madre soltera.

Ahora busca un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para ofrecer un servicio mas en su estética y para esto necesita comprar material para realizar delineados permanentes. Apoyemos a Silvia una mujer emprendedora a que consolide su negocio.

loans.use: Build a permanent salon in order to offer more services

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald is a diligent and enterprising father. Since starting a family, he has persevered in his trade of carpentry. With the support his loyal and loving wife, he is managing to build beautiful and distinctive furniture. This happy couple cherishes their young child, who is their greatest motivation. Currently, Ronald and his family are living with his sister at whose home he opened his carpentry workshop where he gets many orders. He has a problem because he does not have enough raw materials to fulfill his orders, which is the reason he seeks to obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ronald, es un diligente y emprendedor padre. Desde que formó su familia trabaja perseverantemente en su oficio de carpintero, con apoyo de su fiel y querida esposa está logrando construir hermosos y distintivos muebles.Esta feliz pareja alberga en casa a un encantador niño quien es su mayor motivación para esforzarse.Actualmente Ronald y su familia se encuentran viviendo en el domicilio de su hermana, lugar donde abrió su taller de carpintería y en donde tiene gran cantidad de solicitudes, pero tiene un problema, no cuenta con suficiente materia prima para cumplir sus pedidos, es por ello que recurre a ti en búsqueda de un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar N. lives with her large family in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is married with 3 children. She has been in the retail business for 3 years selling children's clothing. She wants to take out a loan to be able to sell a larger assortment of clothing. This will help broaden her business and improve the financial situation in the family. In addition, the population, which buys her clothing, will have a larger assortment to choose from. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Нарзикулова Дильбар проживает со своей большой семьей в городе турсун-заде. Замужем и имеет 3 детей. Занимается торговлей уже около 3 лет. Торгует одеждой для детей. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы завести новый ассортимент товара. Это поможет развитию ее бизнеса , а также наладит финансовое положение семьи.Кроме того население , которое пользуется ее услугами сможет приобретать необходимый для них товар и иметь большой выбор в ассортименте. Погасить кредит Дильбар сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase Cash-flow

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 51 years old. She is married with five children. Four of her children have completed senior high school and are waiting for their script to enter university next year.

Mercy owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies and biscuits. She wants to use this loan to buy a bulk stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders and other items. She wants to increase her stock in the current season to avoid price hikes due to the food crisis. Mercy hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to finance her children’s education and to provide them with life opportunities better than what she has had.

She belongs to the community group called Humility Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy a bulk stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders and other iteams

loans.name: Sinecio

texts.es:
Mr. Sinecio L. is from the neighborhood known as 8th of December in the city of San Estanislao. He is 65 years old and is married to Guillermina Wrague, who is 60. They have 6 children, all grown and working independently.

Sinecio has a Ford car in which he works as a taxi driver. He has two stops, one in the municipal market and the other close to the courthouse. The work brings him a good income. The couple has excellent references, both personal and commercial.

Now it is time to add to their home. He would also like to replace his taxi with a newer vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Sinecio L. es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio 8 de diciembre, tiene 65 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Guillermina Wrague de 60 años de edad, tienen 6 hijos todos mayores de edad y trabajan en forma independientes.

Tiene un automóvil de la marca, Ford en el cual trabaja como taxi de pasajeros, tiene dos paradas, uno en el mercado municipal y otro cerca de la fiscalia, le dà buenos ingresos. Son personas que tienen exelentes referencias, comerciales y personales.

Ahora està mandando ampliar su casa, y màs adelante le gustarìa cambiar su automóvil por otro modelo màs nuevo.

loans.use: Purchase a newer car.

loans.name: Leluu

texts.en:
Leluu is 45 years old. She is married with one child aged 8 years old. She has been a charcoal and coconut seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80 from her sales.

Leluu is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and coconuts for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and coconuts for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Prak Phach's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak P. is the group leader for six people who all live in Rumchek Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can cultivate rice to earn a living. She is a 54-year-old widow with two children. One is a construction worker while the other is a silk weaver.

Since Mrs. Prak P.'s second child is doing well and has a lot of customers, Mrs. Prak P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more silk for her child's business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more silk for her child's business

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two grown sons. Ten years ago she decided to start her own small business. She knew that it would require stamina and flexibility, but she decided to take a risk and try it out, strongly believing that she would succeed. Today Olga runs a successful small business selling clothing in the central city market of Melitopol. 

Olga is very serious and determined. Her great entrepreneurial skills and commitment to her business have helped her keep her sales high and costs low. The ability to give her customers what they want plus a little more, such as a smile or a word of encouragement, has helped Olga keep loyal customers who come back over and over again. Currently she has about $2,000 in working capital with a monthly profit of around $600. Olga is requesting a loan for 3,000 Grivnas to increase working capital. We believe her passion for business, enthusiasm in customer service and marketing skills, together with financial assistance, will help Olga expand her trade and develop a strong competitive business. 

Note: This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: El sr. Benedicto trabaja con la institución desde hace un año, es propietario de un salón de billar en su zona, donde atiende todos los días por las tardes; comparte los gastos de la casa con su esposa, quien tiene un restaurante muy cercano al salón de billar, tienen un bebé, son muy unidos y trabajadores. Viven en un pequeño departamento lo suficientemente amplio para ellos y su bebé. El crédito será invertido en la compra de canchitas (futbolines)  y una mesa de ping pong, ya que el salón es grande y tiene espacio para estos juegos. Es un cliente muy responsable.
texts.en:
Benedicto has been with the institution for the past year. He is the owner of a pool hall in his region, managing it daily in the afternoons. He shares the expenses with hsi wife who own a restaurant very close the the pool hall. They have a baby together. They are a very close couple and they are hard workers. They live in a smal apartment, only big enough for themselves and the baby. This loan will be invested in the purchase of a foosball table and a ping pong table. The pool hall is large and there is room still for these games. He is a very responsible client.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ping pong tables.

loans.name: Karen Nelida

texts.es:
Karen es soltera, tiene 20 años de edad, estudia la carrera de Turismo en la Universidad Nacional del Altiplano y vive en la Urbanización Totorani del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales” en Puno. Su primer préstamo de S/. 300 lo invirtió en la compra de artículos de dormitorio como colchas, edredones, sabanas y otros. A los 14 años empezó con este negocio en el cual le ha ido bien. Trae sus productos de Desaguadero y Tacna para venderlos en su puesto del Mercado Bellavista.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará más mercadería para las fiestas navideñas.

Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Karen is single. She is 20 years old and she is studying the career of Tourism at the National University del Altiplano and she lives in the Urban development called Totorani in the district, province and department of Puno. She is a partner of Communal Bank "Diana de Gales “ in Puno. Her first loan of $95 was invested to buy articles for the bed such as bedspreads, comforters, sheets and others. She started this business at the age of 14 and she has done quite well. Se brings her products from the city of Desaguadero y Tacna to sell them in her stand at the Bellavista Market. With this loan of $550 which will be repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy more merchandise for the Christmas holidays. Her desire is to make her business grow and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for the Christmas holidays.

loans.name: Mehpara

texts.en: Mehpara (her brother is pictured) is single. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region of Kurdmahmudlu village. She was born in 1978. 5 years ago, she started this business. Now she plans to buy 3 calves to fatten for sale that is why she is applying for a loan of 950 AZN.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves to fatten for sale

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 44-year-old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Bassam has been selling mankoucheh for four years. Mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Bassam decided on this business because he used to work in a bakery, where he gained lot of experience. Bassam's business is special because he makes such delicious mankoucheh. His clients are his friends and neighbors

Bassam has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase a motorcycle for his business, so he can start delivering mankoucheh. This is the first time that Bassam has asked for a loan. In the future, he plans to improve the décor of his shop.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky P., who is 34 years old with two children, is a rice grower. Previously in 1999, Pinky worked in Manila as a cook and a clothes dealer selling fashion products like cologne, pants, perfumes t-shirts and sandals. However, she was not happy about being a cook and a clothes dealer. She decided to stop working and went back to her province to manage their small farm. 

She is asking CEVI for a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase fertilizer for her farm. The loan will help her achieve a bigger yield. She believes she could better contribute to her family's income. 

CEVI provides their clients not just credit assistance, but also training and insurance coverage. By providing such services, CEVI and its partners are able to lift more and more people out from poverty.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna A. is a simple woman. She is forty-eight years old, married, and lives in Punta Blanca, Mobod, Oroquieta City. She has three children. Her husband drives his own motorcycle. In order for her to help her husband, she decided to open a “sari-sari” (general) store adjacent to their house. It started with a capital of only $11. Her primary customers are neighbors & relatives. She was able to manage the business so well that they were able to buy their food with the income from the “sari-sari” store. Myrna is also thankful to the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, because it helped her in the expansion of her store, specifically with financial matters. She became a member of the co-op in December of 2006. She has received loans several times. Now, she is applying for only $50 for additional merchandise for sale. She’s looking forward to a comfortable life and plans to expand her business into a grocery store someday.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for sale

loans.name: Maua

texts.en: Maua J. is a married woman who runs a pub at Ubungo Bus Terminal in Dar es Salaam in Tanzania. She sells different types of soft and alcoholic drinks to her customers. She purchases stock from the wholesale suppliers and from the retail-business man. She has been in the business for four years and she feeds her family from her business income. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to keep up the business.

loans.use: To buy stock for her pub

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita D. is a 44-year-old mother of two daughters who lives in Culasi, Antique Province on the island of Panay.  Culasi is a beautiful coastal town, with the sea to the west and mountains to the east; it is home to Madia-as, the tallest mountain on the island.  Bernardita's husband Bertito is a farmer.
Bernardita grows rice with her husband, and intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy materials for rice farming.  Besides rice farming, Bernardita earns extra income from working as a housemaid.
Bernardita's 18-year-old daughter is attending college, and her younger daughter, a nine year old, is in elementary school.  Bernardita hopes to earn enough to help both of her daughters attain a college education.  She would also like to be able to afford to build a more secure and durable house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To buy materials for her rice farm.

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en: Flordelina M. owns a small parcel of land in their village. She is 53 years old and the mother of five children. She wants to grow her business and buy her own farm. "I was just renting land. My husband is the one managing our small business which we use to feed and clothe our children. Someday, we will be able to buy a new farm which is really ours so that we can earn more for our needs," she said. Flordelina is requesting a loan of $150 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase a sack of fertilizer and to pay for labor. CEVI helps people start and have their own business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar O. lives with his wife and three small children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest child is his 9-year-old son, who goes a local high school. The other two small children stay home under the care of their parents.

Erdenebayar runs a small shoe repair shop in the town. He has been running the shoe repair shop for the last nine years and it is known as a good repair shop in the town. Since the start, his business has done well; his business capital has increased from 30,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) to 500,000 MNT. He says that he hopes to expand his shoe repair shop by hiring an additional worker as the demand for his services steadily increases. He requests a loan to purchase shoe repair materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase shoe repair materials

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel P. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos pequeños a los cuales quiere lo mejor para ellos. 
A la vivienda del señor Juan Manuel le está haciendo falta un portón al frente de la casa paro en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder le pagar a la persona que realizara el portón. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder poner el portón y más que nada la seguridad de sus niños cundo estén en la casa.
Don Juan Manuel ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Manuel P. is the father of a family, and he has two small children whom he wants to do better for. Señor Juan Manuel’s home is missing a front portion of the house wall, and at the moment he doesn’t have the money needed to pay the workmen who could do the repair. This is why he is asking for a loan, to be able to replace the wall and, more than anything, for the security of his children when they are in the house. Don Juan Manuel has already had a loan with FVP which he repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a portion of Juan's home

loans.name: María Adelfa

texts.es: María Adelfa M. D. A. con  43 años D. edad  resiD. en Barrio La Loma en el departamento D. Cabañas; María vive con hija Lisbeth D. 9 años D. edad y su esposo don José quien le ayuda en el negocio, ya que María se dedica a la distribución D. carnes rojas que son procesadas por ella misma para luego ser comercializadas en el mercado municipal D. Sensuntepeque, los clientes prefieren la carne que María distribuye ya que la califican como carne D. buena calidad y muy fresca, el destino del crédito que María solita es para la compra D. cerdos para el destazo ya que es una carne que tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
María Adelfa M. D. A. is 43 years old and resides in the neighborhood of La Loma in the district of Cabañas. She lives with her 9 year old daughter, Lisbeth, and her husband José. María is a meat vendor. She processes the meats in the same location where she sells them in the city market of Sensuntepeque. Her husband assists her with the business.

María’s customers prefer to buy from her because the meat she sells is very fresh and of good quality. She will use her loan to purchase pigs for slaughter because that type of meat is very much in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs for slaughter

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Mrs. Lorna E. is a 49-year-old widow from Binalbagan, Negros Occidental who has two school-age children. Lorna has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994. Five years ago, she started selling cigarettes on a wholesale basis to help sustain her family's daily expenses and to fund her children's education. The PHP 10,000 loan that she is borrowing for her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon will be used as additional working capital so that she can buy more stock to sell and continue supporting her single-parent family. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is into pig farming and has been in this business since 2001. She is 35 years old and married with six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Evelyn is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more piglets to raise and sell. With this she will be able to meet the demands of her customer. She thanks all her Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Mahrabadine Group

texts.en:
MahrabaD. is the group leader of this group. The five members of this group all want to expand their businesses.

MahrabaD. wants to take a loan for his business of selling oil.

Khalely A. wants to take a loan is for his general store.

Maryna wants to take a loan for her carpet-weaving business.

AmraD. wants to take a loan for his general store.

AmalleD. wants to take a loan for his retail food business.

They have requested a group loan of 70,000 Afghani. The group sends many thanks to Kiva lenders for supporting entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Jing

texts.en:
Jing E. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old and married with one small child (see picture). To make a living, Jing has a bread delivery business. She buys a variety of bread products and sells them in the local community. Jing is just starting this business.

In 2008, Jing joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jing has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Jing is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas A. is 54 and currently depends on selling fresh fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Meas A. is a humble, low-income mother who has been blessed with 10 children: four are married and the others are single. Most of her children are employed in various occupations. 

Now the river is full of fish due to the coming fish season and Meas A.’s husband needs more tools for his fishing activities. Meas A. has asked for a loA. to fulfill the business needs of her husband by buying fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools for her husband's business

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en: Mansur has been in the cattle breeding business for five years. Born in 1972, he is married and has two children. The S. family lives in the Fuzuli region. He requests a loan of 2000 AZN to buy five calves to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: Buy five calves.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio T. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. He is 43 years old. Gregorio is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gregorio owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling plastics and other recyclables for local community members.

Gregorio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gregorio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gregorio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Anta Mbaye

texts.fr: Madame Anta Mbaye F. est mariée et âgée de 56 ans c'est une aide infirmière en retraite qui travaille dans la confection et vente de draps pour être revendu dans le marché . ce prêt entre dans le renforcement de ses activités de production  et d'accroissement de son affaire et de sa rentabilité
texts.en:
Mrs. Anta Mbaye F. is married and 56 years old. She is a retired nurse who is now active in the clothing and bedclothes business at the market. She will use this loan to bolster her production activity and increase her turnover and profitability.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say S., 29, is a local rice grower living in the rural area of Kampong Chhnang province. She was married, but divorced her husband when her four kids were very young. Say S. needs a loan to buy rice in bulk from other farmers and then she will sell it to raise income when the rice commands highest prices.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk from other farmers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Esther tiene 29 años y tiene una hija de un año y 4 meses y se llama Azumi Nahomi. La socia Esther es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra a 45 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a 45 minutos de viaje. 

La socia se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su esposo y atender a su hija. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a vender pan a la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad de Urcos. Ella y sus compañeras de negocio desde hace 2 años atrás se les ocurrió crear un pan especial que lo llamaron “chuta navideña” que tiene las mismas características del pan chuta (Pan redondo blando con un olor peculiar y es un pan gigante, pan típico de la ciudad de Urcos) pero le agregaron pasas y frutas. La socia y sus compañeras de negocio solo preparan este pan “Chuta navideña” para las fiestas de navidad. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mas insumos como harina, azúcar, manteca, frutas y pasas para preparar las “chutas navideñas” para esta navidad y año nuevo ya que por estas épocas es donde se vende más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Esther is 29 years old; she has a daughter who is 1 year and 4 moths old and her name is Azumi Nahomi. Esther is originally from the city of Urcos, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco and she belongs to the Community Bank “Qori Orcco” of the Arariwa Association. The city of Urcos is located 45 Km from the city of Cusco, approximately 45 minutes of travel time. Esther gets up early to do her household activities such as preparing breakfast for her husband and tending to her daughter. After she is done with her household activities, Esther has to go sell bread at Plaza De Armas (parade grounds) in the city of Urcos. She and her business partners of 2 years now came up with the idea to create a special bread that they called “chuta navideña” which has similar characteristics to the chuta bread (a round, soft bread with a particular aroma and of giant size; traditional bread from the city of Urcos) but they added raisins and fruits. Esther and her business partners only make the “chuta navideña” bread for the Christmas festivities. She is requesting a loan to buy more consumables such as flour, sugar, lard, fruits and raisins to make “chutas navideñas” for this Christmas and New Year, since it is during this season when they sell the most. Esther is grateful for the opportunity afforded by this channel and she is committed to make the payments according to the established time line.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more consumables such as flour, sugar, lard, ruits and raisins.

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra D. est une dame de 73 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de divers produits. Son objectif est de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diarra D. is a 73-year-old lady, married and the mother of 6 children. She has a small business selling various goods. Her goal is to be able to help support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling various products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señor Gloria L. Areas es dueña de una pulpería ubicada en el Reparto San Jose, es una señora de 55 años de edad emprendedora quien junto con su esposo administran el  negocio .El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 15 años, ella empezó vendiendo en un puesto pequeño agua helada y gaseosa poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio esto debido a la demanda de productos y ahora cuenta  con una pulpería estable y solida. Ahora cuenta con 2 muchachas que despachan a las que les brido un trabajo para que  pudieran seguir estudiando.  

 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; Como es la compra inventario para surtir la pulperia para competir con la competencia.

Ella esta casado, con 4 hijos y 1 de ello a su cargo, actualmente se encuentra en la universidad.
 
Lleva 2 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en: Sra. Gloria L.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her store

loans.name: Rasheed

texts.en:
Rasheed is a responsible, affectionate person. He is married with five children. He is 53 years old and he so determined to excel in business and family life.

Rasheed bakes and he also produces cellophane bags (bags made of a thin, transparent sheet of regenerated cellulose and used for food packaging). He is doing well in his business and he hopes to expand his business.

Rasheed hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more baking materials to bake. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Alicia es comerciante tiene 44 años de edad, esta juntado con el Sr. Raul Cristaldo más de 10 años quien es constructor,  tienen dos hijos: Jhonatan de 6 años y Ester de 5 años,  viven en Zarocaro a 10km. de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
 La Sra. Alicia tiene una Despensa-Carnicería en su casa hace 5 años, es el único negocio a un km. a la redonda, tiene una clientela formada de gente humilde y trabajadora.
Ella administra su negocio  y la educación de sus hijos con mucho sacrificio ya que su marido trabaja fuera de la ciudad y las visita una ves al mes. 
Comenta la satisfacción de obtener apoyo crediticio y la confianza de la Fundación Paraguaya, que con dicho crédito realizo compras de carne vacuno y pollo ya que estos productos consigue sólo al contado y con mejores precios en cantidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia is a 44 year-old merchant. She and her partner, Mr. Raul Cristaldo, have been together for over 10 years and have two children; 6 year-old Jhonatan and 5 year-old Ester. He is a construction worker, and they live in Zorocaro, located 10 km from the city of Coronel Oviedo. For the past 5 years, Mrs. Alicia has operated a grocery/meat shop out of her home. It is the only business within a square kilometer, and her clientele is made up of humble, hardworking people. She tends to her business and her children’s education solely, since her husband works out of the city and only gets to visit them once a month. She feels great satisfaction at obtaining support via the loan and the trust of the Fundación Paraguaya, since this loan has allowed her to purchase beef and poultry. These products are only available for with cash, and she gets better pricing when purchasing in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beef and poultry

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Née en 1983 à Comé au Bénin, K. Alice est mariée à DJEGBEVI Florent, et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis dix ans environs au quartier Aïbatin à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Alice a très peu fréquenté. Depuis près de onze ans, Alice mène comme activité la vente de nourriture (riz et pâte de maïs, accompagnés de sauce) à Aïbatin. Parallèlement, Alice a une cabine téléphonique, où elle vend diverses cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Alice s’approvisionne à Cotonou. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Alice désire renforcer son activité et mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Alice sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1983 in Comé (Benin), Alice K. is married to Florent DJEGBEVI, and is the mother of two children, both attending school. The family has lived for ten years in the Aïbatin borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple jointly shares family expenses. Alice has had very little schooling. For the past 11 years, she has been selling food preparations (rice and corn mush, with accompanying sauce) in Aïbatin. As a second activity, she operates a telephone booth, where she sells various telephone recharge cards. She gets her supplies from Cotonou. She is a regular client of ALIDé, and has already been granted two loans, both of which were fully repaid. She wishes to reinforce her activity and better manage customers’ expectations, which is why she is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and corn, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Moises Anibal

texts.es:
Moises tiene 21 años, es conviviente y vive en casa propia de material noble, la cual 
ha construido con ayuda del estado y con sus ahorros. Su unidad familiar la conforman 
su conviviente y su hijo de 2 años. Cuenta con una mototaxi propia la cual maneja con 
mucha responsabilidad y presta un servicio cordial y amable a sus pasajeros. Requiere 
el crédito para ponerle puertas y ventanas a su vivienda que requiere de varios 
acabados, ya que esta es una construcción nueva. Su sueño es brindarle seguridad y 
bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Moises is 21 years old and lives with his common-law partner and their 2-year-old child. They live in their own sturdy home, which Moises was able to build with government help and with his own savings. Moises owns a mototaxi [motorcycle taxi] which he operates responsibly, offering his passengers good and friendly service. He needs the loan to add doors and windows to his home, which is newly built and still needs many finishing touches. His dream is to offer security and a good life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia sells loaves of bread in Benin City, Edo state. She has been in this business for long and she uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers. She is married with 4 children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo, de 53 años de edad, es divorciado y tiene un hijo, Ronaldo de 12 años. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. Teofilo se dedica generalmente a comercializar medicinas naturales, ofreciendo productos de calidad total, por tal motivo ha sabido ganar a su público. Cada quincena adquiere sus productos y entrega los pedidos acorde a las exigencias de sus clientes. Con el pasar del tiempo sus ventas mejoraron, es por ello que en un futuro desea tener una farmacia con la necesidad de imponer su producto natural hacia el publico en general. Usualmente trabaja de manera independiente y apuesta por estos productos naturales debido a que está tomando mucha relevancia a nivel nacional e internacional. Por lo general su producto los vende mayormente en las boticas y de manera ambulante. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo de manera puntual, además se sienten seguro con su grupo comunal, debido al compromiso de cada uno de sus socios. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercaderías con la finalidad de cumplir con los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Teofilo, 53, is divorced and has a son, Ronaldo, age 12. They live together in the beautiful Cusco jungle, in the town of Quimbiri, where they have their own house. Teofilo generally sells natural medicines, offering total quality products which have won over his public. Every fortnight he acquires his products and fills orders according to client requests. With the passage of time his sales have increased, and so in the future he wants to have a pharmacy to offer his natural products to the general public. He usually works independently and he is committed to these products because they are gaining much relevance on the national and international level. He usually sells his products in pharmacies and as a street vendor. This is his third loan with MFP, so he promises to continue to be punctual. He feels secure with his community group, because of the commitment of each of the members. With the requested loan, he will invest in the purchase of merchandise with the goal of filling his outstanding orders.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural products for sale

loans.name: Zonia Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es viuda y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella y la ultima esta estudiando en la universidad. Blanca vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas en mayor proporción son al crédito, Además Blanca es modista tiene un taller de confecciones en su casa, actividad que realiza según las contratas que tenga. También Blanca apoya a sus hijas que tienen un nido.
Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Buena Suerte hace 15 años y lo que mas le gusta son las reuniones, además que aprendió a ser puntual y a ahorrar. Blanca necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lencería y cosméticos.
El sueño de Blanca es que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Blanca is a widow and has 7 children, 3 live with her and the youngest is attending university. Blanca sells makeup by catalogue to her friends and family, her sales are mostly on credit. Blanca is also a seamstress and has a workroom in her home, a job that she does depending on the clients that she has. Blanca also supports her daughters that have a nursery.

Blanca has belonged to the Good Luck Communal Bank for 15 years and what she enjoys most are the meetings, she also learned to be punctual and to save. Blanca needs a loan of 2500 soles, money that will be used to buy lingerie and makeup.

Blanca’s dream is that her daughter be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lingerie and makeup.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Asasah to expand her milk selling business. 


She lives with her family in a city called Riwind in Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Only one of them is able to attend school. 


Her husband does two jobs. In the morning he works in a school as a watchman while, in the evening, he sells milk. In the absence of her husband in the morning, Shahnaz takes care of her buffaloes by giving them food. 


She is unable to supply enough milk to meet customer demand due to low milk productivity. So, she has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy another buffalo. This is her fifth loan from Asasah. She hopes that getting this loan will be a profitable step and will do a lot of good for her business, as before.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Ngim

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngim A. lives in Tang Ruessei village, Takeo province, and she is 47 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Dul Lorn, is a sugar palm seller and he is also a rice wine maker. Her husband is shown with her in the photo. They do not have a child.

Mrs. Ngim A.’s problem is that her field is infertile, but she does not have enough money to support it. So, to improve her rice production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine to plow her field and hire farm laborers to help her to do the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rent a plowing machine and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet G. is from the village of San Jose, Centro Enrile, Cagayan. She is 31 years old. Juliet is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Juliet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane A. is from the village of Dalingap, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zaragoza

texts.es:
Zaragoza es socia  del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Zaragoza es casada, tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la universidad, Zaragoza tiene un carro que realiza transporte interprovincial a la ciudad de Vilcas Huaman, Zaragoza se encarga de la administración y en algunas oportunidades hace tamales que vende en su barrio.
Zaragoza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de repuestos para su carro.
Los sueños de Zaragoza es tener mas carro y tener una fuente de soda.
texts.en:
Zaragoza is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Golondrinas” (The Swallows). She is married and has two children who are university students.

Zaragoza has a car that she uses to provide interprovincial transportation services from the city of Vilcas Huaman. She is in charge of managing the vehicle and also takes advantage of a few opportunities to make tamales and sell them in her neighborhood.

Zaragoza needs a loan of 1000 PEN so that she can buy spare parts for her car. She dreams of acquiring another car and opening a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for her car

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao K., 35, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Men, 39, have been married since 1991 and have three sons. All of them are in school. The family lives in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Sreymao makes a living selling food at her house, and husband helps her in this business. The couple also runs a rice farm. They hire the fellow villagers to grow their rice because they are so busy selling food.  

Sreymao is asking for her first loan, $1,000, to buy additional land on which to grow rice.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang Y. is a 53 year old widowed villager who lives in Kompong Chhnang province. She is a mother whose children are all single and live with her. Her husband died of senility years ago. Hang Y. has worked in agriculture for many years. All her income comes from planting crops on her farmland. Hang Y. usually generates around $1.50 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. For the upcoming rainy season, Hang Y. needs capital to purchase many fertilizers for her crops to grow well.

loans.use: To purchase many fertilizers for her crops to grow well.

loans.name: Nancy Vicenta

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nancy ella tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, uno ya es mayor de edad y sus hijos menores estudian en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.

Su esposo tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, recorre con sus productos en un triciclo por las calles de Manta, dice que el realiza esta actividad desde que tenía 12 años y que se ha mantenido hasta la actualidad a pesar de que ha  habido temporadas bajas pero  igual  conseguía lo necesario para los gastos del hogar, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 3am hasta las 16h00, los productos los compra en el mercado de Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar más frutas y legumbres para su negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda el Banco. Su sueño es tener un local en su casa.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the prosperous Montecristi canton, full of dedicated, hard-working people who are proud of their roots.  Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are honest people who only know to work and to care for their families.  

In this place we find Señora Nancy.  She is 41 years of age, married with 5 children.  One of her children is already grown.  The others study at the secondary school.  Her husband is a businessman.   

Her husband has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  He travels with his products on a tricycle through the streets of Manta.  He says that he has carried out this activity since he was 12 years of age and has maintained the business until now, despite bad times, to earn what he needs for the household expenses.  He works from Monday to Friday from 3AM to 4PM.  He buys his products in the market of Portoviejo. 

This loan is to buy more fruits and vegetables for their business.  She is a founding associate of the communal bank and likes the benefits that the bank offers.  Her dream is to have a place to sell from at her house.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Malingi

texts.en:
Malingi K. is a thirty-two-year-old dressmaker in Mtaani Kilifi. He is married to Joyce Juma who adds to his income and together they have three children. He has been in this business for the last two years and has done great. 

Being his first loan with KADET, he plans to purchase cloth and materials for making dresses to sell during the coming festive season. He plans to use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children. Malingi hopes to increase his cash flow in future.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials for making dresses

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina M. is a 26-year-old trader who is married with three children.  She works in the small village of Sabirabad city. 

Elvina brings different kind of goods from Baku city which is three hours away from her house. She sells home products, perfumes, and dowry gifts from her house. She has her own business since 2003 and has already gained a lot of clients. Her sister helps her a lot to attract more clients. 

 She has applied for a loan to increase the number of items for sale to increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Adjo Emilie

texts.fr: Emilie a 35 ans et est mariée. Elle habite quartier Kluvi et exerce comme activité la vente d’alimentation générale et les bassines.  En effet, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite sur le boulevard Houphouët Boigny. Elle compte dans cette activité 10 ans d'expérience. Pour accroitre son commerce et répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante, elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Emilie is 35 years old and married. She lives in the Kluvi district. She sells general grocery items and basins. She gets her supplies from the big market in Lomé and then sells them on the Houphouët Boigny Boulevard. She has 10 years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business and and meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase food products and basins

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. is married and has six dependents. She has been through junior high school, and now she sells provisions and drinks at Abura. Her husband is a farmer.

Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  She says this loan will enable her to buy more groceries for sale, and possibly to expand her business. If she is able to make extra profit by expanding her business, Ekua plans to reinvest it.

loans.use: to more groceries for sale

loans.name: Tsogbadrah

texts.en: Tsogbadrah is 24 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Tsogbadrah operates a consumer goods selling business at a local market in his town with the help of his wife.
