He started this business in 2009 with working capital of 2,000,000 MNT after working for the local repair center. He sells a variety of consumer goods and clothes that are imported from China. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and establish his own car repair center. Tsogbadrah is a modest man and says, "I want to start operating another business, a car repair center, in addition to my current business." He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to sell for the upcoming Tsagaan Sar, the Mongolian new year.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Hawa. She is married and has four children. In 2003, Hawa established her ice cream business. She began her business because she wanted to support her family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month.  Hawa employs one sales assistant.

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to expand her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 450,000. In the future, Hawa plans to expand further and hire more employees. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand icecream business

loans.name: Essi  Enyonam

texts.fr: Madame est née à Danyi  et habite quartier  Djidjolé.  Elle a 29 ans et est mariée avec  2 enfants à sa charge. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle fait la vente de bijoux et les tapettes.   Elle revend ses marchandises  au marché  Adidogomé  et à son domile. Elle s’approvisionne au grand  marché de  Lomé et compte  8 ans dans cette  activité. Elle demande un prêt pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en:
This lady was born in Danyi and lives in the Djidjolé neighborhood. She is 29 years old and married with two children in her care. 

In order to improve her children’s living conditions, she sells jewelry and flip-flops. She gets her stocks at the Grand market of Lomé and has eight years of experience in this business. She conducts her sales from her home and at the Adidogomé market. 

She is seeking a loan to replenish her stocks of merchandise.

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, es una mujer disciplinada y atenta, tiene 47 años. Es madre sola y vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus hijos. Rosario, es una emprendedora mujer de mil oficios, pero lo que más le gusta hacer es la costura, ya que en su casa cuenta con su maquina de coser, con ella puede remendar la prendas que sus clientes necesitan. De esta manera  viene trabajando por más de 20 años, actividad que le ha generado buenas utilidades. Hoy se siente contenta con lo que hace, ya que gracias a las ganancias que recibe, puede solventar los educativos de sus hijos, así como el de cubrir algunas necesidades dentro del hogar. Sabe que trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y empeño, más adelante logrará  hacer realidad su sueño de instalar una fuente de soda en su casa y de esa manera cubrir la educación superior de sus hijos. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a ustedes que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará cremalleras, hilos, telas y botones al por mayor.
texts.en: Rosario is a disciplined and attentive woman.  She is 47 years old and is a single mother.  She lives in a house that she owns with her children.  Rosario is an enterprising woman of many trades.  However, she likes sewing the most since she has a sewing machine in her house and can use it to mend the pieces of the clothing that her customers need.  She has been working in this business for more than 20 years and it has generated good profits.  She is happy with what she does because thanks to the income that she receives, she can cover her children’s educational expenses as well as some of the household needs.  She knows that if she works hard, she will be able to fulfill her dream of setting up a soda fountain in her house and this way, cover her children’s post-secondary studies.  This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time, as she does not want to disappoint all the people who made the loan possible that will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Upon obtaining the loan requested, she will purchase zippers, thread, fabrics, and buttons at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy zippers, thread, fabrics, and buttons at wholesale

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano es padre de casa de 38 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 2 años, gana su vida como un trabajador en una empresa agrícola en la campiña de la estancia Olmos. Con este trabajo, puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos a ella lo que ayudará mejorar la condición de la vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Posee buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad. Es responsable y ha cumplido con sus obligaciones de otros préstamos en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Mariano is a 38 year old father. He lives with his wife and two children in their own home in the District of Olmos, a farming community with considerable business activity. This area is situated in Lambayeque Province, which is more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, he has earned his living as a farm laborer on an estate in Olmos. Through his work he has been able to cover the family expenses. His home is currently in a state of deterioration. Mariano wants to make a few repairs to help his family’s living condition. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. He has good work-related and personal references from his community. Mariano is responsible and has completed the obligations from his previous loans in a timely manner.

loans.use: To pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 34 years old and has two children who are in school. Suzette is married.

She buys and sells vegetables and bananas in the Philippines. Suzette requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and bananas to sell.

Suzette has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business activities.

In the future, Suzette would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and bananas to sell

loans.name: Khishigjargal

texts.en:
Khishigjargal is 31 years old, lives with his wife and one son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a 'ger', the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son Ochirbat, 5, attends a local kindergarten and his wife Munkhuul, 40, works at fast food cafe as a chef. 

Khishigjargal has operated a taxi service in city since 2002 and has gained a lot of experience over the years. He was renting a taxi before and lately he purchased a second-hand car that he is using in his business. He enjoys transporting people and is very hard-working person. He has gained a lot of experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many clients. He is planning to build a wooden house on his land and to give a proper education to his only son. He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital by buying some spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase some spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Cheap

texts.en: Cheap S. is a 49-year-old widow woman who lives in the Kompong Cham province. She is a mother of five children: two are married, and the remaining three are single. Most of her children are working in different occupations, and they often contribute their earnings to her to use for the entire family’s needs. Her husband died of senility years ago. Cheap S. is a local farmer who has been planting a mixture of crops for over five years. She would like to ask for a loan in order to buy peanut seeds and potato seeds for planting. Cheap S. and her son appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy peanut seeds and potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Donah

texts.en:
Donah T. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (2 sisters).    Donah has a business selling second shoes.  She has been in this business for less than a year, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Donah sells her products in a shop.    

Donah  has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second hand shoes.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenges for Donah include thieves and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell at wholesale only and to start importing shoes herself.  Donah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand shoes

loans.name: Belle Groupe

texts.fr:
Le groupe solidarité est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est constituer de femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui ont la même vision. Elles s'activent tous dans le petit commerce.

Madame BINTA qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main et le responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi en charge deux autres enfant confié par ses voisines. 

Elle s'active dans la vente et l'achat de produits divers dans les marchés de la ville. Elle a une très bonne expérience de ce domaine d'activité, car elle l'a pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on July 10, 2002. It consists of women who live in the same neighborhood and who have the same vision. They are all in retail.

Mrs. Binta, who is at the left in the photo with her hand raised is the group leader. She is 41 years old. She is married and a mother of eight. She also supports two other children of whom her neighbors left her in charge.

She buys and sells diverse products in the city markets. She is very experienced in this, as she’s been doing it for several years.

This loan will allow her to provide for her personal needs as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to buy diverse products

loans.name: Ventilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VENTILLA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, comercio según la ocasión, venta de refrescos, inicio de negocio, venta de productos AVON, tejido de mantas, venta de zapatos, kiosco surtido

La señora María,  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando con la lectura del folleto y por invitación de una vecina. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos, que inicio conjuntamente su esposo, desde hace medio año. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de cosméticos). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Eva porque tuvo que ir porque una de sus hijas se encontraba enferma y requeria atención.
texts.en:
The VENTILLA community bank, associated with Centro Senkata, is embarking on its first round of funding from Pro Mujer.  The group's eight members are lead by a board headed by Sra. Maria.  The members of the group operate a wide range of retail businesses: corner shops; sales of seasonal merchandise; cola sales; Avon product sales; crafts sales; shoe sales; and kiosk sales.

Sra. Maria says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined, at the invitation of a friend, after reading a brochure about the bank.  She operates a business selling cosmetics, a business that she started with her husband six months ago.  

She will use the loan to stock her business (with cosmetics).  The business provides her with a means to support her family that is better than any other open to her.

Sra. Eva had to leave before the photograph was taken because she had to tend to a daughter who was ill.

loans.use: to buy products for her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Wajed

texts.en:
Wajed is a 44-year-old married father of two. He lives and works in Aley. Wajed started his own business 11 years ago; he has 27 years of experience in photography. 

He first started this business when his brother discovered his talent and bought him a special gift, as he describes his first camera, and his journey began. 

Wajed is well-known in his region; he's requested at almost all the weddings in his area and neighboring villages. He's talented and treats his customers in a very polite and special way. 

Wajed loves his family a lot, and seeks the best for them. He is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy an improved and updated Canon camera, which is necessary for his business. 

Wajed hopes to buy an updated editing machine with special effects that will help a lot in editing the wedding photographs he takes.

loans.use: To buy a new improved Canon camera necessary for his business

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is a 62 year-old farmer from the village of Sasireti, Kareli District.  Tamaz is married and lives with his wife, Maya, three sons (21, 19 and 8 years old) and a twenty-year old daughter. The only source of income for the family is farming. In particular, they have 5 hectares of farmland where wheat, barley, haricot beans, maize, cabbage, tomatoes, garlic and beets are grown.  They also have a 3-hectare orchard with 500 apple, 350 peach and 20 cherry trees. Tamaz also has a tractor equipped with different attachments. He uses it on his own farm as well as on neighborhood farms, providing them with different types of services.  That is an additional source of income for the family. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris.

Tamaz requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for treating plants with parasites. Also, part of the loan will be used for paying workers who help the family.  After fertilizing and treating the plants, Tamaz’s family will get a quality harvest and sell it for a good price. It will positively impact the income of the family. 

With the income, Tamaz plans to expand the farm by purchasing an additional 4 hectares of land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides, as well as to pay workers

loans.name: Sara Patricia

texts.es:
alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que es de clima frió, tiene una belleza natural y arquitectónica, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es amable y carismática.

La Señora Sara tiene 21 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 1 hijo de  2 años. Su esposo labora en una fábrica de jeans, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Sara labora conjuntamente con su esposo en su taller, ellos fabrican jeans, trabajan de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como tela, cierres, botones, etc. para su taller.

Su meta es ampliar su taller.
texts.en:
In the city of Cuenca and the surrounding areas, the weather is cold. Cuenca is also known for its natural beauty, its architecture, the wide variety of cuisines, and its friendly and charismatic people.

Sra. Sara is 21 years old, married, and has a two-year-old son. Her husband works in their business where they make jeans. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Sara works with her husband in their business. They manufacture jeans and work Sunday through Sunday without a fixed schedule.

She is receiving her second loan as a member of her Communal Bank. Sara will invest the funds in the purchase of materials such as fabric, zippers, buttons, and other supplies for her workshop. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, and other supplies for making jeans.

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.en:
Nemesio is a responsible father to his two children and a loving husband to his wife. He gives his best in the  farming business just to feed his family abundantly. He is now 49 years old yet very hopeful to uplift his family out poverty. 

Nemesio is asking for the loan amount of P 15,000 to purchase gasoline or crude to use in irrigating his rice field to maintain a quality harvest. He always sees to the development of the business.  Because of his dedication in his work, Nemesio shared that he was able generate P 50,000 average net income that he used to support the studies of his children and in maintaining their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline or crude to use in irrigating his rice field.

loans.name: Gorrette

texts.en: Gorette is a 38 year old single lady. She has one child and is living in a rented house in Fort Portal Uganda. Her dream is to buy land and construct her own permanent home. Gorette runs a drug shop and has been doing so for the last seven years. Her major challenge is delayed debt settlement. This has made her run short of capital for restocking. Her dream is to operate a pharmancy. Gorette needs the loan to buy drugs to resell.

loans.use: to buy drugs for resale.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a widow who is 56 years old. She has three adult-aged children. The family is living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has spent the last four years cultivating the land to make a living. Luciana prefers to plant and/or grow corn because it is the sort of thing she used to do when she was young. At the end of every month, she normally receives PHP 3,000, properly apportioned towards daily needs.

Luciana is a GDMPC member who joined in 2007. She was able to pay back all previous loans taken from the cooperative. Earlier this year, she requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to acquire fertilizers to boost production. Plants applied with adequate growing inputs lead to good productivity. Luciana is hopeful this will happen. She plans to buy tools needed to facilitate good productivity and expand her business area to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: To acquire fertilizers to boost production.

loans.name: Azimchon

texts.ru:
Азимчон женат и у них 5 детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, а также скотоводством. Азимчон добрый и умный человек. Его ценят, и любить все его друзья и родственники. Он старается всегда помогать всем. Азимчон выращивает ячмень для своего скота, а также продает на местном рынке. Он хотел бы получить займ  в размере 2200$ США для покупки скота. Он хочет заранее благодарить Кива и Кива кредиторов за их поддержку и милосердие. Спасибо вам! Ваша помощь нужна нам!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Azimchon is married and has five children.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops and also animal husbandry.  Azimchon is a kind and smart person.  All his friend and relatives value and love him.  He always tries to help everyone.  Azimchon grows barley for this livestock and also sells it at the local market.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2200 for the purchase of livestock.  He wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for their support and mercy.  Thank you!  Your help is necessary to us!

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Marcelina has a retail shop that sells fish like milk fish and sardines. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Marcelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marcelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose Aquilino

texts.es:
José, se decidio por un nuevo prestamo porque esta iniciando un nuevo cultivo, ya que necesita para comprar herbicidas para las plagas, abono y semilla para sembrar,  para que sus cosechas sean mejores este año y aumente sus ingresos. El prestamo anterior le ayudo muchisimo y esta muy agradecido ya que la alimentacion de la familia depende de él.
Su aspiración es tener lo necesario para su familia, darle una mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
José is asking for this new loan because he is starting a new crop, and he needs to buy herbicides for the pests, and fertilizer, and seeds to sow in order to have better crops this year and increase his income. His last loan helped him very much and he is grateful because he earns the daily bread for his family.

His dream is to provide for his family's needs and to give his child a better education.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides, fertilizer, and seeds

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Aydalina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aydalina del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora  de 38 años quien tiene un taller de calzado. Este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años junto a su esposo el cual maneja el taller mientras ella lo comercializa y hace poco tiene un tramo en el mercado el cual obtuvo con el crédito anterior.
Este crédito lo utilizara para ampliar el tramo y condicionarlo  para poder vender lo que produce ya que actualmente vende chinelas de hule. Además otra parte del crédito será para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Aydalina del Carmen is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is 38 years old and has a shoe workshop. Aydalina started this business 10 years ago with her husband. He manages the workshop while she is in charge of selling their goods. She has a space at the market that she obtained with her previous loan.

This loan will be used to expand her space and to equip it so that she can sell what they produce. At the moment, she is selling rubber flip-flops. In addition, part of the of the loan will be used as operating capital.

loans.use: to expand and equip her vending space at the market where she sells shoes.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria,D. 20 años ella se dedica a la confeccion D. tejidos,como guipiles,edelantales,Cortes.desD. hace 4 años, ella nos cuenta que esta contentpa porque a la vez que es un medio que le ayuda a ella y a su familia le gusta mucho su trabajo,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos, ya que esta consiente D. que le falta capital para trabajar,el sueño D. ella es confeccionar tejidos en cantidades grandes y venderlos por mayor.
texts.en: Ana Maria, 20 years old, makes a living in the production of fabrics, like blouses, aprons, and skirts. For 4 years, she tells us that she is happy because while it is a means for her to help her family, she likes her work very much. That is why she is requesting this loan, for the purchase of raw material for weaving. She is aware that she lacks the capital to work. Her dream is to produce fabrics in large quantities and increase sales.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for weaving blouses, aprons,etc.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Monsieur  Issa est un commerçant qui pratique la vente de produits cosmétiques.Il exerce son activité dans un marché de la localité non loin de son lieu d'habitation  depuis 1996. Il est sociétaire du guichet de l'U-IMCEC de la région et  a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Actuellement il sollicite un crédit de 300000 prévu pour l'achat de cosmétiques ,  de nouveaux produits plus particulièrement ( mèches, greffages) afin d'assurer la diversification de ses produits pour la satisfaction de la clientèle.Néanmoins son objectif final est la  réalisation  de bénéfices croissants qui lui permettront de satisfaire ses besoins vitaux.
texts.en:
Mr Issa is a retail merchant dealing in beauty products. He has been based at the Moussanté market of Thiès since before 1996.

With regard to his credit history he is on his third credit loan and all preceding loans were invested in his shop.

He intends to use this loan to increase his stock supply and buy new products such as hair weaves and extensions that are missing from his shop. He resupplies in Petersen and in the central market.

With this loan he wants to meet customer demand (for the most part women) and make ​​a profit to satisfy his basic needs.

loans.use: achat de produits cosmétiques,mèches et gréffages a revendre.

loans.name: Thérése

texts.fr:
Thérèse est une femme âgé(e) de 44ans. Elle est épouse d’un architecte. Elle a 06enfants.
Thérèse travaille comme revendeuse de haricot  depuis 11 ans. Elle vend à toutes sortes de client qui s’approchent de son étalage. Elle achète les produits au marché local. Deux personnes l'aident dans l'exercice de son activité.
Thérèse a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter 100litres de palme, 04bidons d’huile d’arachide et 06sacs de haricots. 
Dans les prochaines années, Thérèse voudrait renforcer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer le bien-être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Thérèse is a 44-year-old woman. She is married to an architect and has six children.
Thérèse has worked as a retailer of beans for 11 years. She sells to all types of customers, who come to her stand located behind the Bè-Adido catholic church. She buys her products at the local market. Two people help her in running her business.
Thérèse has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy 100 litres of palm oil, four cans of peanut oil, and six bags of beans.
In the coming years, Thérèse would like to strengthen her business. She says that with her profits, she intends to ensure the well-being of her children.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, peanut oil, and beans.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимджон трудолюбивый молодой человек. Несколько лет он занимается услугами такси. Он женат, отец двоих детей. Он живет недалеко от столицы. Односельчане часто едут в город и он обслуживает их. Услуги таксиста приносят хорошие доходы. К зимнему периоду следует подготовить машину. Он хочет получить займ и отремонтировать машину, купить новые покрышки. Зимой люди чаще ездят на такси. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и благодарен вам.
texts.en: Olimjon is an industrious young man. He has been providing taxi services for several years. He is married and has two children. He lives near the capital. Villagers often go into town and he services them. Taxi driver service brings a good income. The car needs to be in good condition by the winter season. He wants to get a loan and repair the car and buy new tires. In the winter people usually travel by taxi. He looks forward to your support and is thankful.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Beatrxye

texts.en:
Beatrxye is a 57-year-old widow. Her husband passed away in 1980. Now Beatrxye is living with her parents, her children are all married and living at their own house. They are: Dody, 37; Maisye, 35; Yami, 33; and Diana, 30. 

Being widowed for years has given Beatrxye much worthwhile experience to survive. To make a living, Beatrxye sells a variety of cakes, banana crispy chips, fried corn, and pastries; she also provides a catering service. The income is used to add to her capital and for living expenses. 

Beatrxye is planning to improve her business and therefore she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Rupiah (IDR). She plans to buy four sacks of wheat flour, margarine, eggs, etc. to produce a greater variety of cakes and pastries as ordered by the customers for Christmas celebration.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of wheat flour, margarine, eggs, etc

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a fifty seven year old man from South Rift Valley in Kenya.  He is married to Mary, and together they have 6 children.  He is in the livestock trade business in his area. For the past ten years he has been selling cattle and goats. 

Samwel - who is the sole breadwinner in his family - is taking his first loan, which he will use to buy goats to sell in December, a month of many festivities. He intends to use the profits to diversify into farming. His hope is to grow and diversify his business and better support his family.

loans.use: To buy goats for sale.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
Ana Gabriela tiene 30 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad de la provincia de Guanacaste. La economía de la zona de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.

Desde hace varios años que Ana Gabriela se dedica a la venta de ropa para superarse cada día, pero anteriormente lo hacía con sus hermanas, ahora ha tomado la decisión de vender su propia ropa. Desde que  ingreso a este negocio los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad. 

En estos momentos lo que desea Ana Gabriela es solicitar un préstamo por ¢300,000(trescientos mil colones) para la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, para así invertir en inventario para poder vender, para  obtener  ganancia para incrementar su recursos económicos y de igual manera sacar a su hija de 8 años de edad adelante. 

Ana Gabriela es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Guaitil S.A,  razón por la cual se siente  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Gabriela, 30, lives with her family in a community in Guancaste province.  The economy of the Guancaste region is based mainly on animal husbandry, although in this region you also see beekeeping and aquaculture.

For a number of years, Ana Gabriela has been selling clothing in order to get by each day.  Previously, she worked with her sisters, but now she has made the decision to sell clothing on her own.  Ever since she entered into this business the results have been very good, since the business has been well received in her community.

At this time, Ana Gabriela is requesting a loan of 300,000 Costa Rican colones to buy clothing for women, men and children so that she will have inventory to sell.  This way she can increase her financial resources and provide for her 8 year-old daughter.

Ana Gabriela is a member of the communal bank of Guaitil S. A.  She feels very grateful for having the opportunity to access credit in this way, so that she can reach her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men, women and children to sell

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es:
Doña Gioconda sigue con su negocio de venta de tortillas, ropa, zapatos y cosmeticos, en donde por la mañana palmea tortillas y por la tarde comercializa ropa, el cual tiene muchos encargos, a si como el aumento de tortillas, su esposo sigue trabajando en productos de linea de belleza y sus hijos tambien trabajando.
Los prestamo que ha venido haciendo es con el fin, de crecer en venta, y de esta manera poder apoyar a su familia. comprara ropa de dama y varon, zapatos de portivos, zapatillas de varon, y una variedad de cosmetico, el cual son de buena calidad, y accesibles de precios. Obteniendo sastifaccion por su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Gioconda continues her business of selling tortillas, clothes, shoes and cosmetics. In the morning she pats out tortillas and in the afternoon she sells clothing, where she has many requests, and at the same time they ask for tortillas. Her husband continues working in the beauty product line and their children also are working.

The loan that she has come to ask for is aimed at growing her business and in this way she will be able to help her family. She will buy clothing for women and men, sports shoes, shoes for men, and a variety of cosmetics, which are of good quality and affordable prices. She is getting contentment through her small business.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of varied clothing such as sports shoes for men and cosmetics, in order to maintain her sales

loans.name: Doeurn

texts.en: Doeurn is 58 years old. He is married and resides with two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He is a motor taxi driver who earns about $7 per day. One of her children is employed in a restaurant and earns about $3 daily. Because of the present motorbike is old, Doeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for his motor taxi service. In the future, she would like to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for his taxi service

loans.name: Isabina

texts.en:
Isabina is 49 years old and lives in Trigos, Ozamiz City. She is married with five children. She is engaged in farming and she's been doing this for almost 20 years. She earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. She has requested a loan of 2,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

Isabina has been a member for PMPC for almost five years. She hopes that in the future our cooperative can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.en:
My name is Gumercinda and I cook food to sell to markets in the city. I have been doing this for severql years. I sell burritos from early hours in the morning and distribute them to various places throughout the city. I have loyal clients who cannot leave their posts and appreciate my delivery service of food and coffee. My business has given me the opportunity to support my family, especially to finance my children\'s education and to have them studying in good primary and high schools.

Loan Use: Purchase eggs, meat, tortillas, cheese, butter and other items.

Me llamo Gumercinda y me dedico a cocinar comida para vender en mercados de la ciudad, tengo varios años de hacer esta labor, yo vendo burritas desde tempranas horas de la mañana las reparto en varios puestos del mercado ya tengo mis clientes fijos ya que algunos de ellos no pueden moverse de sus puestos para comprar su alimento asi que aprovecho para entregarles su alimento y cafe. Este negocio me ha dado la oportunidad de mantener a mi familia, especialmente a apoyar a mis hijos para tenerlos estudiando en escuelas y colegios muy buenos.

loans.use: Compra de huevos, carne, tortillas, queso, mantequilla y otros.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer owns a shop and sells soaps, drinks, stationery, candles, soft drinks and other goods. She has a serious shortage of stock, and is seeking a loan of $800.00 so she can replenish the supply of goods in her shop and offer more to her customers.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina Ávila S. was born August 27, 1958 in the town of Tejar Chimaltenango. She is 48 years old and separated from her husband. She has four children, two who are married and two who are single. Presently she is dedicated to selling tortillas in her town. She is thankful to God for her profits and clients. She found a market for her tortillas by taking them to factories and cafeterias in Tejar and Chimaltenango. Her greatest desire is to continue struggling to support her children so that they can keep studying and someday become great professional workers. Her biggest dream is to have a food stand in the market. For this reason, she needs capital to invest and open another market. She needs 5,000 quetzals achieve her goal and move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Josefina Ávila S. nació el 27 de agosto de 1,958 en el municipio del Tejar Chimaltenango, tiene 48 años de edad, es una señora separada de su esposo tiene 4 hijos 2 casados y 2 solteros, actualmente se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su municipio. Ella está agradecida con Dios por sus ganancias y clientelas ya que tiene mercado donde entregar sus tortillas tales como en las fábricas y comedores de el Tejar y Chimaltenango su mejor anhelo es seguir luchando para apoyar a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando y que algún día sean buenos profesionales y trabajadores. Su mayor sueño es tener un comedor en el mercado, por lo tanto necesita capital para invertir mas y abrir mas mercado, ella necesita Q5,000.00 para poder superarse y salir adelante con su negocio

loans.use: Open a market for selling her corn tortillas

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
No, it's not a mistake! Simeona's last name is "D. L. C." from her father and her mother as well! (In Spanish tradition, one's use of last names includes the mother's last name in addition to the father's last name).

She has lived in this place for the past 5 years. She and her husband, who is a hired laborer in the collection of cocoa beans in local plantations, have had 5 children. They couldn't keep up with the cost of such a large family, and that's the reason why Simeona chose to put up this general store in her house which is practically "in the middle of nowhere". The area/community is called Serralles, and belongs to the Yamasa municipality, but it's located some 15 kilometers north of Yamasa, and it takes practically an hour to get to it. There are a lot of ravines with small brooks in this area of the country, as it rains practically on a daily basis. But that means that roads are mostly impassable so it takes a long time to get there, despite being relatively close to the neighboring town of Yamasa.

Simeona has a very small area and a low level of inventory to sell products. It occupies about half the length of her house. (It's not larger than what you can envision, proportioning the size of Simeona vs. the rest of the area you can see in the picture.) This can give you an idea of how poor this family is. But she is the only one in the general area where one can get supplies of foodstuff and other items of daily usage. She sells the equivalent of around 10 dollars worth of goods a day, but now plans to keep a much larger stock and sell over 3 times as much...all possible with the requested loan. She wouldn't say her profit margin, but that's not usually expected from a 'merchant'. However, it was generally evident that she will sell for about a 200% gross margin on sales.

Simeona is dreaming of being able to relocate, or at least be able to rebuild their house in cement blocks, as she feels the wood is not only a fire hazard, but also subject to all kinds attacks, not only from natural phenomena, but also from termites and other bugs. She should do well with her dreams.

loans.use: She needs to diversify, as well as bolster the stock of goods she sells, specially in the area of foods: rice, beans, cooking oil, pasta and eggs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 yeas old and married with four children. For the past four years she has operated a small, retail beverage business. She also collects used bottles for resale. This will be her first loan and she will use it to buy more stock.
 
Joyce lives in the Nsambya Village on the outskirts of Kampala. Her store is located where two paths join and her business offers an open area where her customers can sit and visit. This adds to their relaxation and enjoyment of their drink.

Joyce dreams of one day buying a boda-boda, motorbike, so that she can cut her distribution costs of receiving the sodas.

loans.use: To purchase sodas and beer

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat is 45 years old and married. She runs a small business in Spitamen selling fruits and plastic bags that she buys wholesale in the regional capital, Khujand. Her income is not large, but it covers her family's expenses. She has been a Microinvest customer for more than a year, and has always made good use of the money lent to her. She has applied for a loan to buy new items to sell to her customers, and thereby expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita has two children and is separated from their father. She had to take full responsibility for the children. She started a business sewing uniforms. It began when a neighbor of hers asked if she could make a couple of uniforms as a favor. The quality of her work was so good, and the price so fair, that the same neighbor began to promote her work amongst her friends. Little by little the requests for uniforms has grown.

Today Rita has a request for 20 uniforms which she can't meet because she lacks sufficient materials. She is requesting a loan, to be repaid in 3 months, so she can purchase the fabric and thread and other materials needed to meet the needs of her customers. With your help, Rita will be able to continue to grow her business and start selling her uniforms in greater quantities.

Rita está separada del padre de sus dos hijos. Es por eso que Rita se tiene que hacer responsable de sus hijos. Para poder obtener dinero Rita elabora uniformes. Todo comenzó porque una vecina de Rita le pidió de favor que le hiciera dos uniformes. Sin embargo el trabajo quedó tan bien y el precio era tan bueno que la propia vecina le comenzó a hacer promoción entre sus amigas y así poco a poco se le fue incrementando el pedido de uniformes.

Actualmente Rita tiene un pedido de 20 uniformes los cuales no a podido realizar por falta de material es por eso que Rita está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y así con este dinero poder comprar las telas y los materiales para poder elaborar los productos. Con tu ayuda Rita podrá sacar este pedido adelante, además de poder comenzar a vender sus uniformes por cantidades mayores.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE THE MATERIALS NEEDED TO MAKE THE UNIFORMS SHE SELLS.  HER CUSTOMERS ARE REQUESTING GREATER QUANTITIES AND SHE NEEDS MORE CAPITAL TO MEET THE GROWING DEMAND.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich S., age 29, works as a farmer growing rice, making $2 each day. Her husband works raising poultry earning $3.70 each day. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more fertilizer, seeds and gasoline to supply her cultivation and also purchase feed to breed her ducks.

loans.use: Pich would like to purchase more fertilizer, seeds and gasoline to supply her cultivation and feed to breed her ducks.

loans.name: Bulwa A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Linnda N.. She has a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase fryers and pans. Linda is 28 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 4 to 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Linda makes approximately UGX 120000 in profits and, she hopes to save the extra profits from her loa and pay school fees for the children. Linda has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to buy more plates and she paid the loan back on time.

Linda is joined in her small group by Maria N., Immaculate N., Grace K., and Resty N., Grace N.. Maria N. has a restaurant and wants to purchase charcoal stoves, tables and chairs. Immaculate N. sells fried snacks and wants a loan to purchase fryers, paper bags, and flour. Grace K. operates a restaurant and wants to purchase more furniture. Resty N. is a tailor and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth. Grace N. has a retail shop an intends to purchase a refrigerator and add to her assets.

loans.use: To buy fryers and pans for her restaurant and purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario started her office supplies store three years ago, when her husband was unemployed. During this time she had to cover the costs of providing a home and food for their three children, as well as pay school fees. Now Maria’s husband works as a chauffer, but she has grown her business and continues to work there.

Maria would like $250 to purchase general supplies, in order to provide a better variety of products for her clients. She will pay back the loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Rosario inicio su negocio una papeleria hace tres años cuando su esposo se quedo desempleado y ella tuvo que hacerle frente a los gastos de su casa y la manutención de sus tres hijos, ya que había que pagar las colegiaturas de la escuela. Actualmente el trabaja como chofer pero ella logro hacer crecer su negocio por lo que se dedica a esto.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía en general y contar con mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Kotiban Group

texts.en:
Bamba C. is 46 years old and is married with 6 children. She is the leader of the Kotiban group in the Koromasilaia village of Sierra Leone. The group has been working together to help individual members with their farms. The group has also started a rotating savings club, but they have very little money to invest in the club. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875) to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and for hiring labourers.

The Kotiban group members are dedicated to helping each other improve the quality of their agribusinesses as well as working together as a group to achieve their individual goals. They need a loan so that they can purchase all of the inputs necessary to have a successful planting and harvesting season.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and for hiring labourers

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin was born in 1962 in the town of Khachmaz. He is married and has two children.

Elchin has five years of experience in the house repair business. He is requesting a loan of $975 to buy the necessary materials to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary materials to improve business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 45 years old, single and lives in a small village near the town of Tyr in south Lebanon. Mahmoud is a contractor, and wants to get married soon. He needs $1,200 to finish building his own house, and has applied for his first loan Al Majmoua to make this possible.

loans.use: To finish building his own house

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mr. Yem Y., 37, is a fisherman in Tonle Sap Lake. He has been fishing since 1992 and typically earns around $4 per day. His wife sells the fish. Their children are young and in school. Because fishing is their main income, Y. must improve his equipment and expand his business to increase his family's income, so he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a fishing boat.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat to improve his business

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu, a 41-year-old widow with four children, has been a clothes seller since 2005.  Each day she works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales. Tatu is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of M. I. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi food. She has been living in this city for the last 20 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son has a wood-selling business. The next to him has a lathe workshop.

Razia baji's husband has a shutter business with an experience of 25 years. Razia baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (beams) for her husband's shutter business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Sonia baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones to re-sell. Alia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Saba baji wants a loan to buy vehicle wheels to re-sell. Fakhira baji wants a loan to buy old computers to repair and re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wooden beams for her family's shutter business

loans.name: Marisol, Delfina Y Olga Group

texts.es:
Marisol, Delfina y Olga son socias del Banco Comunal Alborada.

Marisol es madre soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Marisol tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, que se ubica en una calle céntrica y es alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con 2 empleadas.

Por otro lado Delfina es madre soltera, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Delfina viaja a los diferentes pueblos de la región en donde compra quesos, cereales que luego lo vende de casa en casa al crédito y contado.

Mientras que Olga es casada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Olga se dedica a la elaboración de panes variados, actividad que realiza en el horno de su mama, sus ventas lo realiza a las tiendas, además Olga tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Marisol, Delfina y Olga necesitan prestamos de 900 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles respectivamente dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas, quesos, cereales, harina. Los sueños de Marisol, Delfina y Olga son tener un taller mas grande en el centro de la ciudad, construir su casa, tener un horno propio y educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marisol, Delfina and Olga are partners in the Alborada community bank. Marisol is a 26 year old single mother with one son. She has a dress making shop which she rents on a main street where she employs two women.

Dlefina is a 49 year old single mother with three children. She travels to different areas in the region to purchase cheese and grain which she later sells door to door, for cash or credit.

Olga is a 32 year old woman with 4 children. She works baking different kinds of bread using her mother's oven. Her bread is sold in local stores, and in a small grocery story that Olga has in her home.

Marisol, Delfina and Olga are requesting loans of 900, 600, and 600 soles respectively which they will use to purchase cloth, cheese, grains, and flour. Their dreams are to have a larger shop, to build a house, to purchase an oven and provide their children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Marisol, Delfina and Olga are requesting loans of 900, 600, and 600 soles respectively which they will use to purchase cloth, cheese, grains, and flour.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia tiene 38 años de edad y 9 en la venta de pollos en un mercado cercano a su casa. En detrimento de su negocio va la actual coyuntura económica, pero no ha visto decaer sus ingresos, gracias a la calidad de los productos que adquiere de los mayoristas a primera hora diariamente. Al construirse un sitial reconocido por los clientes en el Mercado “27 de octubre”, logra ser el sostén económico en casa, donde vive con su esposo e hijo de 21 años. Pero sabe que nada le garantiza que el mañana sea así, por lo cual diseña sus estrategias para fortalecer su negocio y sabe que una de las aristas principales de éste es la inversión, el capital que uno pueda tener.

En aras de poder mantenerse como uno de los puestos líderes del mercado donde labora, requiere del préstamo de 2000 soles.
texts.en:
Mrs. Basilia is 38 years old and for 9 years she has been selling chickens in a market near her house. The current economic climate has been a detriment to her business, but she has not seen her income decline thanks to the quality of the products that she buys, from wholesalers in the early hours of the day, in order to build a spot recognizable by the clients in Market "October 27" and to act as the main source of income in the house where she lives with her husband and her 21-year-old son. But she knows that there are no guarantees that tomorrow will be the same. So she develops strategies to strengthen her business and she knows that one of the main ways is through investment. The money that one is able to have. In order to remain one of the leaders in the market where she works, she requires a loan of 2000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Estela Del Carmen

texts.es: L a señora Estela del Carmen Martínez Tienen la edad de 32 años habita en el municipio de Monimbo,  ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a su esposo y hijos; el esposo de la señora trabaja para compartir los gastos del hogar .Ella desde hace cuatro años se dedica a vender tortillas y también vende golosinas y gaseosas, para poder salir hacia delante con su familia ella entrega tortillas y vende en la misma casa , con su propios esfuerzos ha logrado mantener este negocio ya que la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento . Ella solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para poder incrementar más su negocio en las venta de tortillas, también comprar productos para incrementar su inventario y poder obtener mejor ganancia  y así darle un mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela del Carmen Martínez is 32 years old and lives in Monimbo in the city of Masaya with her husband and children. Her husband works to pay the shared household expenses. For the past four years, Estela has sold tortillas, confections and soft drinks to get her family ahead. She serves the tortillas and sells the other items from her home, and through her own efforts has been able to maintain her business. The main challenge she faces is a shortage of financial resources. She is seeking the help of Afodenic to increase her tortilla sales and stock more products, allowing her to earn a higher wage and give her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn to produce and sell tortillas

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is a rice farmer who lives in Kampongsvay Village in the Kampong Thom Province. She grows rice twice a year, during the rainy and dry seasons. She has been farming since 2000, while her husband, Mr. Tha is a veterinarian and works in the local area. N. has five children, two of whom are married staying with the family's home and three others are single. One son is employed as a driver in Phnom Penh City and one other runs a business of carpentry. 

Now, she would like to ask for a loan to pay for renting a tractor to plow the farmland for dry season and the remaining amount she plans to use for her daughter's business of carpentry.

loans.use: to pay for renting a tractor to plow farmland for dry season

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
“Luz y Esperanza” or Light and Hope is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their second loan from Esperanza International. The group’s past loan has been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a second loan for further business expansion. Germania is the coordinator for this group in Santiago.

Germania, mother of a ten-year-old child, dreams of converting her current beauty salon one day to a complete spa including a massage center. Germania has recently completed her past loan of 8,000 pesos (approximately $230) and is planning to utilize a second loan of 10,000 pesos (approximately $285) to expand her current infrastructure and purchase additional supplies, including shampoos. Germania is driven in her work and desires to continue to provide for her husband and child.

Other members of Germania’s bank run similar entrepreneurial operations including shoes, pillows, and clothing sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Expansion of current infrastructure and purchase of needed supplies

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun P. is a widowed and handicapped woman who lives with her daughter, son in-law, and niece. They live in Oyun's "ger" ( a ger is a traditional nomadic Mongolian home), on a plot of land owned by one of their relatives in Uvurhangay, a southern Mongolian province.

Oyun has a 500 sq. meter field that is located near the river Dairga in Uvurhangay province. She plants a variety of vegetables, such as potatoes, cabbage, and onions every summer and sells them in a rented indoor vegetable stall at the local food market in all four seasons. She grows plenty of vegetables, and after the harvest she rents an outdoor vegetable stall at the same market and hires someone to sell most of her harvest in bulk.

During the winter and spring, Oyun goes to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, once or twice a month to buy a variety of vegetables and other small food products, such as jelly, noodles, and ketchup, and sells them. Oyun's daughter helps in her mother's business. Oyun has a determined attitude. She is requesting this loan to buy more food products to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more food products

loans.name: Kaja Group

texts.en:
Mariam S., age 45, is married with three children ages 29, 27, and 12. She sells cloth. She started this business three years ago and works daily from 10am until 4pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 112.

This will be Mariam’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her capital and has repaid the loans successfully. She hopes for a third loan to increase her stock and buy fabrics and sarongs.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group, Kaja, which totals 17 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mariam is just behind the man with a striped T-shirt.

loans.use: To expand her business and sell fabrics and sarongs

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en:
Marinel is 32 years old and is residing in Allinguigan 3rd together with her husband George, who is a wood carver. They are blessed with three children: Lelina Mae - 9 years old; John Oliver - 7 years old (both  already in elementary level); and the youngest, Gia Marie - 4 years old. 

Marinel is a rice retailer in their village. To meet the growing needs of her family especially in sending their children to school, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 as additional capital for her rice retailing business. In this way, she can also help her husband in providing for their basic needs and also for the school allowance of their children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Husnidinkhon

texts.en:
A. Husnidinkhon has been in the photography business for three years. He is married and has two children. He has a secondary technical education and was trained as an engineer. Since the local factories are closed, Husnidinkhon started a photography business in order to support his family. Now he has many clients, but in order to stay abreast of the competition, he needs to keep his photo equipment up to date. Husnidinkhon wants a loan to buy new equipment, which will improve the quality of the photo services he provides. This will allow him to better provide for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new equipment

loans.name: Shah Raman Group

texts.en: Shah R. is the leader of the Shah R. group, which has four members. Each member wants a loan to improve their business. Shah R. wants a loan for his car part shop. G. Bashar wants a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver. Madeni wants a loan for her husband who has a general store; he wants to expand his business and  attract more clients. Uma wants a loan for her tailoring business. They are requesting a group of loan of 40000 Afghani for a term of 8 months. They say that Kiva is best because it can support all the world.

loans.use: for expanding businesses

loans.name: Leili

texts.es:
LEILI M. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS FLORES”, vive en el Asentamiento Humano BEATRIZ BARDALES Mz.B. Lt.10. del distrito de YARINACOCHA, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad.

Se inicio vendiendo pescado en las calles con la ayuda de un triciclo.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, esto fue hace 3 años, con dicho dinero compró pescado para vender y afianzó su negocio, pero por algunos inconvenientes, dejó por un tiempo el negocio y hoy se encuentra vendiendo abarrotes y prendas de vestir a domicilio, esto lo hace con la ayuda de una moto que tiene para movilizarse. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de más ropas y abarrotes, y parte del dinero lo utilizará para dar mantenimiento a su movilidad (moto).

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, gracias a ello puede ayudar a sus hijos y en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Leili M. M. belongs to “The Flowers” cooperative bank. She lives in the Yarinacocha district, is 36 years old, and has 4 children, 2 of whom are now grown. She started out selling seafood in the street using a tricycle. Her first loan of 300.00 soles was 3 years ago, and she used the funds to buy fish and to strengthen her business. Due to a few inconveniences, she left the enterprise for a time and today finds herself selling groceries and clothing door-to-door. She does this with the help of a motorcycle she uses for transportation. With this loan of 2,000.00 soles she will invest in the purchase of more clothing and groceries. Part of the funds will also be used to maintain her mode of transportation (motorcycle). In the small amount of time she has been with Manuela Ramos, she feels glad for the help given to women so they can try to get ahead. Thanks to this support, she can help her children and take care of the finances of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.  To buy groceries.  To repair her motorcyle.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David C. is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old and is single. David owns and operates a business raising crops. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, David joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to raise additional crops. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To raise additional crops

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, junto a su esposo y a sus hijos, cultiva principalmente la papa, pero cuando es época de la cosecha también vende el maíz seco para transportarlo a la ciudad capital de su país. Para la selección de sus productos contrata los servicios de varias señoras que realizan el arduo trabajo durante todo el día. Los productos que ella vende son muy bien cotizados, lo que anima más a Esther a continuar con esta actividad, la cual le permite solventar sus gastos familiares. Ahora quiere acrecentar su producción, porque en la actualidad cuando tiene más demanda y no tiene productos en sus cosechas compra de sus vecinos para complacer a sus clientes. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy satisfecha de pertenecer a su banco comunal, puesto que le permite socializar con los demás integrantes y compartir ideas de progreso. Con el dinero que está solicitando abastecerá a sus clientes comprando mayor cantidad de maíz de colores.
texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and children in her own home. For twenty years she has worked in agriculture with her husband and children. They mainly grow potatoes, but when it is harvest season they sell dried corn that they take to the capital city of their country. For a greater selection of product, they hire the services of several women who work hard in the fields every day. The products that she sells are in demand. Esther would like to continue this activity that allows her to provide for her family. Now she would like to increase her production because when there is a lot of demand and she can’t grow enough products to meet this demand, she needs to buy from her neighbors in order to please her customers. This is the third time that she has received a loan from MFP and she is very glad to belong to this communal bank in as much as it permits her to socialize with the other members and exchange progressive ideas. With the money that she has requested she will please her customers by buying more multicolored corn.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Косимова Мунира 1975 года рождения, имеет одного ребенка. 9лет торгует на рынке «Джума-базар» и Матчинский район. Она торгует мужской одеждой. Мунира товар закупает на оптовом рынке г. Истаравшан. Муж мастер строительных работ. Свободное время помогает жене в бизнесе. Мунира хочет увеличить свой товарооборот и ассортимент в школьный сезон. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить сорочки и брюки подросткового возраста.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Munira K. was born in 1975, she has one child. She has been selling on the Djuma-bazar market and in the Matchinskiy region for nine years. She sells men's clothing. Munira buys the merchandise on the wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Her husband is a construction worker. He helps his wife with the business in his free time. Munira wants to increase her inventory turnover and the assortment for school season. She wants to use the requested loan to buy shirts and pants for teenagers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts and pants

loans.name: Rours

texts.en:
Mrs. Rours H. lives in Por Pel Kae village in Kandal province. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Veng Cham Roeun, is a construction worker. He is shown on the right in the photo. This couple has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

Mrs. Rours H. is requesting a loan to build a house for her family in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To build a house for her family

loans.name: Koegan

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a entamé en 1999 le commerce de boissons alcoolisées appelées « Sodabi », dans son quartier il est le seul à exercer ce commerce ce qui lui permet  de réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices, étant marié et père de 04 enfants, c’est avec cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille. Il veut associer à son commerce la vente de produits de brasserie. Il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 bidons de sodabi, 20 casiers de produits de la brasserie.
texts.en:
In 1999, this gentleman began a business selling an alcoholic drink called "sodabi" in his district.  He is the only one in this business.  This allows him to make a large profit.  Being married and father of four children, this business is how he provides for his family.  He wants to include with his business the sale of pub drinks.  He's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 15 drums of sodabi and 20 cases of pub products. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita C., the 41-year-old mother of five children, is a food vendor. Her eldest is just 16 and all of them are studying in school. She is a widow. She dreams of growing her livelihood more to help support the education of her children.

Juanita would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy additional ingredients for food that she cooks and sells. The income she makes from selling food helps a lot in covering the daily expenses in their home.

Juanita joined CEVI’s micro-credit program in 2007. She said she likes its services because it has only a 2% interest rate which is lower and more affordable to repay.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ruwa

texts.en:
Ruwa K. is a resident of Thikedewal. She and her husband, Mr. Lal Bahadur K., are engaged in selling green vegetables. They buy the vegetables from Kalimati market and sell them daily in the local market in the morning and evening. They fulfill all the requirement of their family with the income from selling vegetables.

Ruwa K. and her husband have three children: two daughters and one son. Their daughters are studying in grade 5 and 4 and their son is studying in grade 1.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie C. is from the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 38 years old. She is separated from her spouse and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Analie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products in the local community. Analie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Analie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion I. is 36 years old and the loving mother of five children ranging in age from from four to 11.  She is a member of ASHI, a KIVA field partner. She requests a loan to overcome the financial shortage that hinders the growth of her business.   Salvacion dreams of improving her family's lifestyle and sending her children to college. Salvacion’s husband is a fisherman but his income is low and sporadic.  A loan will help her reach her goals.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for fishing business and buy piglets and materials for a pig pen.

loans.name: Hold Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Meet Members of the Hold Sorbeh Group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city who have come to SMT/Kiva to seek their very first loan. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them expand their businesses.

Fatmata M. (right) is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in Lunsar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty years old. She is married to a businessman and they have three children. Two of Fatmata’s children are attending primary school – one is in class IV, the other is in class V and the last is not of school-going age.  Fatmata sells “rice cakes” (bread made from rice) and has been in this business for four years now. Fatmata will use her share of the loan to buy rice, oil and other ingredients to make more rice-cakes.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make more rice-cakes to sell

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teresa H. tiene su propio tramo de ropa en el mercado Central de Chinandega donde ofrece todo tipo de ropa y en especial ropa para niños la que es comercializada a diario desde termpranas horas de la mañana.
Su negocio lo inició desde hace quince años y ella siempre se ha mantenido con una alegre sonrisa por lo que esto le ha ayudado mucho a desarrollarse en su negocio. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de la ropa para continuar comercializándola en su tramo y así generar las utilidades para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Teresa H. sells clothing in the Chinandega central market. She has all kinds of clothing but specializes in children's clothes. She tends her stall every day from very early in the morning. She began her work 15 years ago and she always has a cheerful smile to offer which has helped greatly in developing her business. The financing she requests is to buy clothing to stock her inventory so that she can continue to produce profits which support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: P. Jeanne est née le 13 Mai 1956. Jeanne vit depuis 20 ans environs au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jeanne est une veuve ayant à sa charge 6 enfants dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Jeanne vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille.
