Jeanne a fréquenté jusqu'au secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Jeanne vend divers articles (biscuits, riz, conserves, pure water, huile végétale, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Jeanne fait ses achats. Jeanne a déjà 20 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine, et est à son quatrième crédit à ALIDé. Jeanne a bien remboursé les trois crédits qu'elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. En vue d'agrandir davantage son activité pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle, Jeanne sollicite ce quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jeanne P. was born on 13 May 1956. For around 20 years, Jeanne has lived in the Cadjèhoun area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Jeanne is a widow with 6 children in her care, four of whom are her own. All of her children are in school. Jeanne lives alone with her children and provides for the family by herself. Jeanne attended school up to the secondary level. To meet her different expenses, Jeanne sells various items (biscuits, rice, canned goods, pure water, vegetable oil, etc.) at her home. It is in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, that Jeanne makes her purchases. Jeanne already has 20 years of experience in this field, and is on her fourth loan with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). Jeanne properly repaid the three previous loans that she obtained through ALIDÉ. With the goal of further enlarging her business to better respond to the demands of her clientele, Jeanne is seeking this fourth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of biscuits, canned goods, bags of rice, and cans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal Minka.
Domitila es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Domitila vende comida de manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica, además viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, quesos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Domitila necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Domitila son tener un capital propio.
texts.en:
Domitila is a member of the Community Bank Minka. Domitila lives with her partner; she is 38 years old and has two children. Domitila sells food as a street vendor in a major street; additionally, she travels to various regional fairs where she buys cereals and cheeses that she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Domitila needs a loan of 600 soles which will be invested in buying rice and sugar. Domitila’s dream is to have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es: Doña Johana tiene 43 años de edad,  casada, y con cuatro hijos que procreo, junto a su esposo han forjado una casa para su familia aunque a un  falta mucho por reparar ya que una parte de su casa aun es de madera y insegura, hay que repellar las paredes que están  y poner piso ya que es de suelo.  Su negocio es la venta de ropa que durantes años se ha dedicado a la ventas, el cual inicio con apoyo de su esposo, producto de su trabajo, de conductor, el cual gana poco pero han sobresalido, sus venta de ropa las da al contado y al crédito por gracias Adios tiene muchos clientes y la variedad que ha venido vendiendo ha mejorado sus ventas. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en uniforme, calcetas, camisolines, zapatos. Ya que comienza el año escolar y muchos padre no tienen para comprar en efectivo el cual se les da para pago de de quincena, el cual espera obtener buenas venta y poder ahorrar para hacer las mejoras a su pequeña vivienda. Agradece a la institución por hacer posible su venta y la mejoría de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Johana is 43 years old. She is married and has four kids. Together, her and her husband have made a house for their family, although there is a lot of repair work to do as one part of it is still made of wood and is very unstable; they have to reinforce the walls that are already there and put flooring down on the ground. Her business is selling clothes and she has been in sales for a long time. She started this business with the support of her husband as through his work as a driver he does not earn very much. Her clothes' sales give them cash and credit as, thankfully, she has a lot of clients and the variety of clients has meant that her sales have improved. With this loan she wants to invest in uniforms, knitted socks, camisoles and shoes as the school year is starting and many parents do not have enough money to buy in cash so she will sell to them and charge every fortnight. She hopes this will bring her good sales and allow her to save in order to make some home improvements. She is very grateful to the bank for making her sales and house improvements possible.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy uniforms, socks, shirts and shoes to take advantage of the time of year as schools are going back/Comprar ropa de uniformes, calcetas, camisolines y zapatos para aprovechar la temporada de regreso a clase.

loans.name: Marie Joseph

texts.fr: Marie Joseph D., 40 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte ANNE1 depuis 5 ans et a été 10 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle développe d'une part une activité d'élevage de poulets et d'autre part la vente de tissus. Elle participe au bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Joseph D. is a married, 40 year-old woman with three children. She has been a member of the Sainte ANNE1 Village Bank for the past five years and has been able to repay 10 consecutive loans. She has two business activities: raising chickens and selling fabrics. She contributes to the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her business activities

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: Este cliente es un ganadero de la zona de el viejo este sr cuenta con 30 años  de experiencia en el rubro ganadero  es casado y padre de 4 hijos y con mucho esfuerzo ha venido saliendo adelante el crédito lo utilizara para comprar ganado de desarrollo y aumentar su hato ganadero
texts.en:
Luis Humberto J. is a livestock breeder in Chinandega El Viejo, Nicaragua. He has 30 years experience in the field of livestock ranching. He is married and the father of four children. He has exerted much effort in order to gradually get ahead in his business. The requested loan would be used to purchase livestock to develop and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Lateef

texts.en: Lateef is a hard working, responsible and affectionate man. He is married with 10 children. The eldest child is 40 years old. His children are excelling in business and school. Lateef is 6o years old and he is a grandfather. This gives him joy and he says that he is a fulfilled man to see his grandchildren. He sells planks to make a living. He has been in this business for a long time and he uses his experience in business to attract and retain more customers. He hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of motor oil

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es: La señora Amanda vive en el barrio Villa Austria, de edad de 49 años, durante   su trayectoria de vida ha logrado formar una bonita familia de cuatro hijos de los cuales tres trabajan, y el menor estudia medicina, su esposo se fue de la casa, pero eso no ha sido motivo para seguir motivada ya que tiene el apoyo de sus hijos económicamente y moral, anteriormente trabajaba en tapicería, pero luego renuncio y comienza a comprar ropa nueva para dama, también se afilio en la Avon y vende una variedad de productos en crema, perfumenes, pinturas, vanidades, faciales para el cutis y otros. Vende al contado y al crédito de quincena. Su meta es poder comprar vitrina y poder exhibir sus productos como lograr captar clientes. Con esta inversión lograra comprar ropa ya que tiene poca y tiene unos encargos que comprar. A futuro desea mejorar la infraestructura de su casa ya que las divisiones aun no son de concreto para una mejor seguridad. Como madre desea seguir apoyando a sus hijos, y crecer en su negocio
texts.en:
Amanda lives in the suburb of Villa Austria. She is 49 years old and over the course of her life she has managed to raise a beautiful family of four children - three who work and the youngest who is studying medicine. Her husband left home, but this has not been the reason to keep motivated since she has the support of her children economically and morally. She used to work in upholstery, but then she resigned and started to buy new clothes for women. She is also an Avon representative and sells a variety of products such as creams, perfumes, makeup, beauty products, facials and other things. She sells for cash and two-week credit. Her goal is to be able to buy a display cabinet so that she can display her products and keep winning customers. With this investment she will buy clothes as she does not have many and she has some orders to buy. In the future she would like to improve the structure of her home for better security since the walls are not even made of concrete. As a mother she wants to keep supporting her children, and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Soth's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Soth S. is from Preak Ta Choar village in the Kandal province. He is 62 years old and the leader of this group loan, which consists of four members. Each member of the group will use the loan to support a different business. Mr. Soth S. and his wife are laborers. With their jobs, they can receive a small salary to support their family.

Mr. Soth S. is requesting a loan to build a cow stable for cow breeding. This couple has three children; one is a laborer while the other two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To build a cow stable

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Bineta S. née en 1982 est vendeuse de céréales au marché khelcom de Thiès. C'est avec l'aide de sa maman qu'elle a ouvert une cantine au marché depuis le 05 Janvier 2009. Elle y vend des produits céréaliers du genre mil, maïs, sorgho, niébé et des aliments de bétail. Elle est à sa deuxième demande de crédit et sollicite pour cette fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour dit-elle renforcer son activité de commerce
texts.en:
Ms. Bineta S., born in 1982, is a retailer of grains at the Khelcom market of Thiès.  With her mother's help, she opened a stall at the market on January 5, 2009.  There, she sells these kinds of grain:  millet, corn, sorghum, black-eyed peas, and animal fodder.  She is on her second loan request, and this time she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs CFA.  She says this is for bolstering her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of a variety of foodstuffs

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat C. is 26 years old and her husband, Mr. Neanghuy Sreng (they are pictured together), is 35 years old. They have been married since 2007 and just have one young son. They live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophat and her husband have been farming since they married. They grow vegetables on their farmland in the village.

Sophat does not have her own motorcycle for commuting; she spends a lot of money for traveling costs very often. Therefore, she is applying for her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Adriana Cecilia

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la foto es la madre de Adriana Cecilia.

La señora Adriana Cecilia vive en un ejido cerca de la ciudad, por lo que ella para ir trabajar se traslada a su trabajo en la ciudad todo los día para cubrir los gastos de su casa. Su mamá se queda al cuidado de sus tres nietos para apoyarla con el cuidado de ellos y así brindarles seguridad. Cecilia solicita a esta institución un préstamo para poder impermeabilizar su vivienda ya que en temporada de lluvia el agua se trasmina y el techo se va dañando poco a poco.
texts.en:
The person appearing in this photo is Adriana Cecilia's mother. Adriana Cecilia lives in a cooperative near the city, and so she travels to work in the city every day to cover her household costs. Her mother takes care of Adriana's three children to help Adriana and to provide them with security. She is requesting this loan to waterproof her home since during the rainy season the water leaks in and the roof is slowly becoming damaged.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproofing

loans.name: Félix Juan

texts.es:
Félix es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Yencala Boggiano, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, zona que tiene un moderado movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría aves de corral y animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan con frecuencia la zona. Esta actividad le provee de una fuente estable de ingresos con los cuales saca adelante a su joven familia. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero agrícola.

Félix desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado de modo que puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Félix es un padre bastante trabajador y que siempre vela por el desarrollo y bienestar de los suyos, su sueño es tener un terreno de cultivo con el cual percibir ingresos permanentes.
texts.en:
Felix is a 23 year-old father who lives with his wife and their children in the Yencala Boggiano neighborhood, a rural area in the Lambayeque district. This area has a moderate level of commerce, and belongs to the province of the same name. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For 4 years he has been raising and selling animals. He raises barnyard fowl and small animals at the back of his house. When they have reached an adequate level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who visit his area frequently. This activity provides him with a stable source of income, with which he can provide for his young family. He also works as a farmhand. Felix wants to improve the raising of his animals by acquiring nutritionally balanced feed, so he can get a better price for them. To achieve this objective he has seen the need to request, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles. Felix is a hardworking father who always ensures that his family members have what they need for their development and well-being. His dream is to have land to cultivate so that he could have permanently higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed so that he can improve his business of raising small animals for sale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A. is from the village of Wao Lanao del Sur. She is 54 years old. Rosita is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en: Victoriana A. is from the town of Trento. She is 61 years old. Victoriana is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Victoriana raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Victoriana has been engaged in her business for over 20 years. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale. She says she wants to acquire more piglets to raise. Victoriana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoriana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Victoriana is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and livestock feed. This will be the second loan taken out by Victoriana from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster-group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and livestock feed

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 47 years old, married with two children.  Seraphine makes a living by selling foodstuffs like bananas, sorghum, beans, etc.  She has been in this business for about 10 years and the hours of her business are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

 After realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, Seraphine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  By using this loan, Seraphine hopes that her sales as well as profits will increase.  If successful, she will use one portion of her profits in taking care of her family and another portion will be saved for a better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: A large quantity  of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Clemensia

texts.en:
Clemensia S. is a married woman who lives in, Brgy.Tagbino, Vallehermoso, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two businesses:  a carinderia or eatery and a Videoke store. Her husband, Benjamin S. Jr., who is 49 years old, is a farmer. They have children who are between five and 20 years old. Clemensia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Clemensia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 16000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8000 PHP, rising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing 18000 PHP for more buy supplies for her eatery so she can continue to save up for the education of her children. Clemensia S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies for her eatery

loans.name: Ingris Francisca

texts.es:
la joven Ingris Francisca H. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la colonia El Centro en la ciudad de Choluteca, Ingris se dedica a la venta de mariscos en el mercado de su comunidad, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para ir a comprar los mariscos que vende diario.
Ingris es soltera vive con su mama y su hermana,  no tiene hijos.
su tiempo libre se lo dedica a su madre y tambien asiste a la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mariscos y asi tener mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Ingris Francisca H. is 22 years old. She lives in downtown Choluteca. Ingris sells sea food in her community's market. Every day she gets up at 4 in the morning to go buy the sea food that she sells every day. Ingris is single and lives with her mother and her sister. She has no children. She spends her free time with her mother and she also helps at church. She will use the loan to buy more seafood and have increased sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and seafood.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S., 39 years old, owns a small shop located inside the market where she sells fish and chicken. She tries to generate a specific profit in order to ensure that her family has their basic living needs met. She is married to Samoeung, 36, who assists her in the fish business, and they have three children. 

San S. is managing her trade smoothly because she has natural skill in how to attract customers. However, she can make only a small profit as her business is reaching a low point due to insufficient financial capital. She will use the loan she requested to increase her working capital, which will sustain her business grown.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Pum

texts.en:
Mrs. Pum S. sells frying pans and stoves. She is 36 and is a single mother who cares for one child who is a pupil in the local public school. Mrs. Pum S.’s husband passed away many years ago. Since 2000, Mrs. Pum S. has sold her items around her village by motorcycle. She also orders products in bulk from retail door-to-door across the province. Mrs. Pum S. always takes a few weeks to sell their products.

Mrs. Pum S.'s business is now running very well because she sells her items at a reasonable price. Currently, her existing motorbike often breaks down during operation. Because of that, Mrs. Pum S. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva, which she will use to repair her broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair her broken motorcycle used to sell her products.

loans.name: Indaura Ismelda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Indaura ella tiene 56 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre que según ella es más que un matrimonio y del que ha tenido 8 hijos, 5 de sus hijos son mayores, con ella vive una hija de 21 años y el menor  de 16 años ambos estudian en un colegio a distancia en Manta. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella vende cosas de bazar en su casa, tiene un pequeño local donde sus clientes llegan a comprar las cosas que necesiten, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta la noche ya que como su negocio está en su casa ella atiende a sus clientes a la hora que deseen. Además su marido vende frutas y legumbres en la ciudad de Manta, el trabaja tres días a la semana recorre con sus productos en un triciclo por las calles en Manta.los productos tanto para el bazar como las frutas y legumbres las compran en Portoviejo.

Este crédito la mitad es para el negocio de ella y la otra parte para el negocio de su esposo. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya 18 ciclos y le gusta por las facilidades y los beneficios que brinda la institución. Sus sueños son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in Sequita Parrish, which belongs to Montecristi in the prosperous Manabita Canton.  The area is full of hardworking and dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  Sequita is a Parrish whose inhabitants are honest people who primarily work and take care of their families.

It is here that we find Señora Indaura.  She is 56 years old and is in a common-law marriage, which according to her is more than a marriage and from which she has had 8 children.  Five of her children are grown.  Her 21 year-old daughter and her youngest child, who is 16 years old, live with her and study at a school in Manta. Her husband is a merchant.

Señora Indaura sells a variety of items from her home.  She has a small shop where her customers come to purchase whatever they may need.  She works every day from 8am until nighttime.  Since her business is run out of her home, she can help people at whatever hour they choose to come.  In addition to this business, her husband sells fruits and vegetables in Manta.  He works three days a week traveling through the streets of Manta with his produce on a three-wheeled cycle.  They purchase the shop items as well as the fruits and vegetables in Portoviejo.

Half of this loan is for Señora Indaura's business, and the other half is for her husband's business.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 18 cycles, and she likes the payment terms and benefits that the institution offers.  Her dream is that her children complete their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase items for a small shop, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jafarkhon

texts.ru: Сафаров Чафархон проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Чафархон имеет среднее образование. Более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Создал все условия для расширения своего бизнеса. Он берет кредит с льготным периодом. Цель кредита является закуп крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Jafarkhon S. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 40 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. Jafarkhon has secondary education. He has been doing animal husbandry for more than eight years. He breeds large cattle at home. He mainly breeds the cattle for resale. He created all the conditions for expansion of his business. He is taking out the loan with a grace period. The purpose of the loan is to buy large cattle.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: C4590 Abizerwa Group

texts.en:
Marianne is 46 years old and is married with three children who are 7, 10 and 12 years old. She is the president of a group called “Abizerwa” and this group is commonly known for selling vegetables. This is their third successful year in this business, which they operate from 5 am to 6.30 pm every day.

Marianne and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing the quantity of vegetables they sell at the market. With this expansion, this group really hopes their profits will increase. In addition, each member of the group will start saving and be able to satisfy the basic needs of their family.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of vegetables

loans.name: Munojotkhon

texts.ru: Тагаева Муночотхон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж находится в России. Сама Муночотхон более семи лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном продает одежду и разную мелочь. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента, то есть она хочет закупить сезонный товар.
texts.en: Munojotkhon T. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 37 years old, married, has five children. Her husband is working in Russia.  Munojotkhon has been working in sales for more than seven years. She principally sells clothes and different odds and ends.  She is taking out a loan to increase the variety of her inventory by buying seasonal goods.

loans.use: Increasing inventory

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard D. is from the town of Banga. He is 32 years old, married and has a 5-year-old child. Gerard owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gerard works hard to provide for the increasing needs of his household.

Gerard joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gerard is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeung R. is a villager who lives in Tuol Krang village in Kandal province.  She is 57 years old, and a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to cultivate spring onion for a living.  With this farm she faces a problem with insufficient money to start up her spring onion. She would like to ask for a loan to buy spring onions for planting. Her husband, Mr. Chhoch Chhum, is a house builder and he earns a small income to support his family. 

This couple has two childR. who are seamstresses in the garment factory. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy spring onions for planting.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en: This is 42 year-old Mbalu. She is married and has three children aged 18, 15 and 4. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she assists with her schooling. In 1998, Mbalu established her baby clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to be self reliant. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 2,028,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy additional baby items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 405,600. In the future, Mbalu plans to educate her children and to have a house of her own. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional baby items

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Esther; ella tiene 51 años D. edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio D. venta D. ropa para damas, caballeros y niños ella venD. polos,chompas,pantalones,camisas entre otros más ,la socia venD. todas las mañanas en las ferias dominicales del distrito D. San Sebastián, esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento ya que los demás días se dedica a su casa y ayudarle a su hija mayor en la crianza D. su hija la cual sale en la foto, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Esther belongs to the Communal Bank “Union Fuerza Y Amistad” (Union, Strength, and Friendship), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 51 years old, married, and has two children. Esther has a business selling clothes for women, men, and children. She sells polo shirts, sweaters, trousers, shirts, and many other items. Esther sells at the Sunday fairs in the District of San Sebastián. This is her only business activity at the moment since she dedicates the rest of the week to her household activities and helping her eldest daughter raise her granddaughter (who appears in the photo with her). Esther is a cheerful person who has tremendous desire to succeed. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

Esther is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene 9 hijos.  Tomasa no cuenta con estudios.
Hace poco que empezó a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a  la crianza de trucha (pes), ella requiere de un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que le permitirá comprar productos alimenticios para la alimentación de la trucha.
 Su sueño es comprar un terreno en Ilave y tener un puesto fijo para realizar la venta de trucha en mayores cantidades.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
  En la foto la vemos hilando, es un actividad común en las mujeres de Puno, pero no es su actividad principal.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” communal bank which is located in Juli district, Chucuito-Juli province, Puno department.  She is 55 years old, married and has 9 children.  She did not go to school.

She started collaborating with Manuela Ramos Movement a short time ago.  She raises trout (fish) and needs a 500 new sol loan to buy feed for them.

Her dream is to buy a piece of property in Ilave and have a fixed stand to sell trout in larger amounts.

What she likes about the communal bank is the savings.

In the photo she appears spinning yarn, a common activity of Puno women, but that’s not her main activity.

loans.use: To buy trout feed.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan Pablo es técnico en ensamblaje de computadoras, el crédito lo necesita para comprar una Pc ya que son herramientas de trabajo que utiliza para realizar con mayor eficiencia su trabajo. Vive  en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero  no tiene  hijos. El  señor esta satisfecho y muy contento con los préstamos que se le otorgaron, pues es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Pablo is a computer assembly technician. He needs a loan to buy a personal computer for work so that he can perform his job more efficiently. Juan Pablo lives in the home of his parents located in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

Sr. Juan Pablo is happy and content with the loans that have been provided. He has been a client of IMPRO since 2007.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for work.

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer is a resident of Borewala, which is a small city of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in Habib colony, where she has been living with her family in a 2 room brick house for the past 15 years. 

Anwer sews dresses at her home for her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month.  Her husband’s name is T. M., and he has a construction supply business. He provides his services to different construction companies and individuals who come to buy construction supplies from him. Anwer has two daughters and a son. Her daughters are studying, while her son has a business of welding. 

Anwer has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to buy another welding machine for her son’s business. This will help him do his work more effectively and provide better quality services to his clients. He will be able to hire an assistant who will help him in completing his work.   He has been doing this business for the past 14 years, and Anwer hopes that a loan will help him further improve his business.

Note: "In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Anwer".

loans.use: to buy another welding machine for welding business

loans.name: Muok

texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Muok S. who earns a living by raising pigs.

Muok S. is a mother who earns her daily revenue by working as a local farmer in the village, raising pigs. In addition, she also assists her husband to cultivate a rice crop. 

Muok S. has given birth to five children. Two are married and live separately and the other three are still single. 

Muok S. has always been successful in her pig-raising investment because she has knowledge of this sector from years ago. 

To earn additional income, Muok S. is applying for a loan to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: to buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: PauL. es madre D. casa D. 43 años D. edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y 2 hijos en el caserio Los Riojas ubicado a 25 minutos  D. L. ciudad D. Túcume. Su comunidad es rural y pequeña con un aproximado D. 100 familias. Se gana L. vida desD. hace 10  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio. Suele criar ganado porcino(lechones), ovino y pavos y patos. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan L. zona en donD. vive. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Aprendió esta actividad D. sus padres, es decir conoce a L. perfección el rubro. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales D. su producción y venta D. chicha, una bebida típica D. Perú hecha D. harina D. maíz. PauL. solicita un crédito para invertir en L. compra D. aves menores para engorD. y alimento balanceado para las aves. También desea realizar algunos arreglos en el interior D. su domicilio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, PauL. podrá aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia.
texts.en: PauL. is a 47-year-old housewife. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. It is located in the Los Riojas neighborhood, which is about 25 minutes from Túcume City. She lives in a small, rural community of about 100 families. Since she was ten years old she has been earning a living raising and selling young animals, which are situated in a pen behind her house. She raises pigs (piglets), sheep and ducks. When the animals have grown to a sufficient size, she sells them to a buyer that always visits the area where she lives. This business relies on competence and also on the fact that there is a good market for her product. With additional income she will make and sell chicha, a typical drink of Perú maD. from corn flour. PauL. is asking for this loan in order to buy young birds in order to fatten them up and also to buy balanced food for the birds. She also would like to fix some things insiD. her house. For these needs she is asking for a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With this influx of funds, PauL. will be able to grow her earnings and help her husband with the economic support of their family.

loans.use: to buy more young birds in order to fatten them up and to buy balanced food for the birds.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 57 años, vive en casa de su hija mayor con ella, su esposo y sus nietos. Hace más de 5 años trabaja junto a su hija en el restaurante en que ambas son socias, y aunque no tiene a quien mantener, sus ganas de vivir y ayudar a sus nietos hacen que a diario se levante muy temprano para realizar las compras y preparar la comida. Ella cocina  diversos platillos durante las mañanas, su buena sazón ha hecho que le genera las ganancias suficientes para mantener a su familia y colaborar con los gastos y darse su gusto. Como es una dama muy emprendedora tiene planeado para el futuro seguir en el negocio de cocina, por ello su deseo es mejorar en la preparación de sus platillos y lo conseguirá cuando se capacite como chef. Es su crédito número 7 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para renovar sus cubiertos y ollas a presión y una nueva licuadora.
texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and lives in her oldest daughter’s house with her, her husband and her grandchildren.  She’s worked in partnership with her daughter in a restaurant they have for over five years.  Although she doesn’t have anyone to support, her desire to live and help her grandchildren motivates her to rise early every day to do the shopping and prepare the food.  She cooks various dishes in the morning.  Her tasty preparation insures sufficient profits to support her family and collaborate with expenses and treat herself.

Because she’s a very enterprising lady she plans in the future to continue in the cooking business so her wish is to improve her dishes, something she’ll do when she becomes accomplished as a chef.

This is her seventh loan with MFP.   She is happy to know that she can count on financial support because she’s always been responsible with her payments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive people.  She thanks all those who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business.  She will use the requested loan to renew her utensils and her pressure cooker and for a new blender.

loans.use: to buy utensils, a pressure cooker and a blender.

loans.name: Fatmata's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the RC Hanga, situated in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in September 1970 by the Catholic Mission. RC Hanga school is staffed with 22 able teachers and has an enrollment of 810 pupils.  

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Fatmata, 44 years old, is the leader of this group of teachers. She was born in Bunumbu and has been in the teaching profession for 25 years. Fatmata is married and has 2 children – one in primary school and one in secondary school. Fatmata has requested a loan of SLL 2,000,000 for developmental purposes. She would like to buy house building materials such as bags of cement for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials to construct a house

loans.name: Edisson Rolando

texts.es:
Edisson Rolando tiene 29 años, vive en Union Libre vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Edisson se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz desde hace 10 años, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es las enfermedades y la variación del clima. Su sueño es tener dinero para arreglar la casa.

Le gusta salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Edisson Rolando is 29 years old.  He's in a common law relationship and lives with his wife and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “La Unión” (Unity) communal bank is located in Aguas Frías de Medellín which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Edisson has farmed corn for the last 10 years.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and his sales take place at daily farmers markets, especially Sunday’s.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like illnesses and weather variations.

His dream is to have enough money to make home improvements.  He enjoys going out with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal has a big family of three daughters and two sons. Amal and her husband work together in their clothing store selling clothes for all ages. They need to pay for the new summer clothes they are buying, but the money they have is not enough, so they took out a loan from FATEN to make up the difference. 

Amal is a conservative woman therefore her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustine is 28 years, married and has a nine-month-old child. His wife is a tailor, and they work together.

Faustine owns a general store in which he sells different items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, Irish potatoes, etc. He has been in business for the past five years, and his store is progressing well. From this business he can afford to feed his family and advance himself.

Faustine needs a loan to buy more items to put in his store so as to make more in profits. With these profits he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and Irish potatoes to sell in his store.

loans.name: Jose Eladio

texts.es:
José tiene 30 años de edad, el es casado y tiene un 1 hijo. Vive en casa de su suegro, la cual esta ubicada en  el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  En donde cuenta con los servicios básicos de energía   eléctrica y agua. 

José cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí el ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con varios años de antigüedad  y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Además  cuenta con una mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas) la cual es de sus propiedad y gracias a ambas actividades el ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería y productos de primera necesidad para surtir más su negocio, de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes,ademas desea realizar un mantenimiento a su mototaxi, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

José tiene buenas referencias y las personas que lo conocen lo consideran un apersona trabajadora y de buena voluntad.
texts.en:
30-year old José is married and has a son. He lives in his father-in-law’s house located in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, twenty minutes from the town of Chiclayo. The house has electricity and water.

José has a grocery store in the house where he sells basic supplies to his neighbours. The business has been operating for several years so José has a regular and loyal clientele. He also owns a motortaxi (motorbike with a cab on the back to transport passengers). Thanks to these two jobs he has been able to support his family and get ahead.

José now wishes to expand his business and buy more supplies so that the store is better stocked and he can satisfy his customers’ requests. He also wishes to spend some money maintaining his motortaxi. He has approached Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles.

He has good references, and the people who know him say that he is a hardworking, willing person.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his grocery store

loans.name: Karim Patricia

texts.es:
Las reunión del banco comunal “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” son cada treinta en la ciudad de Cusco y ahi conocimos a la socia Karin y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco, tengo 37 años edad, soy madre soletera y tengo dos hijos y vivó en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde desarrollo mi actividad económico que es la repostería”.
 
Karin tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde prepara tortas, pasteles y otras cosas más. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Karin requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina preparada, maicena, leche, huevos, chantillí, mantequilla y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Patrón Santiago de Santiago" meets every month in the city of Cusco and there we met one of the members, Karin, who told us the following:

"I was born in the city of Cusco, I'm 37 and a single mother with two sons.  I live in the same city I was born in and that's where I have my bakery business.".

Karin has a small shop in her house where she prepares cakes, pies and other products.  She has been in business for three years and it has gone well thanks to all the effort she puts into it.  Karin is in need of a loan to buy ingredients such as prepared flour, corn starch, milk, eggs, whipped cream, butter and other items.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as prepared flour, corn starch, milk, eggs, whipped cream, butter and other items.

loans.name: Arlen Ydania

texts.es: Arlen Ydania comenzó su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general hace 8 años, ella es maestra de educación primaria con lo poco que tenia de su salario fue comprando ciertos productos a pesar que no eran muchos logro obtener clientes. La lucha constante y el empeño de querer salir adelante han hecho de arlen una futura empresaria. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de gorras, bolsos, calzados, manteles, cortinas, ropa interior y oro laminado.
texts.en: Arlen Ydania started her business, which is general merchandise sales, 8 years ago.  She is an elementary school teacher and used what little was left from her salary to gradually buy certain products.  Despite not having very many she still was able to acquire customers.  Constant struggle and her dedication to get ahead in life have turned Arlen into a future businesswoman.  Because of this, she’s asking for this loan to buy caps, purses, footwear, tablecloths, curtains, underwear and gold plated items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 23 years old and married. She is taking care of an infant child and is a resident of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is earning an income for the family but she is engaged in other means to improve their living conditions. She owns a motorcycle transport business. The  vehicle is capable of carrying 2-4 passengers. By the end of the month, a total of PHP 10,000 is generated - quite sufficient for a small family such as hers.

This current year, Ellen joined GDMPC to access financial services. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase motorcycle accessories to improve the quality of her service. When this all is done, Ellen is expecting to gain more income. She plans to expand and improve her business range.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle accessories

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La señora Betty confecciona edredones; es dueña de  un pequeño taller de costura. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima, como ser telas, hilos, etc., y también para la compra de una máquina recta y una máquina obber. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Victoria en la ciudad de La Paz , es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter productivo y empresarial del mismo es que va a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Betty makes bedspreads and is the owner of small sewing workshop. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials such as fabrics, thread, and other supplies. She will also buy an upright sewing machine and a bobbin machine. Betty lives at the home of her parents located in the District of Villa Victoria in the city of La Paz. She is married and has one child.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan through IMPRO. Due to her productive and entrepreneurial qualities, Betty’s loan is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, an upright sewing machine, and a bobbin machine.

loans.name: Twitezimbere/rbr Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere / RBR et sur la photo est celui qui a l'argent. Le nom du groupe signifie « let’s develop ourselves ». Il est né au Rwanda et il a 34 ans. Il est marié avec 6 enfants de 9 mois à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Jean Bosco est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver à temps. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a member of the group called Twitezimbere / RBR and in the photo he is the one holding the money. The name of the group means "let’s develop ourselves". He was born in Rwanda and he is 34. He is married with six children whose ages range from 9 months to 12 years old. Three of them are enrolled in school. His own educational level is six years of primary school. 

Jean Bosco grows rice. This is his first loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay for labor for his rice crop. 

His strategy for growing his business is to plant his crop in a timely manner. In the coming years, Jean Bosco would like to harvest a big quantity of rice. With the profit, he intends to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay for laborers for his rice crop.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo, de 38 años, convive con Encarnación, su esposa. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Yelsi, Nicol y Paola. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio el palomar (selva central peruana). La vida de está familia se centra en Dios, junto a su esposa cultivan en sus hijos la fe. Aquello que les ayuda en el trabajo que realizan. La siembra de café y plátano, es su actividad económica. Ya tiene 8 años dedicándose a ello, y según afirma lo que más le gusta a él es poder limpiar su terreno agrícola, “me divierte, quitar la maleza de la tierra”, menciona. Cada 15 días viaja a la ciudad de La Merced, donde vende los plátanos que cosecha, pero su producción de café, los vende a los acopiadores, que constantemente visitan sus cultivos. A Hugo le falta capital, para mejorar la calidad de sus plantaciones; ya que invierte en los estudios de sus hijos. Pero está juntando dinero para abrir un negocio de comestibles; con el que piensa generar nuevos ingresos y así, invertir mayor dinero en la agricultura. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Buenos Aires” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde  gusta del trabajo que desarrolla junto a su banco comunal, pues en este corto tiempo pudo lograr mejoras en sus cultivos. Por ello promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.  Hugo de recibir su apoyo; comprará fertilizantes naturales para sus cafetales, ya que quiere mantener la calidad de los mismos, para la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Hugo is 38 years old and lives with Encarnacion, his wife. They have 3 children: Yelsi, Nicol, and Paola. As a family unit, they live in their own house in the community of Sanchirio el Palomar (in Peru's central jungle). Family life centers on God. Hugo and his wife cultivate faith among their children. This helps them in the work they do, sowing coffee and plantains, which is their economic activity. They have been dedicated to this for 8 years. They say that what they like most about this is being able to clear their agricultural land. “I enjoy removing weeds from the land,” says Hugo. 

Every 15 days he visits the city of La Merced where he sells harvested plantains, but his coffee production is sold to buyers who constantly visit his fields. Hugo lacks capital to improve the quality of his plantations, since he is investing in his children's studies. But he is accumulating money to open a grocery store, with which he hopes to generate new income and thus, to invest more money in agriculture. 

Hugo belongs to the “Buenos Aires” (Good Breezes) communal bank and this is his 4th loan with MFP, where he likes the work they do together. In a short time he has been able to make improvements in his crops. That's why he promises to be punctual in his payments. With this loan, Hugo will buy natural fertilizer for his coffee groves, since he wants to maintain their quality for the coming harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer for his coffee groves.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis tiene 46 años, su actividad que es brindar el servicio de sastrería, que atiende desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad que ninguno está bajo su cargo. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitarle variedad de prendas como pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes y uniformes pues sus clientes siempre son exigentes en lo que solicitan. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de telas, botones, hilos, tijeras entre otros productos que son necesarios.
texts.en: José Luis is 46 years old and is a tailor. He works from 7 in the morning until 9 at night. He has 3 grown-up children, none of whom are under his care. Most of his customers order a range of garments such as trousers, shirts, skirts, suits and uniforms; his customers are very demanding with their orders. The reason for the loan is to buy fabrics, buttons, thread, scissors and other much-needed products.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, buttons, thread, scissors.

loans.name: Tiburcia

texts.es: La socia actualmente tiene 42 años; la socia tiene 6 hijos  de los cuales 3 de ellos son mayore sde edad, y a tres de ellos la socia les apoya, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de carnes, ella se dedcia  a la crianza de ganados, la socia invertira el credito en la compra de vacas tiernas para la crianza y la venta, ella también compra carne de cordero para la venta de  la carne. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de carne.
texts.en: The borrower is currently 42 years old and has six children; three of them are adults and three that are still in her care.  She is a meat merchant and raises livestock.  She will use the loan to buy young heifers to raise and sell; she will also buy lamb meat to sell.  She’s requesting the loan to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy young heifers to raise and lamb meat to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 62, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ceferino, her business partner, and is the mother of five children. Four are in college and one is in high school. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edna operates a food stall. She sells snacks, burgers and beverages to the local community. Aside from this she also earns from the apartment that she owns and the table and chairs rental that she operates. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP)  in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of patties, buns, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Edna would like to buy a vehicle for their business and hopes to continuously grow her enterprise in the coming years. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and an enterprising businessman. His wife Mary is a farmer. The couple is blessed with two children. Samuel's primary business is charging batteries. He has also had a barber shop for the past six years. His monthly income is 10,000 Kenyan shilings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

Samuel is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by a staff member. He will use the loan to buy a shaving machine for his barber shop and a solar panel for his charging business.

He plans to use the anticipated profit from the two businesses to boost his wife’s business. His hope and dream is to buy a piece of land and build his own house.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine for his barber shop and a solar panel for his charging business

loans.name: Kona Moja Group

texts.en:
Elias is the facilitator of the Kona Moja group. Elias  and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elias  takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Elias  had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Elias was only able to harvest 4½ bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elias  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Elias will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kona Moja  group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Elias is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Edelia

texts.en:
Edelia is 62 years old, a widow with five children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Edelia has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish and other seafood to sell.

Edelia has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, Edelia would like to save money to expand her business and secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and other seafood to sell.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Ms. Thanh is 31 years old with three school age children. She sells traditional cigarettes. For ten years this business has provided a stable income for the Thanh family.  

After taking part in the SEDA credit program in 2007, she found that this kind of credit is very suitable for her family. Currently, she wants to borrow  9,632,000 VND to buy more traditional cigarettes to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more traditional cigarettes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María es  una persona  trabajadora  y muy responsable,  la  cual  tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada, el cual  le a permitido  salir  adelante  día  con día,  en esta ocasión requiere  de nuestro  apoyo para  realizar  la compra  de mercancía  para  continuar  trabajando, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para la  realización de su proyecto ya que  ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  brindar  a  sus  clientes  un excelente  servicio, además  de  generar  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en:
María is a hard-working and very resposible person. She has her own business selling used clothes, which allows her to succeed day to day. 

On this occasion she needs our help to be able to buy merchandise so she can continue working.

In the support offered to help her realise her goals, allows her the possibility to offer excellent service to her customers as well as generating more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena de 36 años de edad, es soltera con 02 hijos, juntos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de Llochegua. Elena es una buena y noble mujer trabajadora, ella trabaja expendiendo pollos vivos y pelados a un precio módico para sus clientes. En un inicio Elena vendía salchicha con pollo frito y los pollos que compraba tenía alto precio, por ello es que decide vender pollo en un precio por debajo de la competencia y capto rápidamente sus clientes. Actualemente tiene una buena acogida, que gracias a este negocio ahora ella ha comprado su propio terreno donde podrá en un futuro construir su vivienda. Ella está feliz y contenta con lo que ha realizado por que dicho negocio le genera una buena rentabilidad, pues gracias a ello su familia vive feliz. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Elena esta contenta con su banco comunal por que vienen trabajando eficientemente.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará más pollos para beneficiarlos.
texts.en:
Elena is 36 years old and single with 2 kids. They live together in a rented house located in the central village of Canayre, in the Llochegua district. Elena is good and noble hardworking woman. She works selling live and skinned chickens to her customers at a reasonable price. At first Elena had been selling sausage with fried chicken, and the chickens that she’d bought were expensive. So she decided to sell chickens at a lower price than the competition and quickly grab her customers. 

Now she is well established, and thanks to this business she has now bought her own plot of land where she will be able to build her house in the future. She is very happy and content with what she’s done because this business generates a good profit, and thanks to that her family lives well. This will be her 2nd loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments in a timely fashion. Elena is happy with her communal bank because they work efficiently. 

With the 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy more chickens to benefit them.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 48-year-old, hardworking lady with 6 children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a personal goal of buying a car. She has been dealing in clothes-selling for the last 10 years. After starting with capital of 100,000 UGX, Ruth now has 3,000,000 UGX. Her major hardship is seasonal weather. However, she has a vision of moving her business to a more permanent location. Ruth needs a loan to help her buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zhanny Nuve

texts.es: Zhanny vive en Isla Trinitaria en el sur de Guayaquil. Tiene 36 años edad y está casada con Roberto quien tiene 9 años trabajando de manera independiente como vendedor de helados. Tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 6 años de edad quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal. Hace 8 años decidió abrir el bazar porque deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y cuidar de sus hijos. Como está ubicado en su domicilio abre desde muy temprano y cierra a las 8 de la noche. Su hija de 15 años es quien le ayuda en la atención tiene carisma y predisposición eso le gusta ya que está aprendiendo algo que en futuro tal vez se convierta también en su forma de vida. Zhanny nos comenta que el sector es tranquilo pero si han tenido casos de robos, no a ella pero si a sus vecinos. Espera continuar trabajando con tranquilidad por mucho tiempo. Con el crédito comprara un congelador y vitrina para la exposición de sus productos. Ella tiene como meta terminar la construcción de su casa enluciendo los cuartos y terminar su cerramiento.
texts.en: Zhanny lives in Isla Trinitaria, a suburban area in the south of Guayaquil. She is 36 years old and she is married with Roberto, who has been working independently for 9 years selling ice-creams. She has 2 children aged 15 and 6 who attend public school. She decided to open a bazaar 8 years ago because she wanted to help her husband paying for their household expenses as well as for their children’s needs. As the shop is well located she opens very early and closes at 8 pm. Her 15-year-old daughter helps her attending the shop: the girl is charismatic and she seems fit for the job, and Zhanny likes that because her daughter is learning something that in the future may allow her to earn a living. Zhanny told us that hers is a quite area, even though some of her neighbors have been robbed. She hopes to continue working in peace for a long time. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a freezer and a showcase to present her products. Her goal is to finish building her house by plastering the rooms and putting the last seals.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and a showcase.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Mary is a member of the Ebenezer group. She is 48 this year and happily married with 5 children. All her children are currently attending school. Mary lives with her family in Abrakrampa in the Central Region of Ghana. 

Mary has been a farmer for 19 years. She grows oranges.   She is also a trader and sells provisions as a side business but her main source of livelihood is the income from the orange farm. Mary is also an active member of a registered local Citrus Farmers Association.

Mary finds it difficult to maintain her farms because she cannot afford the financial demands of hiring workers to maintain the farm. She needs financial support in the form of micro loans to hire laborers to prune the trees and clear the farm, and to buy insect traps to protect the crops.    Mary's family is relying on the income she takes home, particularly her children who need the money to pay school fees.A micro loan of GHC1,500 will support Mary to achieve her business goal.  Mary thanks all micro-lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to pay for  insect traps and fertilizer, as well as to hire laborers to work on the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Saami wants to buy 2 medium size steers

loans.name: Luis Adolfo

texts.en:
My name is Luis Adolfo and I work primarily as a merchant and owner of a grocery store called "Gracias a Dios" (Thanks to God), located in my own home in the center of my neighborhood. My grocery store creates enough income to cover personal expenses and other necessities. Now I have a need to establish a second location which will be run by my wife, because of which I need to stock more items.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre el Luis Adolfo, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pulperia llada pulperia "Gracias a Dios" ubicada en mi casa de habitación en el centro de mi colonia, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos personales y otros compromisos, actualmente estoy estableciendo otro negocio para que sea atendido por mi esposa el que necesito surtir mas.

loans.use: To buy eggs, rice, sugar, coffee, butter, dairy products, soap and other items.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim P. is 55 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She sells delicious Chinese bean cakes in her village and can make about $2.50 per day.  Her husband (pictured here) sells candy and makes about $5.00 per day.  One of their daughters is a garment worker in a nearby factory and one of her sons is a construction worker.  The other three children are still in school.  The family hopes to use this loan to purchase wood in order to repair their house--specifically to protect it from leaking in the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase wood in order to repair house so it does not leak during the rainy season

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel is an enterprising young woman with great wishes to improve. She is single and lives his her aging parents. Four years ago, Raquel started her own clothing business. She started by investing a little capital on it and by selling among family and friends. She has gotten a good response from her customers and decided to continue investing on it by adding cosmetics to sell. She has also open a general store and Raquel hopes to continue growing as a microentrepreneur.

To be able to cover her demands and increase her sales, Raquel asks for a $475 dollars loan. She will use it in buying merchandise. She commits to return the payment in 6 months. Be part of Raquel's success and help her to improve her life and that of her family. They thank you very much for your support and trust found in you.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Raquel es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, ella es soltera y vive con sus padres que son de edad avanzada, desde hace cuatro años Raquel inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, comenzó invirtiendo muy poco capital y vendiendo entre familiares y amigos, pero ha recibido muy buena respuesta de sus clientes y decidió continuar invirtiendo, incorporando la venta de cosméticos, también ha abierto una tienda de abarrotes y espera continuar creciendo como microempresaria.

Para poder cubrir sus demandas e incrementar sus ventas, Raquel solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de los logros de Raquel y ayúdala a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia, ellos agradecen mucho el apoyo y confianza que han encontrado en ti.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Ehinmwinose, 55 is married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City.  She sells provision, drinks and foodstuff to people living her community. She is seeking for loan amount of $400 to enable her buy more provision and drinks for sale. She is a dedicated member of our LAPO. She has been business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provision, & foodstuff

loans.name: Karima

texts.en: Karima is married and the mother of two children. Several years ago, she began selling children's clothes in the central market of her town, Isfara. She loves being in business and turns over her inventory quickly because she has many faithful customers who like to shop at her store. Karima buys her goods in the nearby city of Istaravshan, and has come to us for a loan of $500 so that she can go there to purchase a new assortment of winter clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of winter clothes

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
Claudia had just given birth when she noticed that the income her husband earned at his job wasn't enough to pay for the expenses of their son. This is why she started selling used clothing, to make money to pay for her son's diapers. Little by little, she noticed that having an extra business was a good way to provide for her family. She gradually increased her products, exchanging used clothing for new clothing.

However, she doesn't have enough winter clothing right now to offer her clients. This is why she is requesting a credit of $250, which she is willing to repay in 5 months. With this money, she will be able to purchase more merchandise in Moroleón, Guanajuato, so she'll have new products to offer her clients. With your help, Claudia will be able to get ahead with her business and take care of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Claudia se acababa de aliviar cuando se dio cuenta que con lo que ganaba su esposo en la obra no era suficiente para pagar los gastos que estaba teniendo su hijo. Fue por eso que comenzó a vender ropa usada para poder sacar dinero para los pañales de su hijo. Poco a poco fue dándose cuenta de que teniendo un negocio extra era muy bueno para poder solventar a su familia. Poco a poco fue incrementando en sus productos, cambiando la ropa usada por ropa nueva.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con ropa de invierno para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por eso que Claudia está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y así con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía en Moroleón, Guanajuato, para así tener nuevos productos qué ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Claudia podrá salir adelante en su negocio y con su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the winter

loans.name: Kabojja A1(E) Group

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old. She sells matooke (a banana dish) for a living. She sees a business opportunity of bringing trucks of matooke from villages and supplying to retail sellers in the city. Mary wants to use the extra business profits to buy land in the village. Juliet sells clothes and wants to use the loan to add stock. Francis has a retail shop and intends to use the loan to add stock to her shop. Hadijah has a hardware shop and wants to use the loan to increase stock. Alice has a hotel business and intends to expand it with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her matooke (a banana dish) business

loans.name: Asha's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Asha is 34 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 16,14,11,7 and 4. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 12 and 9. Asha owns a food vendor store, which she started in 2001. Everyday, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Senija

texts.en: Senija was born in 1962 and she lives with her husband in Vukovije, a small village near the town of Živinice.
