While the members of this village group will use their portions to support their different purposes, the group will be responsible for any member who might default on his or her loan.

In order to better her farm’s production, Mrs. Sin is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to hire laborers to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, to pay for hire laborers to plow her farming field.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San Y. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates rice crops on her own farmland.  She has another financial earner in her husband who goes to buy animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. In the past, San Y. has always hired a plowing machine from her neighbor in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy two cows to add to her farming business and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. This will provide her with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: to buy two cows to add to her farming business.

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Krishna Maya M. is married and has three children aged twenty, eighteen and twelve. In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. In the future, Krishna Maya plans to lift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store called a pasal is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

BPW Partner Page: Join our lending team, BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Mohammad Khair

texts.en:
Mohammad Khair is a 29-year-old single man. He owns an Internet station, which provides Internet to homes and offices in his area and nearby villages. At the beginning, he had no competitors as he was the first to provide such a service in his region.

Mohammad is well-known in his area. He has excellent customer service, as most of his clients state. He started this business in 2000. His 11 years of experience gave him a special place in this sector. 

Mohammad Khair is requesting a loan, for the first time, in order to buy updated machines necessary for his business. These machines help in providing the customers with the best connection in the region.

Mohammad hopes to open a car-rental company, which is a dream he is working hard to achieve soon.

loans.use: to buy new updated machines necessary for his business.

loans.name: Reyna Argentina

texts.es:
doña Reyna Argentina es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio que es la venta de golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos, su negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de buses de Choluteca, este lugar es muy estrategico ya que todo el dia viajan muchas personas y aprovechan a comer en el negocio de la sra. Reyna, en estos momentos las ventas son muy buenas y no se da abasto para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los alimentos para la preparacion de sus golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos.
Reyna es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, Reyna se levanta todos los dias a las 5 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos y luego atender a sus clientes.
en sus tiempos libres se dedica la cria de gallinas y cerdos.
texts.en: Doña Reyna Argentina is a hard-working woman who runs a business selling sweets, breakfasts and lunches.  Her business is located in the bus terminal in Choluteca.  This is a very strategic location since many people travel through here all day long and eat at Señora Reyna's.  Currently, her sales are very good and she can't keep up with the demand.  She will use the loan to buy food supplies to prepare her sweets, breakfasts and lunches.  Reyna is a single mother with 5 children.  She gets up at 5:00 every morning to prepare her foods and then she attends to her customers.  In her free time she raises hens and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, lard, oil, rice, vegetables, beans, cheese, butter, soft drinks, salt, spices, bread, juice, chorizo and eggs.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 29 años, Es soltero vive con los padres, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Juan Carlos se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 29 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. He lives in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos Province.

The members of "LA UNION" communal bank get together in the Aguas Frías de Medellín district, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture, planting short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and pole beans. 

Juan Carlos works in agriculture, planting corn and rice. He buys supplies in Ventanas and sells his products at the daily markets, especially the Sunday market. 

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost. With the help of the loan, he will improve his economic situation so he can cover his needs. He faces challenges such as competition and the variation in the climate. His dream is to buy a house. 

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia is 60 years old and is a married woman with 12 children. Her husband works as a farmer. He grows corn and vegetables.

Gelasia runs a "habal-habal" business (motorcycle transport). One of her sons drives the motorcycle to transport people in their community. Gelasia has requested a loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts like tires.

In the future, Gelasia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts like tires.

loans.name: Vardigyul

texts.en:
Vardigyul keeps livestock and beehives. Vardigyul needs to replace the old hives with new ones. This requires some financial investments. With the requested loan, Vardigyul plans to purchase new hives, as well as some medicine and requisites for her bees. 

The new hives will allow Vardigyul to have a good produce, develop the beekeeping. This will also help Vardigyul to get additional income and insure sustainable future for her family. She lives together with her husband.

loans.use: to pay for hives, medicine and other requisites for bees

loans.name: Mercedes Aurora

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Amor Y Felicidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  16, 13 Y 8 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. Está en el banco comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para su negocio y su vida personal.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que además se dedica a la venta de de ropa por catalogo de varias marcas tanto nacionales como extranjeras. Además de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos Yanbal los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que empezó por la necesidad que tenia de ganar algo propio y como no había trabajo empezó con su negocio que en la actualidad le deja buenos ingresos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Guabito in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank “Amor Y Felicidad” (Love and Happiness) meet every 15 days. Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos”.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Mercedes. She is 38 years old, married, and has three children (ages 16, 13, and 8). The two older children are in high school and the youngest attends elementary school. Her husband is a merchant. Mercedes has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because the loans have been very important to her business and for her personal life.

She is an excellent homemaker who also sells clothing through catalogs of various national and foreign brands. In addition, Mercedes sells products made by Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works three days a week, offering her products on credit and collecting payments each week. The Yanbal products are shipped to her house and she acquires the clothing from a distributor. Mercedes has been in business for four years and has done very well. She says that she started her business out of necessity because she had to earn her own income. Since she did not have a job, she decided to start this business and now earns a good income.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing of all types. Her dream is to open a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée à un homme polygamme qui vit avec 4 épouses.Elle est en location dans une maison avec ses quatre enfants.Elle mène l'activité d'aviculture depuis un an pour subvenir à ses propres besoins,à ceux de ses enfants et pour appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des nombreuses charges familiales.Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000F à l'IMCEC pour l'achat de 200 poussins et l'aménagement de son poulailler. Les revenus obtenus de cette activité lui serviront à supporter les dépenses liées aux besoins de sa famille. Elle envisage dans le futur d'implanter une grande exploitation avicole dans sa parcelle située à la périphérie de la ville.
texts.en: This borrower is married to a polygamous man who has four wives.  She lives in a house with her four children.  She has been running a poultry business for a year to help meet her own needs, those of her children, and to help her husband meet the many family expenses.  She is requesting a loan of 250,000 F from IMCEC to buy 200 young chickens and to maintain her chicken-raising facility.  Her income earned from this work will help her to meet the expenses associated with her family’s needs.  For the future, she foresees establishing a large poultry enterprise on her plot located at the edge of town.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks and to establish her own chicken coop.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who go to school. She has one additional family member. Veronica sells second hand clothes. She sells her clothes on a retail basis and moves door-to-door. She has been in business for the last two years. Veronica works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow big and operate on a wholesale basis. She would also like to get a permanent business shop where customers could find her. Her major business challenges are transportation and the increasing prices of clothes in Uganda. Veronica lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a determined 46-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with four children who are 23, 20, 18 and 14 years old. For the last 10 years, he has been doing welding to make a living. He supplements his income with the earnings he makes from farming. Previously, he used to run a workshop. He wants in the next five years to have established another shop. He is requesting a loan of 95,000 Kenyan shillings to buy metal plates and metal bars. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has now embraced the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy metal plates and metal bars

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 39-year-old married woman with three children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the clothing business for seven years. She started the business with capital of 500,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is bad debtors and her vision is a wholesale business plus an educated family. Rose needs the loan facility to buy clothes, shoes and bags to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Rajaa'

texts.en:
Rajaa', age 30, operates her own grocery store business. She and her husband have three sons and two daughters and live in the city of Jenin in Palestine. Her husband is a baker with a decent salary, and her grocery business is another source of income for the family.
 
Rajaa' wants to improve her grocery by purchasing additional grocery items to offer for sale. She does not have a sufficient amount of money for what she needs, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Rajaa' receives this loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase a greater variety of groceries and have a better selection to offer for sale. In this way, she will sell more and increase her income so as to help raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of groceries and have a better selection to offer for sale

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es:
Toribio de 58 año, es divorciado, pero tiene 2 hermosas hijas. Él vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva Alianza, Pichari. El trabajo al que se dedica es el de agricultor, desde muy joven aprendió de sus padres, quienes le inculcaron de como fertilizar y cuidar la tierra. Sin embargo a la edad que tiene, no puede realizar un desgaste físico como antes, por tal motivo ha optado por abrir un negocio, como es la venta de abarrotes, así no deja de percibir ganancias sin perjudicar su salud. 
Su decision de abrir un negocio de este rubro, porque los pocos que hay se encuentran demasiado lejor de su comuna, de esa manera facilitaría las necesidades de sus vecinos. Aún así desea seguir trabajando en paralelo con la agricultura, y por ello desea ampliar la siembra de cacao, por ser un producto que tiene mayor demanda y eso le genera fuertes ingresos. Está contento con la labor que realiza, pues se siente atraído por la naturaleza. Este será su primer crédito con MFP y por tal se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar peones que lo ayuden a podar y sacar la maleza de entre sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Toribio is 58 and divorced but he has two beautiful daughters. He lives in his own house located in Nueva Alianza community, in Pichari. He is a farmer, who learned from his parents at a very young age. They taught him how to fertilize and care for the land. However, at his current age, he can not put forth the same physical effort as before and for that reason he opted to start a business and sell groceries: thus he could continue to make a profit without jeopardizing his health. His decision to start a business of this kind is because the few existing stores are too far from his township and in this way he can make it easier for his neighbors to meet their needs.

Even so, Toribio wants to continue working simultaneously as a farmer. Consequently he wants to expand his planting of cacao, because it is a product that is in higher demand and generates strong returns. He enjoys the work because he feels attracted to nature.

This will be his first loan with MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time. With the 3,000 soles he is requesting he will contract laborers to help him trim and weed between his cacao plants.

loans.use: to contract laborers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Maria has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jaqueline Esmilda

texts.es: Jaqueline Esmilda tiene una pulpería, desde hace más de 4 años. Ella aprendió este negocio por su mama quien le enseño este medio de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades de sobrellevar su vida como madre soltera. Ella solicita el financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, fideos, papel higiénico, golosinas, refrescos, pan, sopas y enlatados. Ella desea crecer poco a poco con su negocio y ampliarse cada dia mas en su comarca.
texts.en:
Jaqueline Esmilda has a local store, which she's had for more than four years. She learned the business from her mother, who taught her this way of life. 

In spite of the difficulties of her life as a single mother, she has managed to stay afloat through great effort. 

She is asking for financing in order to buy dry grains, noodles, toilet paper, candy, soda, bread, soup and canned goods. She wants to grow her business little by little, and expand in her area every day.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, noodles, toilet paper, candy, soda, bread, soup and canned goods.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida, de 28 años, es una joven mujer con ganas de surgir y tener muchas cosas para su futuro. Ella convive con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 3 años. Juntos habitan  tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su pareja y su menor hijos, ella junto a su pareja trabajando mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. EL trabajo de Ida consiste en la venta de comida por las noches, ella sale a vender en la vereda de su casa, estuvo vendiendo en forma continua por siete años, pero dejo hace un año aproximadamente por algunos problemas, pero hace seis meses volvió a vender y esta nuevamente en el negocio, ella como tiene buena sazón, sus clientes siempre la buscan para poder degustar de sus deliciosos y exquisitos platos, trabaja sola y desea progresar haciendo su buen trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para estar a lado de su menor hijo, además para hacer algunas cosas del hogar, le esta yendo bien, pues sus clientes le son muy fieles ya que encuentran en ella buena atención y una sazón exquisita, espera seguir vendiendo por mucho mas tiempo y mas adelante mejorar las condiciones de su venta en cuanto a infraestructura. Este será el segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, la primera vez que hizo un préstamo le fue muy bien y espera poder seguir yendo así, agradece mucho el préstamo otorgado ya que le permitió retomar el trabajo que realizaba y le esta yendo mejor ahora. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con su venta de comida, espera poder comprar por grandes cantidades ya que así gana mas.
texts.en:
Ida is 28 years old.  She is a young woman who has a desire to get ahead in life and do well for her future.  She lives with her partner by whom she has a three-year-old son.  They live together in their own home and, together with her partner, Ida works hard to provide their son with a better quality of life.  Ida's business is selling food in the evenings.  She goes out to sell her products on the sidewalk outside her house.  She had been selling her food continually for seven years but stopped approximately one year ago owing to some problems.  However, six months ago she started selling her food again and her business is up and running again.  As her food is tasty, her customers are always seeking her out so that they can eat her delicious dishes.  She works alone and would like to make progress, doing her good work.

What Ida likes about her work is that it gives her time to be with her young son and she also has time to take care of her household.  Her business is doing well as her customers are very loyal.  This is because she provides good customer service and delicious food.  She hopes to continue selling her food for a long time to come and, in the future, she would like to improve the infrastructure of her business.  

This will be Ida's second loan from MFP.  Her first loan went very well and she hopes to be able to continue doing well.  She is very grateful for the loan she has been given as it will allow her to re-start the work that she used to carry out which is going better now.  She will use the sum of 1,500 soles that she has requested to buy ingredients and supplies so that she can continue with her food sales business.  She hopes to be able to buy in bulk as this allows her to earn more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Mushegh

texts.en:
Mushegh is 41 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city with his retired mother, jobless wife and young son, who studies at school.

Mushegh has re-equipped one room of his house into a workshop where he engages in jeweler’s art. He sells the jewelry he produces to a jeweler’s shop and he also he fulfills private orders. Mushegh has run his business for more than 10 years and thus he provides for his family. During this period he was able to buy all necessary equipment for his occupation. Mushegh does his work very neatly and thanks to that he has a lot of regular customers. 
 
This is Mushegh’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a loan of 700,000 AMD to buy necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his business

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet's Group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Juliet is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her hotel (restaurant), which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food to cook for resale, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and open up another shop that does hairdressing. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to own a salon business. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Juliet's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food to cook for resale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, a 56-year-old resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her four children. She, together with her children, manages her house while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josefina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to people in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one packet of shampoo, some cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail prices. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and others in her local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Josefina hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she dreams to be able to provide her family with a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Mrs. Han, 35, a hard-working and responsible mother residing in Pouk District, Siem Reap Province, grows rice and raises pigs to generate income. Currently engaged in harvesting her rice, she is requesting a loan from HKL to pay for farm labor, enlarge her pigpen, and buy additional piglets. She would to thank all lenders who help her attain her goal.

loans.use: to enlarge her pigpen, buy additional piglets and pay laborers harvesting and threshing her rice crops.

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le is taking the loan out for her son, Son. With the hope of being a business administrator for a company, Son entered Hanoi Polytechnic University.  His course lasts 5 years, and it will be completed by September, 2014. During studying, he has difficulties in paying fees and managing daily expenses since he is living far from home. Le wants to have a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to solve this problem.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees and other expenses.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es: Augusto, tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado con Paulina de 40 años y tiene 02 hijos Wilian de 15 años y Deysi de 13 años; juntos viven en su propia casa ubicados en la comunidad Camunachari. Para Augusto no hay  impedimento para seguir surgiendo y obteniendo buenos provechos; desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra y es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo. Augusto es campesino donde sus terrenos son cultivados con plantas de café. Ya tiene 15 años trabajando en sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta  con el apoyo de su esposa, sus 02 hijos y de los jornaleros para así avanzar con mayor rapidez en cuanto a la cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias así impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando los frutos de sus plantaciones. El crédito solicitado es para que pueda comprar más semillas de café para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Este será su crédito numero 01 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es colaborativo con todos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles; comprará  más semillas de café para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Augusto is 37 and married to Paulina who is 40.  He has two children Wilian, 15 and Deysi, 13.  They live together in their own home within the Camunachari community. 

There is no stopping Augusto from continuing to grow and obtain good profits; since he was a small child his parents took him to work on the farm and he is well accustomed to hard work in the fields. Augusto is a farmer and grows coffee in his fields.  He has already spent 15 years working his own land. During the harvest seasons his wife and two children as well as casual labourers help him out so that they can harvest the coffee more quickly.  

What he most enjoys about his work is harvesting the fruits of his labour as this makes him feel that the months of hard work have paid off.  The hardest thing for him is transporting his produce from his farm to the city of San Francisco, where he gets the best prices for his products.  He says that he is not fond of the winter because of the amount of insects and rainfall that hamper the yield from his plantation and threaten his crops.

He has requested a loan so that he is able to buy more coffee seeds to graft so as to get a good return on his work in less time.  This will be his first loan from MFP and he feels that the money will help him a great deal in his work. He is cooperative with everyone at his communal bank.  With the 1,000 new soles he will buy more coffee seeds to graft so as to get a good return on his work in less time.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya and Katerina came to the States a few years ago. They both have been pursuing careers in the movie industry since their childhood. Katerina studied film in Saint Petersburg, and Zoya went to university in San Francisco, where she got her film degree.

Zoya and Katerina met on a film production and decided to cooperate and produce a film. Last year they produced their first film, “Awaking”, which had a lot of success at the festivals and was featured in some news and magazine publications.

In December 2014, Zoya and Katerina decided to register a business and open a company, LetoFilm, in order to produce films, commercials, and music videos. Opening a production company was always a dream for both of them. There are a lot of challenges in producing films, especially raising funds for the film. LetoFilm will work on creation of amazing pieces of art, which people will admire and remember.

Zoya and Katerina never give up on their goals and stay strong and positive, even in very hard financial times.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for the production.

loans.name: Franco

texts.en:
Sofia works as a jewelry and clothes vendor in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She started off a seamstress who worked from home. She was able to save about $100 and invest in jewelry as a new activity. Her husband also helped her accrue these savings with the profit from his aluminum and glass workshop that is also run out of their home. This couple works closely together in order to support each others businesses because these microenterprises are the main source of income in their household of 3 children. Although they have always financed their businesses through their own savings they have come to realize that they need loans in order to increase revenue and profits. They will use these loans in order to invest fabric, clothes and jewelry for Sofia and in glass for the workshop.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in fabrics, clothes and other materials

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.en:
Hello my name is Ana and I am a merchant, I have a grocery store run from my own home, located in the center of my community. I have several years experience in this business which creates enough income to cover family expenses, as I am a single mother and thanks to this business I am able to give my children what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola mi nombre es Ana, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pulperia en mi casa de habitación, ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, ya que soy madre soltera y gracias a este negocio puedo dar a mi hijos lo necesario.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, butter, refreshments, coffee, instant soupd, eggs, rice, meats and sausages.

loans.name: Belkis

texts.en:
Belkis S. D. L. C. lives with her husband Victor. She owns her own beauty parlor and boutique. She started with a small loan of just $60. Belkis S. has taken various loans since then and is now requesting this loan to restock and expand her current product line. She has successfully paid off her previous loans and has demonstrated that her business can benefit from a larger loan. She says her goal is to continue growing her business.

NOTE: Belkin is a member of a Bank of Hope solidarity group consisting of five microentrepreneurs. They have gone through Esperanza's training program and have created their own businesses. They will receive their share of this $750 loan to expand their respective businesses and will be responsible for making each payment together. They are accountable to one another for paying in full and on time.

loans.use: Purchase hair care products and salon equipment

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en:
Tamella is 51 years old and single, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan,  Djabrayl region. She is settled in Bakiu City, Surakhany region.
She has been selling foodstuffs for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy foodstuffs and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

20 years ago, Sara's three children were small and she had no one to help her with the expenses of the home and their education of its children. She he decided to undertake her own business that sells milk candy, Typical of this region, the demand by these products is very good and their sales improved every day. Single, now her children are older and they help her in its business, together they have managed to make it grow and improve the service that offers.



In order to provide better its business, Sara it is asking for a loan of $ 250 dollars that it will use in the purchase of merchandise to be able to cover the demand of its clients. She is committed to return this amount in 3 months. They thank for much the confidence and support that you offer them.



ORIGINAL SPANISH

Desde hace 20 años Sara enviudó, sus tres hijos estaban pequeños y al no tener a nadie que le ayudara con los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos ella decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de dulces de leche y pay, por ser dulces típicos de la región la demanda por estos productos es muy buena y sus ventas mejoraban cada día, de esta manera es como Sara sacó adelante a su familia ella sola, ahora sus hijos están grandes y le ayudan en su negocio, juntos han logrado hacerlo crecer y mejorar el servicio que ofrecen.

Para surtir mejor su negocio Sara está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia contribuyendo con su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mrs. Patricia E. a 48-year-old woman, a widow with 7 children. She lives in Benin City and sells provisions and drinks to people living in her community. According to her, if loan of $400 is given to her, it will enable her buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She has been in this business since 2000 and she is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Wazalendo Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 48-years-old and sells fish and different snacks. She works from 6am to 7pm daily and makes a monthly profit of $220.

Mariam is married with 3 children (ages 18, 24, and 27). She also takes care of 3 other children, ages 2, 4, and 6.

Mariam is the subgroup leader of Wazalendo A. She and her other subgroup members hope for this loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy fish stock

loans.name: Mirembe I(B) Group

texts.en: Joan sells crafts for a living. With the extra business profits, she intends to buy a plot of land and build a house.Joyce and Christine both sell freahs foods and want to expand their businesses with the loan. Hadijah sells maize flour while Esther has a retail shop business.

loans.use: To expand craft selling business

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol is a mother who works diligently every day to cover educational expenses for her five younger children. When three of her children entered the police academy and her oldest daughter was completing her teaching, her husband’s salary could not cover all of the necessary expenses; due to this lack of funds, Marisol began selling socks at fairs across the city, which proved to be very helpful and profitable. Since it’s a traveling business, Marisol leaves every weekend to sell her socks in other cities as well. She is very pleased with this as sales have been very good this year and she has been able to fulfill the needs of her dear children who are struggling to become excellent professionals. This exemplary mother seeks your help to expand the reach of her business and invest more capital to offer additional items.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Marisol, es una madre de familia que día a día trabaja diligentemente para cubrir los gastos educativos de sus cinco menores hijos. El sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para toda la inversión que se tenia que hacer cuando tres de sus hijos ingresaron a la escuela de policías y su hija mayor estaba haciendo sus trámites de titulación, después de haber concluido sus estudios de pedagogía; la situación de carencia obligó a Marisol a empezar a vender calcetines en las ferias de la ciudad, esta actividad resultó ser de mucha ayuda y muy rentable, debido a que el negocio es realizado de manera ambulante, Marisol sale cada fin de semana a otras ciudades a venderlas también; está muy satisfecha con este hecho ya que las mismas han sido muy buenas este año y han podido colmar las peticiones de sus queridos hijos quienes luchan por convertirse en excelentes profesionales.Esta ejemplar madre de familia solicita vuestra ayuda para ampliar su radio de acción e invertir mayor cantidad de capital para ofertar otros artículos.

loans.use: Increased capital to offer greater quantity and variety of items.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en: Mirjana was born in 1982 and she lives in Laktaši. She is not married and has no children. She owns a hair salon and her monthly income is 700 BAM. This is the first loan she has sought through Kiva and she is seeking this loan in the amount of 1,200 BAM to enable her to buy equipment for her shop. In practice, she intends to improve upon the services that her salon offers and, as a result, to generate additional monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase certain equipment for her hair salon

loans.name: Maria Luzmila

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Luzmila Z. E. is 70 years old. She studied until the second year of high school. She has 2 sons in total but none depend on her. She lives in the City og God section in the district of the Future in the city of La Libertad, Peru. She began her business with a few products, when she was living in the desert, she had a small store in her home, she was always maintaining this business, later she came to live in the coast of La Libertad because she wanted to give her sons a better education. With a lot of effort she began selling products of necessity, with time she has been increasing her business. For 10 years she has belonged to the institution, the first bank that she belonged to was in the desert of La Libertad, later she became a member of the Victor Raul Communal Bank in the city of Trujilo. She obtained her first loan of 300 soles, money she used to purchase all the necessities to begin her store. With this loan of 1000 soles which will be paid in 4 months she will purchase 3 sacks of rice, 2 cans of oil, one bag of sugar, a carton of noodles, and other products. Mrs. Maria has the great idea of becoming independent, to say that she has her own capital and in this manner she can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Luzmila Z. E. tiene 70 años de edad. Estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene dos hijos en total pero ninguno depende de ella. Vive en el sector Ciudad de Dios en el distrito El Porvenir en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Su negocio se inicio con pocos productos, cuando vivía en la sierra ambientó una pequeña bodega en su casa, siempre ha mantenido ese negocio, posteriormente se vino a vivir a la costa de La Libertad debido a que quería darle mejor educación a sus hijos. Con mucho esfuerzo empezó vendiendo productos de primera necesidad, con el tiempo ha ido incrementando. Hace 10 años que pertenece a la institución, el primer banco al que perteneció fue en la sierra de La Libertad, posteriormente ingreso al Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl” en la ciudad de Trujillo. Obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero con el cual compro todo lo necesario para implementar su bodega. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprará: tres sacos de arroz, dos latas de aceite, una bolsa de azúcar, un paquete de fideos, y otros productos. La señora Maria tiene el gran anhelo de independizarse, es decir tener su propio capital, de esa manera hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Milca

texts.es:
Milka is dedicated to the sale of fish but there is currently a shortage making her unable to continue this activity; nevertheless she works as a maid for now. She would like to return to her routine once the city lifts its restriction on fishing since she has many plans for how to improver her sales. In this opportunity she would like to receive a long to improve her dwelling to provide a more comfortable living area to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Milca, se dedica a la venta de pescado, pero por la temporada y la escasez del mismo, no está ejerciendo esta actividad, sin embargo trabaja en una casa como empleada doméstica. Su deseo de volver a su habitual rutina una vez que concluya la restricción en su ciudad la tiene muy contenta debido a que tiene muchos planes de mejora. En esta oportunidad desea adquirir un préstamo para mejorar su morada a fin de otorgarle un espacio cómodo a sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to improve her dwelling

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Miss Elena P. Díaz is thirty-two years old, is a single woman, who lives in the city of Ybycuí. She has worked as a hairdresser for eight years. As she did not have the opportunity to pursue her studies, from a young age, she had to emigrate to the neighboring country, Argentina, in search of work and better opportunities.

Once she was in Argentina, she found work as an assistant in the hairdresser’s, where she learned the profession. She worked and saved money for a good time until she succeeded in raising enough money to return to Paraguay and establish her own business. Today, Elena has a beautiful salon in the neighborhood that is always busy.

She is very eager to continue expanding her business. As a result, she wants a loan so that she will be able to buy supplies like creams, shampoo, conditioners, brushes, curlers, hair dyes, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Elena P. Díaz tiene 32 años de edad, es de estado civil soltera vive en la ciudad de Ybycuí se desempeña como peluquera desde hace 8 años. Como no tuvo la posibilidad de realizar sus estudios de muy joven tuvo que emigrar al vecino país, Argentina, en busca de trabajo y mejores oportunidades.

Una vez en Argentina, ella consiguió trabajo como ayudante en una peluquería en donde aprendió la profesión, trabajo y ahorro por un buen tiempo hasta que logro reunir un capital para volver a Paraguay y montar su propio negocio. Así es como hoy día, Elena, tiene una hermosa peluquería muy concurrida en el barrio.

Ella está muy deseosa de seguir expandiendo su negocio por lo que desea un crédito para poder comprar insumos como cremas, shampoo, acondicionadores, cepillos, ruleros (tubos para el pelo), tinturas, entre otros.

loans.use: To buy supplies like creams, shampoo, conditioners, brushes, curlers, hair dyes, among other things

loans.name: Siguitèmasson (C’Est Le Travail Qui Paye) Group

texts.fr:
The six members of Siguitèmasson group are an average 41 years old and have on average 4 children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands and co-spouses, parents-in-law, brothers and sisters, and their children in the Ouassila Wèrè section of the village of Ouassila, Ségou Prefecture (Republic of Mali). The members of the Siguitèmasson group are linked by bonds of kinship and friendship. In view of their mutual confidence, they decided to ask for a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan (jointly liable loan) with the institution, after a series of four training courses.

The members of the Siguitèmasson group sell firewood, cereals, soap, and yams. With the loan they expect to buy 3 cartloads of firewood, 150 kg of cereals, 1 sack of yams, ½ sack of locally fabricated soap, 2 cases of detergent. They buy the firewood locally (they have a permit allowing them to cut wood, issued by the office responsible for nature conservation of Ségou). As for the cereals, they purchase them in neighboring villages (such as Konodimini). The soap and the yams are bought in Ségou.

The sale of these articles is generally done in the village, retail, for cash and on credit out of their homes and on the village square. The wood is sold in Ségou or to merchants coming from Ségou. Their clients are generally women and a few men.

They hope to have an average monthly profit of 6,000 FCFA (about US$ 15) that they will use to help their husbands pay family expenses, investing any remainder in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les six (6) membres du groupe Siguitèmasson ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris des coépouses les beaux parents les frères et sœurs et leurs enfants dans le quartier Ouassila Wèrè du village de Ouassila, préfecture de Ségou (république du Mali). Les membres du groupe Siguitèmasson sont liés par des liens de parenté et d’amitié. En raison de la confiance mutuelle, elles ont décidé de solliciter un prêt auprès de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe (crédit solidaire) avec l’institution. Après une série de quatre formations.

Les membres du groupe Siguitèmasson, exercent le commerce du bois de chauffe, des céréales, des savons et des tubercules. Avec le prêt elles comptent acheter 3 chargements de charrette, 150 kg de céréales 1sac de tubercule, 1/2 sac de savon de fabrication locale, 2 cartons de savon de lessives. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place en bois de chauffe (elles deteinnent un permis de coupe de bois délivré par les services compétents de la conservation de la nature de Ségou). Pour les céréales, elles achètent dans les villages voisins (tel Konodimini). Pour le savon, les tubercules les achats se font à Ségou.

La vente de ces articles se fait généralement au village en détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile et sur la place publique du village. Par contre le bois est vendu à Ségou ou à des commerçants venant de Ségou. Leurs clients sont généralement des femmes et quelques hommes.

Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 6.000FCFA qu’elles utiliseront à aider leurs maris à subvenir aux charges de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.

loans.use:
Purchase and splitting of firewood; cereals; soap and yams

Achat et coupe de bois de chauffe ; céréales ; des savons et des tubercules.

loans.name: Rincón De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
The Committee called "Corner of Hope" is one of the first committees formed in the zone of villa CONAVI Limpio, thanks to a promotion carried out by these same ladies of the area. Four prior meetings were held where the interested women learned more about the enterprising women Committee program.

In the meetings we share many experiences of the ladies with their businesses. In the beginning the meetings were attended by 20 ladies, some of whom have already left and others who continue with the program. At present the committee consists of 20 ladies with different commercial activities, always according to the agreements of the committee. At present they are in the 6th loan cycle of the program. The line of credit that they manage is between 300,000 Guaranis and 1,000,000 Guaranis for each member, according to the cycle in which they joined the group.

The loan requested will be used by each member to purchase work tools, merchandise and/or commodities for making the products that will finally be sold. The majority of the members of the committee are dedicated to independent work such as the sale of foods, jewelry, perfumes, fruits, cleaning articles, garmets, etc.

They are people that work arduously in their respective business. They always say that, at the start they could not count on anything. Now, thanks to the Paraguayan Foundation, they have the possibility of growing. The dream of the group is to be able to count on a business in community, not only to grow their income, but also to continue working together as they so much enjoy to do.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Comité “Rincón de la Esperanza” es uno de los primeros comités formados en la zona de villa CONAVI Limpio, gracias a una promoción que realizaron las mismas señoras de la zona. Se realizaron cuatro reuniones previas al crédito en donde las interesadas se interiorizaron más a cerca del programa Comité de mujeres emprendedoras.

En las reuniones compartimos muchas experiencias de las señoras con sus negocios. Al comenzar las reuniones asistieron 20 señoras de las cuales algunas ya han salido y otras continúan con el programa actualmente siguen siendo 20 señoras con diferentes actividades comerciales, todas siempre estuvieron de acuerdo con los compromisos del comité. Actualmente se encuentran en el 6º ciclo del programa, la línea de crédito que manejan es de a partir de 300.000 guaraníes hasta 1.000.000 guaraníes por cada integrante, según lo que le corresponde de acuerdo con el ciclo en el que se encuentran.

Lo solicitado en el crédito cada una de las integrantes utilizará para la compra de herramientas de trabajo o para la compra de mercaderías y/o materias primas para la elaboración del producto que finalmente llevarán a la venta. La mayoría de las integrantes del comité se dedican al trabajo independiente como por ejemplo: venta de comidas, de bijouteries, de perfumes, venta de frutas, venta de comestibles, costureras, venta de artículos de limpieza, etc.

Son personas que trabajan arduamente en sus respectivos negocios, siempre recuerdan que al iniciarse no contaban con nada hoy en día gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya ellas tienen la posibilidad de crecer. El sueño del grupo es poder contar con un negocio en comunidad, no solo para aumentar sus ingresos si no también para seguir trabajando juntas como a ellas tanto les gusta hacer.
texts.en:
The Committee called "Corner of Hope" is one of the first committees formed in the zone of villa CONAVI Limpio, thanks to a promotion carried out by these same ladies of the area. Four prior meetings were held where the interested women learned more about the enterprising women Committee program.

In the meetings we share many experiences of the ladies with their businesses. In the beginning the meetings were attended by 20 ladies, some of whom have already left and others who continue with the program. At present the committee consists of 20 ladies with different commercial activities, always according to the agreements of the committee. At present they are in the 6th loan cycle of the program. The line of credit that they manage is between 300,000 Guaranis and 1,000,000 Guaranis for each member, according to the cycle in which they joined the group.

The loan requested will be used by each member to purchase work tools, merchandise and/or commodities for making the products that will finally be sold. The majority of the members of the committee are dedicated to independent work such as the sale of foods, jewelry, perfumes, fruits, cleaning articles, garmets, etc.

They are people that work arduously in their respective business. They always say that, at the start they could not count on anything. Now, thanks to the Paraguayan Foundation, they have the possibility of growing. The dream of the group is to be able to count on a business in community, not only to grow their income, but also to continue working together as they so much enjoy to do.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and merchandise such as: lingerie, meats, vegetables and fruits, delicacies, perfumes, cosmetics, threads, fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en:
Shafiga B. is 53 years old and is married with four children. 

Shafiga has been running her business for more than 15 years. She is selling women's clothing and underwear. This business is the only financial income in her family; this income is sufficient for supporting the family but not enough to improve their living conditions. 

Now Shafiga has applied for a loan of 1000 USD. She plans to use the loan to increase her working capital. The generated income will be used for purchasing women's clothes for the winter season. She thanks everyone who supports her!

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es: La señora Julia Estela P. Ampie, tiene la edad de 44 años habita en Ticuantepe; esta señora es  madre soltera  tiene  a su cargo 2 hijas que actualmente estudian su secundaria en el instituto de Ticuantepe. Esta señora tiene una pulpería ubicada en su vivienda y tiene por nombre pulpería P.. Esta señora también trabaja como operaria en una zona franca para poder ayudarse con los gastos de la casa, sus hija le ayudan con la pulpería ya que una va a clase por la mañana y la otra por la tarde, el mayor sueño de doña Julia es darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijas por lo cual decidió pedir un préstamo para incrementar su negocio y obtener mejores ganancia.
texts.en:
Julia Estela Perez is 44 years old and lives in Ticuantepe. She is a single mother who cares for 2 daughters who attend highschool. Julia runs a small general store from her home. She also works in a duty free shop to help cover the household costs. Her daughters help her with the business, as one goes to class in the morning and the other goes in the afternoon. Julia's dream is to be able to provide a better quality of life for her children, which is why she is requesting the loan to grow her business and increase her income.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small general store, increase her income, and provide a better quality of life for her two daughters.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi: Chị  Bùi Thị Cảnh năm nay 50 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004 .Hiện tại gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi, làm thúng cho thu nhập khoảng 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài thời gian chăn nuôi làm thúng bán  tại nhà chị Cảnh còn tranh thủ thời gian đi bắt ốc bán cho thu nhập 1.000.000đ/ tháng. Với nguồn thu nhập này ngoài việc hoàn trả vốn theo quy định gia đình chị còn tiết kiệm và đầu tư thêm vào chăn nuôi tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang có kế hoạch đầu tư vào dịch vụ khoan cắt bê tông nên chị xin vay 6.000.000đ để mua máy móc.
texts.en:
Mrs Bùi Thị Cảnh is 50 years old. She became a TYM fund member in 2004. Today she and her family raise animal and make bamboo baskets for a living. On top of that she picks/sells snails to increase her earning, this bring in an extra 1.000.000 VND a month. After making her payment toward the loan she is able to put away some savings and invest some in her animal raising business. She and her family have a new business plan: offer a service to cut concrete. They need a loan of 6.000.000 VND to buy a concrete cutting machine.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy concrete cutting machine

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok R. is 50-years old and resides in the Ptasrong Commune in Pursat Province. She is married with seven children, four of whom are students, and three are married and live away home. Her husband, Noun Thom, is 49 years old. The couple are local cultivators who have owned farmland for growing various kinds of plants like fruit trees and vegetable crops. Sok and Thom are requesting a loan to buy additional farmland. The loan will help them to increase their income and sustain their family's living expenses. (Mrs. Sok R. is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase additional farmland

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda O. is a graduate of the University of Port Harcourt, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and married with three children. She sells baby clothes. Because she plans to increase her stock, Linda is requesting a loan of N100,000 (US $700) to purchase more baby clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more baby clothes to sell

loans.name: Anyell

texts.es: La joven Anyell tiene 27 años de edad, reside en villa Venezuela, casada y con una niña, su esposo se desempaña de albañil, ella trabaja de impulsadora en  una empresa  Unilever desde hace tres años, su anhelo  es poder terminar de hacer su casa, y tener mas seguridad `por la delincuencia, este es su tercer quinta solicitud que han sido de mucho beneficio ya que con cada préstamo hace una mejora a su casa, con esta préstamo va comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en la parte frontal lo cual va a comprar piedra, arena, cemento y otros. Sus planes hacia un futuro es poder echar muro a todo alrededor de la casa lo cual va ir poco a poco con el apoyo de préstamo que Afodenic le otorgue.
texts.en:
Anyell is 27 years old and lives in the town of Venezuela. She is married with one daughter. Her husband works as a bricklayer and she has worked as a sales promoter with a company called Unilever for the past three years. She wants to be able to finish her house and for it to be more secure. This is her fifth loan—the loans have been very beneficial because each time she completes a home improvement project. With this loan she is going to buy construction materials to build a wall in front of her home. She will buy rocks, sand, cement and other materials. In the future she plans to extend the wall around her entire home, which she will complete part-by-part with the help of the Afodenic loans.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a fence

loans.name: Faqer Sha

texts.en: Faqer S. lives in District 15 in Kabul Afghanistan. He is married and lives there with his extended family. Faqer S. has a gas shop and is very hard worker with a lot of experience in his work, so he wants to expand his business. He is requesting an individual loan of 50000 Afghan for the term of 16 months to expand his stock and increase his monthly income to help support his family.

loans.use: To enlarge his business and buy the necessary materials for his shop

loans.name: Haibutllah

texts.en:
Haibutllah is 23 years old, married, and lives in Ningarhar Province. He graduated from 12th class, but because of some problems he couldn't further his education. Instead, he is working on his own land as a farmer and he has animals.   


He has five children; and he has a lot of dreams for the future of the children. Because the income of a farmer is not enough for his living expenses, he wants to buy necessary things for the land to increase his income. 


So he contacted AFSG and he requested to take 50,000 AF as a loan for 27 months. He wants to buy seeds and other essential equipment for his land to increase his production and sell it easily in the bazaar. He thanks the lenders through AFSG  for helping poor people.

loans.use: Buying more seeds for his land

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
M. Jamila is a married mother of an enthusiastic family. She is a very hard worker, who rises early in the morning to feed her cattle. She wants to increase the set-up of her business to improve earnings. She works for the well-being and happiness of her 4 children. In order satisfy her goal for a higher quality of life, Jamila needs to buy more cattle for raising and later selling, for which she seeks a loan of 500 USD for a term of 12 months. Let’s support this hard-working and talented woman so that she can obtain her goals!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana A. is 61 years old and married with five children. She has a poultry farm where she rears birds and she also sells palm oil. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Tatu is a clothing seller in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $50. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her third loan through BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Tatu is 21 years old, married, and has a 2-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Halima, who has her own small shop in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cherlie

texts.en:
"We are tenant farmers. We are tilling the land that we will never own. Farming is the only thing that sustains our family. We use our harvest to feed our family and to buy the things we need. Now, we only have a small farm and owned by our friend. Someday, our wish is to buy our own farm to be able to support our children better," says Cherlie M., a 34-year-old mother of three children. 

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase complete fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will really help her to improve their harvest. She is also interested to venture into another business loan in the future.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Marília Ivone Simeão

texts.pt:
Marília Ivone Simeão M. de 52 anos nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, estudou até quarta classe. Solteira e mãe de dois filhos maiores todos vão a escola, sustenta um netinho. 

Veio viver em Boane em 2000, tendo antes vivido na cidade de Xai-Xai Província de Gaza com o ex marido. Actualmente vive na casa própria.

Trabalha 15 hrs por dia para suprir as necessidades básicas da família, este é o terceiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku e nunca trabalhou com outra instituição financeira. Com o empréstimo de 13,000.00MT pretende aumentar o stock no seu negocio e esperar que a renda também aumente. 

Sendo única actividade de sobrevivência da família, no futuro pretende reforçar mais a sua capacidade e volume de negocio para poder aguentar a concorrência que cada dia vai crescendo.
texts.en:
Marília Ivone Simeão M. is 52 years old and was born in Manjacaze, in Gaza Province. She studied through fourth grade. She is single and the mother of two young adults who both go to school, in addition to supporting a young grandchild.

She moved to Boane in 2000, previously having lived with her ex-husband in the city of Xai-Xai in Gaza Province. Now she lives in her own home.

Marília works 15 hours a day to meet the basic needs of her family. This is her third loan from Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner), and she has never worked with another financial institution. With the loan of 13,000 MT (meticais), she intends to increase the stock at her business and hopes that the profit will increase as well.

Having only this one income-generating activity to support the family, Marília intends in the future to increase the business's capacity and volume in order to withstand the competition that is constantly growing.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory in her business

loans.name: Maual Group

texts.en:
Maual is the group leader of Maual group. There are five members in this group and each of them wants to progress their business and make it larger.

Maual wants to take a loan for his fruit and vegetables shop.

Seema G. wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Maboba wants to take a loan for her husband who has general store.

Sheren Aqha wants to take a loan for his pizza shop.

Amana wants to take a loan for her embroidery and tailoring business.

So they are requested a group loan of 50,000 Afghani and they are very thankful to AFS and to Kiva lenders who are able to support the whole world.

loans.use: To progress his business

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Хаитов Сафарали проживает в Вахшском районе. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Сафарали по специальности "строитель". Он более 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Клиент  просит кредит, для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян риса, т.к. он выращивает рис.
texts.en:
46-year-old Safarali H. lives in the Vahshskom district. He is married and has seven children. While Safarali's specialization is as a construction worker, he has been engaged in farming for more than ten years. The client is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for rice plants.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Medarda Elizabeth

texts.es: Medarda Elizabeth R. R. reside en el municipio de Colon ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Medarda cuenta con 25 años de edad vive con su esposo y su pequeña hija Andrea de 3 años de edad, William esposo de Madarda es empleado y aporta a la familia $200.00 US mensuales. Medarda posee una sala de belleza hace siete años la cual ha ido creciendo y ganando popularidad en la zona ahora Medarda a surtido su sala de belleza con productos para el cabello de esta manera logra generar más ingresos para la familia, ahora ella a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que sus ventas y demanda en su productos ha ido aumentando y desea comprar variedad de productos nuevos para surtir su  negocio.
texts.en:
Medarda Elizabeth R. R. lives in the town of Colon, located in the district of La Libertad. She is 25 years old and lives with her husband and young daughter Andrea, who is 3 years old. Her husband William is employed and earns $200 USD each month for their family.

For seven years, Medarda has been operating a beauty salon that is growing and gaining popularity in the area. She now needs to restock her salon with hair products so that she can generate more income for her family. Since her sales and the demand for her merchandise have been increasing, Medarda decided to apply for a loan so that she can buy a variety of new products to sell at her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to restock her salon

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is thirty-two years old. She is divorced and has one child. She sells porridge and groundnuts (peanuts) in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods, popularly enjoyed as breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread.

With a large customer base, Linda wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise a good income to support her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa S. is a rice grower from trento Agusan del Sur. she has two children. Her eldest is just 8 years old. The income that she makes from her farm has helped her family buy food, clothes and other basic needs.She would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay the owner of the equipment that she used during land preparation and buy farming necessities.

She started in CEVI since 2008 and she said that CEVI is helping her a lot improve her harvest. receiving another loan from CEVI will also help her gaian manage well their rice field.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary B. is currently in the business of selling beer and local alcohol at home and is requesting a loan to open up a bar at the market. Hillary is 29 years old and is married to a soldier. She has two children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children’s school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bar at the market.

loans.name: Srey Yi

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Yi H. and her husband, Mr. Pen Yang, are duck breeders. They live in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. They have two children:  one helps with the business and the other one is attending the local school. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Srey Yi H. decided to ask for a loan to buy 160 ducks.

loans.use: To buy 160 ducks

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.en:
Cayetano Gerapuso, 38 years old, is a farmer. His main crop is rice because people are buying it all the time. He is hoping that someday, he will be able to grow his business and increase his income to pay the daily expenses in their home. He said that his rice farm business is doing great. He expects to have something greater by buying the things needed to grow his harvest.

He needs another loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Your support on this loan will be very helpful to pay the laborers as well as the equipment he rented during land preparation. He likes the services of CEVI because aside from loans, it provides insurance and low interest rates as well.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Elizabeth Akinyi

texts.en:
Elizabeth has an open-air stand in the Kisumu market where she sells bed linens including blankets, comforters, bedcovers and sheets. Her location is busy but she is challenged when it rains or is scorching hot. She also deals with a great deal of competition. In addition to the bed linens, she has another stand selling children's clothes. Her ultimate business goal is to have a boutique in downtown Kisumu.

Elizabeth is married and has one daughter in lower primary school. She is hardworking and ambitious and dreams of building a big house and educating her daughter.

loans.use: To buy more bedcovers, comforters, blankets and nets to sell

loans.name: Maribel Andrea

texts.es: La señorita Maribel Andre es originaria de la comunidad de Chimente del municipio de Totonicapan donde hace cinco años inicio su propio negocio en la confeecion de playeras, gorras, sus principales punto de ventas son los departamento de Totonicapàn, Chimaltenango y Santa Cruz del Quiche hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales, como tela, forro, cono, y otros para aprovechar las fiesta de fin de año y como el inicio del ciclo escolar dos mil diez para los uniformes de los niños y niñas, y con los ingreso poder mejor el nivel de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Maribel Andre is originally from the community of Chimente in the municipality of Totonicapan. Five years ago she started her own business making shirts and hats which she sells in Totonicapán, Chimaltenango, and Santa Cruz del Quiche. Now she is asking for a loan in order to buy materials like cloth, lining, and cones to be able to make items for new years eve parties and school uniforms the start of the school year in early 2010. With her earnings she will be able to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose P. sells charcoal in the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Rose is 37 years old and is married to a teacher. She has 3 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to open a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Rose from  South Sudan

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón distante a 15 Km de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se conformó el grupo denominado San José, nombre por el cual han optado por ser miembros D. barrio con dicho nombre, quienes luego de interiorizarse sobre el reglamento de CME, aceptaron y conformaron dicho comité por los múltiple beneficios que presenta el programa, está integrada por 16 activas y luchadoras  mujeres, encontrándose en el octavo ciclo, sacrificándose al máximo para salir adelante, pues cada una de ellas han invertido en sus respectivas actividades, gracias a eso han mejorado considerablemente la calidad de vida tanto de ellas como la de sus familias.
Cada integrante realiza una actividad independiente pero de forma muy organizada de modo a que las actividades no resulten muy común y todas puedan beneficiarse de igual manera, así algunas se dedican a la venta de ropa, o de comida y otros.
Doña Felisa O. es de profesión costurera y tiene 6 hijos en edad escolar por quienes lucha con su marido de profesión albañil para darle la mejor educación posible. Ella posee un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde recibe los trabajos sobre medida, confecciona ropa de todo tipo como vestidos pantalones para damas y caballeros.
Por su buen trabajo ella posee un numero importante de clientes especialmente de vestidos en estas épocas de fiestas, por ello ha solicitado el crédito para la compra de algunas herramientas de trabajo.

1
Juana Sánchez
Almacén
2
Cecilia DelV.
Venta de carbón
3
Rossana C.
Venta de comestibles
4
Vidalina Ojeda
Venta de comestibles
5

Venta de frutas y verduras

texts.en:
The San José group, so named because its members are from the San José neighborhood, is located in Yaguarón, 15 kilometers from the city of Paraguarí. This group, which has committed itself to the rules of communal borrowing, is made up of 16 active and hardworking women. This is their eighth loan cycle and they have made great sacrifices to get ahead, each woman investing in her respective business. Thanks to this, they have considerably improved the quality of life of both themselves and their families.

Every member of the group works independently but in a very organized way so that their businesses to not compete with each other and everyone can benefit equally. For example, some some sell clothing, others food, etc.
