Doña Felisa O. is a seamstress and works hard with her husband, who is a construction worker, to provide her 6 school-aged children the best education possible. She has a small shop in her home where she takes in work, creating all kinds of clothing, including dresses and pants, for men and women. Because she is known for her good work, she has a many customers who have ordered special dresses for the Christmas season. She is requesting a loan to purchase some supplies for her business.

The group's members are: Juana Sánchez (shop owner), Cecilia DelV. (charcoal sales), Rossana C. (grocery sales), Vidalina Ojeda (grocery sales), Elva V. (fruit and vegetable sales), Edith M. (housekeeper), Leonida T. (housekeeper), Olga Y. (pork sales), Amada G. (housekeeper), Salustiana Orué (shop owner), Ignacia DelV. (housekeeper), Rocio A. (grocery sales), Felisa O. (seamstress), Gladys C. (beverage sales), Alejandra León (fruit and vegetable sales), and Lilia C. (housekeeper).

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Angela Asunción

texts.es:
Ángela es socia del  al Banco Comunal Pedregal desde hace 13 ciclo, este banco esta  ubicado en la provincia de Manabí en la costa ecuatoriana,  ella vive en Picoaza y se dedica a la venta de legumbres en el mercado de Portoviejo su jornada laboral empieza muy temprano  desde las 4 de la mañana esta en pie para ir a vender, el lunes es el único día que no sale al mercado.

No es nada fácil realizar este trabajo comenta Ángela, pero ha sabido sacarlo adelante con la ayuda de su familia pues ya lleva 15 años laborando  en el mercado. Con este nuevo crédito solicitado la señora Ángela podrá cancelar a sus proveedores mayoristas de pedidos anteriores  y la diferencia comprará  zanahoria, tomate, cebolla colorada, acelga y más legumbres para abastecer su puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Angela has been a member of the Pedregal Communal Bank through 13 cycles. This bank is located in the province of Manabí on the Ecuadorian coast. She lives in Picoaza and dedicates herself to selling vegetables in the Portoviejo market. Her daily labors begin very early; by 4:00 in the morning she is on her way to the market to sell. Monday is the only day she doesn't go to the market. It isn't easy to do this work, comments Angela, but she has learned how to carry it forward with the help of her family. She has been working in the market 15 years. With this new loan she requests, Angela will pay off her wholesale providers' old bills, and with the difference she will buy carrots, tomatoes, colored onions, salt-wort and other vegetables to resupply her post in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CARROTS, TOMATOES, ONIONS AND OTHER VEGETABLES TO SELL

loans.name: Anita Del Carmen

texts.es:
La ciudad de Azogues  es la capital de la Provincia del Cañar, se halla localizada en la Hoya del río Paute goza de un clima templado  por su ubicación geográfica, además podemos disfrutar de la belleza del Santuario Franciscano, aún mantiene su arquitectura  colonial  haciéndola una  ciudad  muy hermosa, su gente cordial y  amable acogen al turista nacional y extranjero, además se caracterizan por ser personas  muy luchadoras y firmes para salir adelante y siempre brindarles lo mejor a su familia como nuestras socias.

Anita H. es socia del banco comunal Barrio Nuevo desde hace tres ciclos  motivada por su compadre quien le informo de estos créditos y los beneficios que ofrece la Fundación ESPOIR, los préstamos recibidos los ha utilizado en la compra de materiales para realizar  sus manualidades como muñecos en tela, pintura en tela, adornos, bordados,  etc. ha realzado cursos para aprender y también por habilidad.

Anita tiene 30 años de edad   vive en la comunidad Barrio Nuevo con sus tres hijos  de 8, 7, 5 años  puesto que su esposo migró al extranjero para brindarles un mejor futuro.
 

Con el dinero del  crédito solicitado  va a comprar mesas, sillas, cafetera, mostrador para montar su cafetería y hacer su sueño realidad;  su meta salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
The city of Azogues is the capital of the Cañar province. It is located in the Hoya del Río Paute. Because of its geographical location it enjoys a mild climate. Also, we can enjoy the beauty of Franciscan Sanctuary. It maintains its colonial architecture, making it a beautiful city. The people are friendly and likeable, and they welcome national and foreign tourists. They are also characterized as being fighters. They are steadfast about getting ahead and always giving the best to their families, just like our members. Anita H. has been a member of the Barrio Nuevo Communal Bank for three cycles. She was motivated by her friend who told her about the loans and the benefits offered by the ESPOIR Foundation. She has used the loans she has received to buy materials to make handicrafts like stuffed animals, fabric paintings, decorations, and embroidery, etc. She has taken courses to learn, and she also has a talent for it. Anita, 30, lives in the Barrio Nuevo community with her three children; 8, 7, and 5. Her husband moved abroad to give them a better future. With the money from the loan she has requested she will buy tables, chairs, a coffeepot, and counter to establish her café and make her dream a reality. Her goal is to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs, a coffee pot, and counter, etc.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a rice farmer. She has faced a lot of challenges, especially when she is financially lacking, but she is determined to continue in her business. A married woman with five children, she works hard to supply her family with food, clothes and their other needs. One of her priorities is to give all her children a proper education.

Luzminda joined CEVI, a Kiva partner, in January to gain access to its program. She requested to borrow 6,000 Philippine pesos, which she will use to buy the farm supplies she needs, such as seeds, fertilizers and other items.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Mirzodjon

texts.ru: Кабутов Мирзоджон проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Мирзоджон не имеет высшего образования. Работает в своей мастерской. Он в основном занимается ремонтом автомашин. В этой области имеет большой опыт. Кредит берет для покупки инструментов, чтобы предоставить качественную услугу.
texts.en:
Mirzodjon K. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. Mirzodjon does not have a higher education. He works at his own repair shop and primarily repairs cars. He has a lot of experience in this field. Mirzodjon is requesting this loan for the purchase of tools in order to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua S. sells locally produced cooking utensils, coal pots and other items at Elmina.  Efua has a senior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a painter. Efua has been locally manufacturing utensils for quite some time now. She helps her husband take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy other locally made cooking utensils to meet the increasing demand and satisfaction of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy locally made cooking utensils.

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es: Guísela tiene 31 años, casada y vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos, mientras que su esposo, quien es comerciante, vive en Lima, pero cuando puede los visita. Para ella lo más importante es mejorar su calidad de vida, es por ello que tiene su restaurante, establecimiento que es muy concurrido en la ciudad de Tarma. Todos los días sus clientes acuden a su restaurante para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una muy buena cocinera, ya que desde pequeña lleva esa afición, que hasta el momento cocina con mucho esmero y dedicación. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su establecimiento, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola. Más adelante, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante y así poder darles más comodidad a sus clientes. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, por lo que espera continuar siendo muy puntual como en anteriores créditos. Por otro lado se siente muy a gusto trabajar con su grupo comunal, en donde es muy participativa. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más ingredientes para cocinar en mayor proporción, debido a que tiene más demanda de su comida.
texts.en:
Guísela is 31 years old and married. She lives in her own home with her two dear children. Her husband, who is a merchant, lives in Lima but visits them when he can. The most important thing for her is to improve their quality of life. That is why she has a restaurant. It is a very well frequented establishment in the city of Tarma. Her customers come to her restaurant every day to taste the delicious menus she prepares. She is a very good cook. She has been very enthusiastic about it since she was little and until now cooks with great care and dedication. She has been working as a cook for 5 years. She thinks the most difficult part is waiting on all the people that come into her establishment since she has to work alone a lot of the time. She hopes to improve the infrastructure of her restaurant in the future and make her customers more comfortable this way. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she hopes to continue to be punctual as with previous loans. On the other hand she feels very happy working with her village group where she participates a lot. She is applying for a thousand PEN to buy more ingredients in order to cook in greater proportion since her food is in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more ingredients to prepare more food.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N., 44, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for good quality rice products. She sells groceries for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

N. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mantelar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité de MANTELAR est créé en octobre 2002, il est composé de 8membres issus du même village NIAFOR. Le groupe de MATELAR est l'un des 08 groupes qui composent le Banc Villageois de NIAFOR. Les membres du groupe ont en moyenne une quarantaine d'années et sont mères d'au moins 04 enfants. 

Elle font en général du commerce d'huile de palme, d'arachide et du maraîchage. 

Pour intensifier leurs activités et augmenter leur pouvoir d'achat elles ont décidé d'intégrer en octobre 2002 l'institution micro-financier CAURIE-MF pour bénéficier des ses services. Elles ont pratiquement une ancienneté de 8ans et demi dans le système et tous leurs prêts ont été toujours remboursés sans difficultés.

Leurs nouveaux prêts leur permettront de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises et de développer des activités maraîchères. 

La responsable du Groupe, Fanda toumane N. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge et tutrice d'un autre enfant de son beau frère. Elle fait la culture de la patate douce, du commerce d'arachide et d'huile de palme.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges financières de la maison et de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group MANTELAR was estabished in October 2002.  It is composed of eight members from the same village of NIAFOR.  The group is one of eight groups that make up Banc Villageois de NIAFOR.  The group members average about 40 years of age and are the mothers of at least four children.  In general, their commerce involves palm oil, peanut oil, and market gardening.   To intensify their businesses and to increase their buying power, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution CAURIE-MF in October 2002.  The purpose was to receive some of its services.  They have practically 8½ years of seniority in the system.  Their loans have always been repaid without difficulties.  Their new loans will enable them to do better in supplying themselves with goods and in developing their market garden businesses.  The supervisor of the group, Fanda Toumane N., is 43 years old.  She is married and the mother of six children to support, and she is the guardian of another child of her brother-in-law.  Fanda grows sweet potatoes and sells peanut oil and palm oil.  Her goal is to support her husband in paying for the various house expenses and to take part in covering the children's schooling costs. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering the goupe's ability to stock up on goods

loans.name: Lurcille

texts.en:
Lurcille B. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Lurcille is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lurcille owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lurcille has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lurcille joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lurcille has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lurcille is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Lurcille from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Seath

texts.en: Mrs. K. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears in the photo here. K. is a domestic cultivator who owns a plot of farmland to grow crops to earn a living. Her husband is skilled in making wooden boats and is using this knowledge to earn money. He is hired by neighbors to make their  boats usable for fishing. Recently, he got many jobs from his clients but he lacks some implements required to perform his service. K. has requested a loan for her husband to buy accessories he uses to build boats.

loans.use: To buy accessories needed for boat building.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. C. is from the village of  Valencia City. She is 37 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. Jocelyn owns & operates a food business, making and selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
In his late 40’s, it’s hard to imagine that Frank T., who has been running an agricultural enterprise for over 10 years, is still at his best proving to fellow businessmen that he can make it. Having been inspired by his late father for quite some time, hard-working Frank got a vision to start up a banana-selling business alongside his milk sales enterprise. He has been practicing this from Mugamba, Rukungiri, where he earns approximately $200 on a monthly basis.

However, his main problem is dealing with low quantity harvests; therefore, he needs this loan to purchase mulch and manure for his plantation. This will make it possible for him to earn more revenue and care for his family of seven children and a wife at home.

loans.use: to buy mulches and fertilizer for his banana plantation

loans.name: Saroem's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saroem N. is a group leader and was born in 1967. She was selected by the four members in Trapeang Trach village, Takeo province. All the members will use a portion of their loan in varied ways to support their businesses in this current year. Mrs. Saroem N. is a chicken seller at her local market where she can earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Siem Eng, is a construction worker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. To improve her current business, Mrs. Saroem N. is applying for a loan to buy more chicken to resell. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are attending local school.

loans.use: To buy more chicken to resell

loans.name: Music Retailer Group

texts.en:
Thomas T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Music Retailer. Thomas is 41 years old, married and has seven children who range from 3 to 19 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to a lack of financial support.

For 3 years, he has been selling DVD discs in Redlight Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more DVD discs.

His dream is to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, F. is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more DVD discs.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida C. is from the village of Balide, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 35 years old. Loida is single and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Loida owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling toys, umbrellas, and school supplies in the local community. Loida has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Loida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Loida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Loida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Isata, who is a married mother of two children, aged six and ten years, and has one additional dependent living with her, her nephew, who she is helping to educate. In 2007, Isata established her ready-made items business to help support her husband provide for the needs of their family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 800,000SLL every month from this business.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000SLL. in order to add more stock to her business. Isata hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000SLL. In the future, she plans to educate her children to university and buy a piece of land. Isata thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat is a hard-working business owner from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Her business is selling the fabrics used for sewing the national dresses. Sharofat has been running her business for 12 years and has gained much experience. She is divorced from her husband and has two children. Sharofat’s business has become the main source of income for her family. Her son also is engaged in her business. Sharofat has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni to add to her working capital. Her business is growing. Financial assistance will help her to continue operating successfully and supporting her family.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to offer poor and low-income clients a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Gibson Muasa

texts.en: Gibson Muasa M. is a 35 year old café owner and fish monger in Kilifi. He is married to Mueni Muasa who contributes to the family’s total income; the couple supports six people. He has been in this business for the last five years and he is doing great. This is his third loan from KADET. Gibson would like to purchase a deep freezer with the loan money and buy more fish inventory for his shop. He will use the anticipated profits to start a saloon business for his wife. In future he hopes the business will be fully expanded and that he will be in a position to cater for all of his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer to stock the fish that he sells.

loans.name: Stone Quarry Development Group 2-Mukono

texts.en: 46-year-old N. Alice belongs to the Stone Quarry Group-Mukono. This industrious woman has been building a stone quarrying enterprise for 10 years. Alice is married with 4 children. It’s with the persuasion of friends that she was able to embark on this business. Prior to this, she was selling charcoal. Her business generates 150,000 UGX weekly. With this loan, Alice says she is going to purchase more heavy-duty hammers to be used in the quarry.

loans.use: To purchase more heavy-duty hammers for work at the quarry

loans.name: Nemreh

texts.ar:
نمره عمرها 55 سنة غير متزوجة تعتمد على نفسها منذ اكثر من  26 سنة تعمل بكد                                          
ونشاط تعمل في الخياطة في المنزل لها زبائن كثر من جيرانها ومحبيها                                                         
عملها جيد جدا محبوبة ومثابرة في عملها تريد من خلال طلب من المجموعة تطوير عملها وشراء                                  
مكنة كهربائية جديدة لزيادة عملها تحلم نمره الى انشاء معمل صغير لها لكي تضمن                                           
شيخوختها فيما بعد ما يميز نمره في عملها انها تجذب الزبائن من خلال اسعارها الرخيصة لها تاريخ مشجع جدا في المجموعة
texts.en: Nemreh is a 55-year-old single, self-reliant woman. For the past twenty-six years, she has been toiling away at home as a sewing professionA.. She is popular among her customers (who come from her neighbors and friends) because she is well-liked, her work is high-quality, and she offers extremely reasonable prices. Nemreh is seeking a loan from A. Majmoua (with which she has a very encouraging credit history) to procure a new electric sewing machine to increase productivity. She also dreams of setting up a small workshop to ensure for herself an income for when she becomes too old to work.

loans.use: Purchase new electric sewing machine

loans.name: Shaloom Group

texts.en:
Charles L. is in his late twenties and is married with 7-year-old twins. He has been selling women's sandals for 10 years. He works from 10:00 am to 7:00 pm daily and he makes a fair monthly profit.

This will be Charles's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy more sandals and successfully paid back the loan. He is seeking a new loan to buy more sandals to increase his sales.  His dream is to be a big and popular sandals seller in his area.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group Shaloom, which totals 20 members. The members of this group will hold each other acountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Charles is in the back row, fourth from left, wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: To increase stock of sandals

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with two children, neither of whom goes to school. She also takes care of her niece and nephew.  Patricia lives in a rented house with access to electricity, but without running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food. 

For the past six years, Patricia has operated a retail shop where she works six days a week. Her main business challenges are the change of seasons and thieves. Patricia is requesting a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to purchase bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. Patricia’s goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop and to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi a 32 ans. Elle est coiffeuse de profession mais associe la vente de produits de beauté et des mèches. Elle cumule 10 ans dans cette activité et s’approvisionne  au grand marché de Lomé.  Avec  cette activité, elle a remboursé plusieurs crédits déjà.  Elle demande un prêt pour satisfaire plus de clients. La dame est entrain de coiffer une cliente.
texts.en: Akouavi is 32.  She is a trained hairdresser, and also sells beauty products and hairpieces.  She has been doing this for ten years.  She buys her supplies in the big marketplace in Lomé.  She has already repaid several loans, and is asking for another loan to be able to cope with more customers.  In the picture, she is styling a customer's hair.

loans.use: Buy beauty products and hairpieces

loans.name: Nellevine Anyango

texts.en:
Nellevine Anyango W. is twenty three years old, married to Charles Onyango and together they have two beautiful children, her husband is also a business person. Nellevine operates general stores whereby she sells cereals as aprimary business, she also sells charcoal, and kerosene at the same time, in Huruma Estate in Eldoret Town. 

She has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly income of KSH.10,000.This will be Nellevine's first loan from  KADET LTD, and she plans to add more stock in her shop like; more cereals (e.g maize), beans charcoal, and kerosene for resale. 

With the income she is going to get she plans to complete building her house which is still under construction, also raise her family's living standard. In future she plans to expand her business and also stabilize her family.

loans.use: To add more  stock; add cereals like dry maize,beans; buy more charcoal,and keresene for sale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly de 40 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Manuel de 40 años y sus 3 jóvenes hijos; juntos buscan salir adelante es por esta razón que se esfuerzan a diario. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, y esta muy contenta con su labor pues le permite entretenerse mientras le ofrece a sus amigos y conocidos, además por su capacidad de persuasión logra vender seguido. Paralelamente a esta actividad, comercializa ropa de dormir, por pedido, es decir cuando le encargan trae de los mayoristas de la ciudad  diversidad de colchas y sábanas, este negocio le genera buenas ganancias, pues los ofrece a crédito pero a mayor precio del real. Como si fuera poco durante los fines de semana se debe despertar temprano para empezar con la venta de  tamales en la puerta de una panadería, y en la labor le ayudan sus hijos, además tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un bazar en su vivienda, pues por su zona no tiene competencia. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Nelly tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de sabanas y cosméticos para tener en stock, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes que quiere concretar para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 40, lives in her own house with her 40 year old husband, Manuel, and their three young children.  Together they look to get ahead.  That is why they work hard every day.  This enterprising woman sells a very well-known brand of beauty products.  She is very happy with this work.  It allows her to enjoy herself while she sells to her friends and acquaintances.  With her power of persuasion, she manages to make frequent sales.  She also sells sleepwear by order.  This means that when she has orders, she gets a diversity of comforters and sheets from the wholesalers in the city.  This business generates good income.  She offers credit, but it is more expensive than paying in cash.

As if this weren’t enough, on the week-ends she needs to get up early to start selling tamales at the doorway of a bakery.  With her work she helps her children.  Also, she has many plans for the future like setting up a store in her house.  There is no competition in her area.

This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who made the loan possible.  The loan will allow her to keep working as she looks to make progress.  Nelly plans to use the requested loan to buy sheets and cosmetics in order to have stock.  She has various pending orders that she wants to fill to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy sheets and cosmetics to fill her customers' orders

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tamaraneh” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Salamatu T. is the leader of this group. Salamatu is 23 years old and married with one child who is attending primary school. Salamatu sells fish. She has been running this business for four years now. With the help of this loan, Salamatu will invest in her business by buying fish in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy fish in large quantity to add to her stock

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida R. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old. Zenaida is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Zenaida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling assorted products, such as junk foods, candies & biscuits, in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as junk foods & candies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Zenaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, such as junk foods & candies

loans.name: Cesáreo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Cesareo T. le está haciendo falta algunas mejorar en el exterior de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora que requiere su casa.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así comprar el material y contratar a una persona que realice los acabados que necesita su casa. 
Don Cesario es empleado del Servicio Postal Mexicano en el área de repartidos de correo, con este ingreso pagara el crédito ya que es viudo y sus hijos ya tiene su propia familia.
texts.en:
Cesáreo T.’s house needs some improvements done to the exterior, but he does not have the necessary money to make the improvements that his house needs. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy materials and hire a person to finish his house.

Cesáreo works for the Mexican Postal Service in the mail delivery department. He will pay off the loan will this income, as he is a widower and his children already have their own family.

loans.use: Expansion and finishes to the exterior of his house

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. operates a retail shop in Kawangware market in Nairobi, and besides that, she runs a cyber café  which she just  opened recently . She has been in the retail business for four years and earns an income KES. 30,000 per month.  She is a married lady with two children, and she is 26 years old.     


She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she learned about KADET LTD through a friend who is member of a group registered with KADET. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use the entire loan amount to add stock to the shop and buy a computer for the cyber café.           


Janet intends to use the anticipated profit to save and pay school fees for her children. In the future she plans to grow her business and establish a big shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop and one computer for the cyber cafe

loans.name: Nouhad

texts.en:
Nouhad is a 46 year old divorced woman, mother of one girl, and owner of a bags shop since 2008. She has 22 years of experience in this field. Nouhad used to work as a teacher, but she felt that she had to prove herself in her own business where she can invest her talent and effort in an efficient way. Nouhad struggled a lot to keep her daughter satisfied and happy, to avoid the feeling of kids who suffer from divorced parents' struggles. Nouhad had her mother and daughter's support to start this business, and she also took the strength from her friends.

Her business is improving, and it's all through the previous loan she got from Al Majmoua, which helped in improving her social life too. This time Nouhad is requesting a loan in order to introduce new products to her customers such as cosmetics and accessories. She wants her customers to  need such products the moment they step into her shop. She's respected by all of her customers, neighbors and friends. Nouhad hopes to expand through adding new products in the future.

loans.use: to add new products to her business such as cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts and repair tools

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín es un padre de familia de 50 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío Paccha que pertenece al distrtito de Chulucanas a una hora del departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y turismo.

Martín se dedica  a la crianza de ganado ovino y porcino (tiene 12 ovejas y 8 cerdos en su corral ) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas y cerdos están en la parte posterior de su casa.  A sus animales los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo los ofrece en el mercado de las distintas ciudades.  Con el dinero que va adquirir por la venta de sus ovejas y cerdos, podrá atender las necesidades diarias de su hogar y familia.  También cuenta con unas hectáreas de tierras de cultivo donde  siembra maíz y algodón.

A solicitado un préstamo Martín a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para  comprar alimentos balanceados para sus animales  asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de los mismos y también para la compra de fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo y mejore la calidad de sus productos una vez que los cosecha .

Martín es conocida en la zona por ser una hombre trabajadora, que con mucho empeño desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia,en especial la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martin is the father of a family. He is 50-years old and he lives with his wife and children in a house which they own. It is located in the community of Paccha in the district of Chulucanas. It is one hour from the department of Piura. This region's primary businesses are agricultural, farming, crafts, and tourism.

Martin has been raising sheep and pigs (he has 12 sheep and 8 pigs in his corral) for many years. The corral where he keeps his sheep and pigs is located in the rear section of his property. He raises his livestock with balanced feed and natural grasses. When they have reached an optimum size and weight he offers them for sale in the markets of different cities. With the funds he will acquire from for the sale of his sheep and pigs he will be able to provide for the daily needs of his home and family. He also has a few hectares of farm land where he cultivates corn and cotton.

Martin has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. He will purchase from Capital Semilla balanced feed for his livestock to ensure a good development and fattening. He will also purchase fertilizers for his plantation to improve the quality of the products at the time of the harvest.

Martin is known in the region for being a hard working man who is ready to work hard to provide his family with a better quality of life, especially for his children.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock and to purchase fertilizers for his farm land.

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es: Hilaria Úrsula se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Tiene más de 12 años en este negocio. Ella tiene su negocio de manera ambulante, la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran felices de los buenos productos que ofrece. El crédito es para la compra de cocos, mangos, naranjas, melones, sandias y otras frutas.  Ha sabido mantener el negocio por la buena administración ya que no ha sido fácil con todos los desafíos que ha enfrentado como es la salud, pero a pesar de eso sabe que tiene que trabajar todos los inicios.
texts.en:
Hilaria Úrsula sells fruit and vegetables.  She’s been in business over 12 years.  She is a street vendor.  Most of her customers are happy with the good products she offers.

The loan is to buy coconuts, mangoes, oranges, melons, watermelons and other fruit.  She has known how to stay in business thanks to its good administration which hasn’t been easy with all the challenges she has faced, like health issues.  However, despite this she knows she has to always work.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Aida Fabiola

texts.es:
Aida Fabiola tiene 33 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Aida se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta lavar la ropa y cocinar.
texts.en:
Aida Fabiola is 33 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children. She resides in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Señor de La Salud” (Lord of Health) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Soloma, which is part of the canton of Echeandia. The members of this Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Aida is a farmer who grows corn and rice. Her purchases are made in Ventanas and she sells at the fairs every day, especially on Sundays.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. The support from this loan will help her financially acquire the supplies she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, crop diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to buy a house.

Aida enjoys doing the laundry and cooking.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 45, a resident of GMA, in the province of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Carlito, a business man, and is the mother of seven children; one is already working, while the youngest is still in elementary school. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to send her children to college.  For most poor Filipino parents like Imelda, a college diploma is the best inheritance they could leave to their children. 
 	
Imelda operates a buy-and-sell business. Essentially, she buys wood scraps from factories, then sells them to communities as house repair materials. Customers are attracted to her business due to her low prices. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, Imelda is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan. She will be using the money to buy more scrap wood. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. She dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more scrap wood.

loans.name: Geoconda Benita

texts.es: Geoconda Benita tiene 39 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio, ella tiene que levantarse muy temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar, pues además tiene que brindarle la atención necesaria a sus hijos. A pesar de ser una actividad muy minoritaria trata de mejorar los ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa en general, cosméticos, calzado, bolsos, sabanas entre otros. Ella sueña con que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Geoconda Benita is 39 years old and sells general merchandise. She has managed her modest business for more than five years. Geoconda wakes up early to complete her household chores before attending to the needs of her children. Despite having an informal business, she tries to improve her income so that she can obtain a better quality of life.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothing, cosmetics, shoes, bags, bed sheets, and other items. Her dream is for her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, cosmetics, shoes, bags, bed sheets, and other items.

loans.name: Kathy Gioconda

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal San José este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Katty, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 14 y 5 años, la mayor este año termino el colegio pero no pudo ingresar a la universidad y los otros estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es maestro de un colegio de la localidad.
 
Ella como mujer trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante hace varios años se decidió a la venta de productos Sayson (productos de belleza, perfumería y bisutería) y hace más de un año también empezó a vender carteras y lo hace al mismo tiempo que realiza sus otras ventas, nos cuenta que trabaja todos los días y que sus productos los  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, ella  aprovecha las ofertas para comprar más barato y luego vende al precio real con lo cual se gana un dinero extra.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y carteras. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y  le gusta  por las charlas que le ayudan mucho en su vida diaria.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabí we find the 24th of May village, which is where the San José cooperative bank meets.  This area is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard-working residents that primarily dedicate themselves to farming and raising animals.

It is here that we meet Katty, 38 years of age and in a common-law marriage from which she has four children ages 17, 15, 14 and 5.  The oldest finished school this year but wasn’t able to enroll at the university, and the others are still in school.  Her husband is a teacher at a school in the area.

She is a very hard-working woman and, due to her great desire to get ahead, she decided to sell Sayson products (beauty products, perfumes, and costume jewelry).  About a year ago, she also started selling purses, which she does at the same time she’s selling her other products.  She tells us that she works every day and that she delivers her products on credit and charges every fifteen days.  She takes advantage of offers to buy more cheaply and then sell at retail with which she earns extra money.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and purses.  She has been in the cooperative bank for three cycles, and she enjoys it because the discussions help her a lot in her daily life.

Her goal is to continue forward with her sales.

loans.use: buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and purses.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 63 años, vive actualmente en su casa propia al lado de su hermano. Toda su vida se ha esforzado para tener una estabilidad económica que le permita el bienestar de los suyos, nunca se ha casado y en la actualidad vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Tiene un negocio desde hace 20 años, que es una bodega, en la que ella misma se encarga de atender. Para ella es muy importante contar con dinero para volver a invertir en su negocio, siempre procura que este abastecido de variados productos, así engancha a sus clientes. Asimismo nos menciona que le gusta este trabajo, por que puede disponer de su horario y eso le da ventaja de no descuidar su casa. En adelante desea tener una tienda con mayor variedad en mercadería. Es su segunda vez que esta trabajando con MFP,  se enteró de esta financiera por medio de un volante que le hicieron llegar a lo cual ella misma ha solicitado información y tomó la decisión de solicitar un  préstamo para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar más productos y abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita is 63 years old and currently lives in her own home with her brother. All of her life she has strived to achieve financial stability so that she can provide for her own welfare. Margarita never married and currently lives in the house she inherited from her parents. She has a store that she manages and has been in business for 20 years. Margarita believes it is very important to have money to reinvest in her business because she is always restocking her inventory with various products, which helps to draw in customers. She also says that she enjoys this form of work because she can set her own schedule and not neglect her household chores. In the future, Margarita hopes that her store will have a wider variety of merchandise.

This is the second time she has worked with MFP. Margarita learned about the organization through a promotional flyer that she received, so she requested information and made the decision to request a loan in order to improve the condition of her business. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of more products so that she can restock her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise so that she can restock her store.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura y ganadería.

Arsenio desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de Oyotun, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más ganado vacuno lechero para que se incremente la producción de leche y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Arsenio es una persona trabajadora y dedicada que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades.
texts.en:
Arsenio is 49 years old and lives with his family in their own house. The house is connected only to electricity and is located in the rural area of the district of Oyotún in the province of Chiclayo. The area is known for farming and cattle rearing.

For several years Arsenio has been rearing and selling cows. His corral is located outside of his home. He feeds his animals with balanced fodder and grass from natural pastures to get a good milk production which he sells to the people in his area and at the market in Oyotún. He has a loyal clientele that buys his milk. He spends his income on family expenditures.

Arsenio came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 3000 new soles to buy more milk cows to increase his milk production and earn more money from his milk sales. The profit will enable him to pay the loan installments and improve his family's quality of life. Arsenio is a hard-working and dedicated man whose only wish is to expand his business and provide better opportunities to his children.

loans.use: to buy milk cows.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 52, married, and has three children.  She is patient and hard working, which is her secret to financial improvement, despite the poor living conditions.  Estelita constantly wishes for a stable source of income to sustain her family's basic necessities

Estelita has been involved in planting and harvesting rice for thirty years.  She is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and pay for the expenses of farming.  Estelita and her husband will continue to manage their rice farming business.  Estelita will also strive to lift the family from a poor quality of living to a better quality of living.  She looks forward to the growth of her business and how she can become a better borrower and entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and pay for the expenses of farming.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús, de 34 años; es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de sus padres: Dionisio y Justina, a los que cuida y apoya en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Su principal sustento económico se centra, en la siembra de alverja y papa en gran cantidad. Ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es lanzar semillas sobre la tierra. En todo este tiempo de trabajo incansable; pudo comprar sus terrenos propios y muy bien ubicados, pues están al alcance del río, logrando que Jesús pueda regarlos constantemente. Como sus cultivos maduran con mayor rapidez, contrata peones ocasionalmente para que le ayuden en el mantenimiento y cosecha de sus productos. El mayor problema que afronta, es la falta de capital de trabajo, pues hace un año fracasó en su cosecha, ya que salió a destiempo. Pero eso no lo desanima, ya que comenzó trabajando en el picado de papa en grandes cantidades en la capital del país, donde viaja cada 15 días. Ahora está pensando ahorrar para poder incrementar su producción de tal manera que pueda comercializarlo en la capital del país. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por la oportunidad que le dan. Además promete pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Jesús de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 20 sacos de fertilizantes naturales y 2 bolsas de semilla de alverja, para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Jesús, aged 34, is a single, hard-working man.  He lives with his parents Dionisio and Justina, whom he takes care of and supports in having their own home.  Their home is located in the hamlet of Bellavista Huaracayo. 

His main economic support is growing large quantities of peas and potatoes.  He has been doing this for 10 years, and what he likes most about his work is sowing the seeds in the earth.  With all this time of tireless working, he has been able to buy his own farmland which is very well located. It is within reach of the river, which means that Jesús can irrigate consistently.  As his crops are maturing faster, he occasionally hires workers to help him in the maintenance and harvest of his crops.

The biggest problem that he faces is a lack of working capital, as a year ago his harvest failed, which was a bad time.  But this doesn't discourage him, as he has started working selling large quantities of chopped potatoes in the country's capital, where he travels every two weeks.  He is now planning on saving money, so as to be able to increase his crops so that he can sell them in the country's capital.

He belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Muruhuay”, and he feels grateful to them for the opportunity they are giving him.  Additionally, he is promising to make his repayments in a punctual manner.

On receiving the support of the loan, Jesús will invest the requested money in purchasing 20 sacks of natural fertilizer and 2 bags of pea seeds for his next planting.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of fertilizer and two bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Gretchie

texts.en:
Gretchie is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Gretchie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Gretchie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gretchie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, esta solicitando un préstamo que lo necesita para comprar lo que necesita para las tortillas como: leña, maíz y gas, y de esa forma tener lo necesario y poder continuar en el negocio, este apoyo con los prestamos ha sido una gran ayuda para el negocio, pues el gas ha encarecido, la leña por la epoca lluviosa es dificil encontrarla, pero con el aporte de este prestamo puede prepararse para varios meses. 
El sueño de María es fortalecer más su negocio, que su hija siga estudiando en la universidad, y obtener más ingresos para el sostén de ella y de su hija.
texts.en:
María is requesting a loan to buy the supplies she needs for making tortillas such as firewood, corn and gas.  This will enable her to have what she needs available and to continue in her business.  The support of these loans has been very helpful for her business because the cost of gas has gone up and firewood is difficult to find during the rainy season.  However, with the support of this loan she is able to set herself up for several months.

María's dreams are to further strengthen her business, for her daughter to continue studying at university, and to make more income so that she can support herself and her daughter.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and gas.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Pacita has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Pacita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Pacita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié , père de quatre enfants dont les trois sont à l'école.Il exerce le commerce de produits alimentaires et tient une boutique devant son domicile ou il propose à ses clients des denrées de premières nécessité comme le riz, l'huile, des pommes de terre, des oignons...Il entretient sa famille avec les revenus tirés de son commerce.Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetabnt des sacs de riz, d'oignons, de pommes de terre et d'autres produits divers.Son ambition est d'élargir son activité et de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Oumar is married and the father of four children, out of whom three attend school. He sells food products, and has a store in front of his house, where he sells staples such as rice, oil, potatoes, onions, etc, to his customers.

He provides for his family thanks to the income generated by his business. He's seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 in order to bolster his working capital by buying sacks of rice, sacks of onions, sacks of potatoes, and other food staples.

He ambitions to expand his business and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of onions, sacks of potatoes, and other food staples

loans.name: Linder

texts.es: Linder, de 41 años, es una hombre con muchas ganas de progresar, es muy responsable y desea darle lo mejor a su familia, Esta casado y tiene tres hijos de 19, 15 y 4 años. Juntos habitan en una casa propia en donde vive a lado de sus hijos y su esposa. EL trabajo de Linder consiste en el transporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi, él sale desde muy temprano en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros, se moviliza de un lugar a otro en busca de clientes para así poder generar mayores ganancias en su día. Además, cuando puede realiza otras inversiones ya que posee dos mototaxis, de los cuales uno maneja y otro lo maneja un chofer. Paralelo a ello, vende ropa, zapatillas, que trae de la ciudad de Lima y los vende a amistades y familiares, así logra tener más ingresos. Tiene once años en el trabajo de transporte, mientras que en la venta de ropa y zapatillas recién dos años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su tiempo ya que el es docente de una institución educativa y trabaja medio tiempo ahí y el resto de las horas del día se dedica a trabajar en su mototaxi, es por eso que le esta yendo bien ya que genera ingresos. Este será el segundo crédito con la institución MFP, la primera vez que recibió un préstamo pudo invertirlo de buena manera teniendo buenas ganancias. Desea que le sigan otorgando los préstamo ya que le es de mucha ayuda para realizar la inversión en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará repuestos0 ntre ellos toldos, llantas, y piezas del motor de sus mototaxi, además pagara al mecánico que le brindará el servicio de reparación de sus unidades.
texts.en:
Linder is 41 years old. He is a man with a great desire to get ahead. He is very responsible and wants to give his family the best. He is married and has three children who are 19, 15, and 4 years old. They all live together in their own house, he, his children, and his wife. Linder’s job is transportation of cargo and passengers in his motorcycle taxi. He goes out very early in search of his eventual passengers. He goes from one place to another, seeking clients so that he can generate good earnings each day. Also, when he can, he makes other investments because he has two motorcycle taxis, one of which he drives and the other is driven by a driver. Along with this business, he also sells clothing and shoes that he brings from the city of Lima, which he sells to friends and family so that can have more income. He has been working in the transportation business for eleven years, and has been selling the clothing and shoes for two years. 

What he likes about his job is that it allows him to manage his own time. He is a teacher at a school and works part time there and the rest of the hours in the day he spends driving his motorcycle taxi. This is why things are going well for him, because he is making money. This will be his second loan with the Microfinanzas Prisma institution. The first time he received a loan he was able to invest it in a good way and have good earnings. He hopes that they will continue granting him loans because they are a lot of help to him in investing in his business. With the amount requested, he will buy replacement parts such as tarps, tires, and motor parts for his motorcycle taxis. He will also pay the mechanic that will provide the service of fixing his taxis.

loans.use: to buy tarps, tires, and motor parts for his motorcylce taxis and also to pay the mechanic.

loans.name: Damaris Wanjiru

texts.en:
Damaris used her previous loan well.  She bought more stock for the retail shop. The business improved tremendously. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Damaris will use the loan to add stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will expand the business. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her child and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice and maize meal

loans.name: Yudaya's Group

texts.en:
Yudaya's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Yudaya is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past 1 year, Yudaya has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hairdressing for local women. 

To help expand her business, Yudaya has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids, and will help Yudaya to generate greater profits and pay for her mother’s medical bills. Yudaya hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Yudaya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Yudaya's future prospects by teaching her how to be hard working.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 55 years old, married, and has three children.  She is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. Together with her husband and children, Wilma manages their household while operating her accessories stall. She is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Wilma buys accessory items from a wholesaler and sells them at a profit. Her products include hair clips, head bands, and bags. Customers are attracted to buy due to Wilma's low prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons.  She earns 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Wilma is requesting a loan for 48,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Wilma dreams of expanding her store and helping her children through all her hard work in her business. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of accessory items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 30 year old married woman with six children, four of them are in school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and wheat flour to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Soda

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui exerce dans la friperie depuis trois ans.Elle achète dans la capitale une balle de friperie et revend les vêtements au détail à domicile.Son activité s'avère très rentable et lui procure des bénéfices consistants lui permettant de prendre en charge les frais scolaire et d'habillement de ses 6 enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Elle parvient aussi à participer à l'amélioration de l'alimentation de la famille, en soutien à son mari. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de 300000f de l'UIMCEC pour acheter 1 balle de vêtements. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman who has been in the business of second-hand clothes for 3 years. She buys clothes in bales in the capital and resells them retail at her house. This activity is actually quite profitable; she makes some substantial profits which enable her to pay for the school fees and clothes of her 6 children, who all go to school. She also manages to ensure better feeding for her family by supporting her husband. In order to strengthen her business, she is applying for a 300000f loan from UIMCEC so she can buy 1 bale of clothes. Her goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy 1 bale of clothes.

loans.name: Grimaldo

texts.es: Grimaldo, de 57 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Getrudes de 49 años  y sus 02 queridos hijos Michael de 16 años y Yuri de 18 años; a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. Grimaldo es bien centrado en sus responsabilidades y obligaciones, ha Grimaldo la vida le enseñó tropiezos pero no se rindió al contrario trato de sobresalir y trabajó con mucho ahínco sobre sus plantas de café. Estos productos una vez cosechados los llevará a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en comprarle. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar en épocas de lluvia porque perjudican el rendimiento de su trabajo. El crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos como la poda y el desmonte de malezas. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario y responsable. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles; contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en el mantenimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en: Grimaldo, who is 57 years old, is a very hardworking man.  He lives in his own house along with his wife Getrudes, who is 49 years old.  He also lives with his two beloved children: Michael, who is 16 years old, and Yuri, who is 18 years old.  He wants to offer them a good education.  Grimaldo is well balanced in his responsibilities and obligations.  Life has taught Grimaldo some lessons, but it has not hindered him from excelling.  He worked diligently over his coffee plants.  Once these products are harvested, he takes them to the city of San Francisco to be sold.  He already has numerous purchasers who know the quality of his product and who do not worry about buying from him.  What he likes the most about his job is sowing his land and making them fertile and productive.  He has been doing this activity for 20 years and he considers the most difficult part of the job is working in the rainy season because it damages the yield of his work.  The sought after loan is for maintenance in respect to his crops such as pruning and weeding.  In the future, he hopes to continue saving his earnings because he want to buy new lands.  This will be his first loan with MFP.  He knows that he has to pay all off the installments punctually and he is ready to do it.  In his communal bank he is a supportive and responsible member.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles; he will hire day laborers to help with the maintenance of his plants.

loans.use: to hire day laborers

loans.name: Wilmer Eleodoro

texts.es:
Wilmer, tiene 23 años de edad, el vive en la calurosa ciudad de ICA, el es una persona muy responsable y alegre, el trabaja como albañil, en una empresa de construcción, trabajo el cual lo realiza con mucha responsabilidad y empeño, lo que le ha permitido ser uno de los mejores albañiles de la obra.

Wilmer está muy agradecido con los prestatarios de KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para arreglar en cuarto donde vive y así tener una buena calidad de vida.

El sueño de Wilmer es ser el mejor maestro de obra y así tener muchos clientes por atender.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 23 and lives in the warm city of ICA.  He is a very responsible and cheerful parson who works as a mason for a construction company.  He works very enthusiastically and responsibly, which has allowed him to become one of the best masons.

Wilmer is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and will use the money to buy building materials to fix up a room where he lives so he can have a good quality of life.

Wilmer’s dream is to be a better master in his work and have many customers.

loans.use: to fix up a room.

loans.name: Makara Group

texts.es:
MARIANA , es una mujer emprendedora, dinámica y con muchos deseos de trabajar. tiene 35 años de edad vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposo en su humilde casa de madera.
su esposo se dedica al cultivo de coco y a la venta de madera. 
MARIANA, tiene una tienda de víveres en la  cual invertirá en la compra de productos como: arroz, aceite, enlatados, fréjol, lenteja, papas, cebolla y otros productos para surtir su pequeño negocio.
vive en una comunidad donde carecen de servicio de agua potable, consumen agua del río, el trasporte es nulo y tienen que caminar mucho para poder llegar a la población mas cercana.

es su segundo crédito en VisionFund y se siente muy contenta de esta oportunidad que tiene para trabajar en su comunidad y para sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Mariana is an enterprising and dynamic woman who is eager to work hard. She is 35 and lives with her four children and her husband in a small and humble wooden house.

Her husband grows coconuts and sells wood.

Mariana has a small grocery store. She would like to invest some money in buying products like rice, oil, tinned food, beans, lentils, potatoes, onions and other products so she can stock her small business.

She lives in a community that doesn't have drinking water. They use the water from the river. There is no transport and they have to walk a long way to get to the nearest village.

This is the second loan with VisonFund and she is very pleased to get this opportunity to work in her community for her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy general groceries for her small business.

loans.name: Madam Ayélé Catherin

texts.en:
Madam Catherine Ayélé D., spouse of ADJO, is living in the area of N’kafu (Toyota Bar) in Lomé. This woman of 30 years old is a mother of three (03) children among whom two are twins (girls). Beside her own children, she takes care of an orphan dependent. Her husband is an unemployed printer and all the household duties are left up to her. She has started her business selling basic groceries, (sugar, condensed tomato, fresh tomato, soap, detergents and others…) over the past two years with only the limited means she had at her disposal. Her business did not move forward significantly at the beginning on account of the insufficiency of the working capitals, is today enough flourishing due to the devotion and determination of Madam D., who deserves to be supported financially. The demand growing due to the very commercial location of the business, but her supply is insufficient.

Madam D. requests currently $ 500 to build up a significant stock of merchandise in order to respond to the customers demands. To finance this woman is to save a whole family.

Madame D. Ayélé Catherine épouse ADJO est domiciliée au quartier N’kafu (Toyota Bar) à Lomé. Cette femme âgée de 30 ans, est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants dont des jumelles. En dehors de ses propres enfants, elle a en charge un autre enfant de parents très démunis. Son mari est un imprimeur régulièrement en chômage et presque tous les besoins de foyer repose très souvent sur elle. Elle a commencé ses activités de vente des produits alimentaires de première nécessité (sucre, tomate en boîte, tomate fraîche, savon, détergents et autres…) il y a deux (02) ans avec les moyens dérisoires qu’elle disposait. Cette activité qui n’avait pas connu une évolution significative au départ pour insuffisance de fonds de commerce, est aujourd’hui assez florissante à cause du dévouement et de la détermination de Madame D. qui mérite d’être soutenue financièrement aujourd’hui. La demande se fait de plus en plus pressante à cause de l’emplacement très commercial de l’activité mais l’offre est insuffisante. Madame D. sollicite aujourd’hui $ 500 pour constituer un stock important de marchandises à être revendu en période de soudure afin de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Financer cette femme, c’est sauver toute une famille.

loans.use: To supply merchandises (sugar, soap, milk, sweets, chocolate, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to relocate her grocery business to a safe environment and purchase more stock

loans.name: San Juana

texts.en:
Mrs. San Juana has had her business for 8 months. “I had to work very hard in order to have my own business. Now what I need is more merchandise because the customers are always requesting many things. Also, I would like to paint the exterior of my business, because the walls are very scratched. I am requesting $1,000.00 to invest in my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. San Juana tiene 8 meses con su negocio “Tuve que trabajar mucho para poder tener mi negocio propio ahora lo que me hace falta es más mercancía ya que la gente me pide muchas cosas, también quisiera pintar por fuera mi negocio ya que las paredes estan muy rayadas”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in buying merchandise for my business.

loans.name: Kouadio
