Srey would like to grow rice during the dry season but lacks sufficient funds to do so. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to support her rice field.

Srey supplements her living by making Khmer cakes for sale. Her husband, Mr. Norng Sophat, is a laborer who is able to earn a small salary to help support his family, and also helps in his wife's farming.

This couple has four children, three attending the local school, while the youngest is only four years old. Srey's husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to support her rice field.

loans.name: Sandoh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sandoh” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sia F.. Sia is aged 31; she was born in Kenema city where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school. Sia sells bread, soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, foot-brushes, etc. and has been doing this business for 10 years now. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy bread, soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, foot-brushes, etc. wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
Novie B. is from the village of Baracbac Sta. Fe, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 43 years old. Novie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Novie raises pigs for fattening and sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 9 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP every four months from these activities.

In 2011, Novie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Novie's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase livestock feed and other supplies for his pig farm

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn N. is a 38-year-old married woman who earns a daily income cultivating rice crops. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents, and she uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. They have five unmarried children. One of their children is employed as a sewing worker on a fixed salary. Sorn N. currently generates an income of approximately $1.5 per day from her rice-growing business. 

To make additional income, Sorn N. is applying for a loan to purchase many ducklings for feeding, and she will sell them out when they are big enough.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings to raise and sell

loans.name: Word Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Word” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Hawa S. is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a farmer and they have four children. Hawa has been a businesswoman for 11 years. She sells margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), cooking oil, salt, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), cooking oil, salt, etc., at wholesale

loans.name: Les Phares De Ouanaminthe 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Amogene est la coordinateur de son groupe Les phares DE OUANAMINTHE.

Amogene habite dans la région de Ouanaminthe d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Amogene a dirigé son commerce de pesos il est aussi un vendeur de Bible pendant les 3 dernières années.

Amogene voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus de pesos et de Bible

Des autres membres des phares ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires et des produits cosmetiques.

Amogene dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause du chômage.

Amogene dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’il achète un moto pour le taxi
texts.en:
Amogene is the coordinator for the group "Les Phares de Ouanaminthe" (The Beacons of Ouanaminthe). He lives in the Ouanaminthe region of Haiti where electricity is rare and running water is very limited. He runs a pesos business and for the last three years has also been selling Bibles. He would like to use this loan to invest in more pesos and Bibles.

The other members of "The Beacons" need a loan for businesses such as selling foodstuffs or cosmetics.

Amogene says his chief challenge is the lack of regular customers due to joblessness. His dream is to grow his business so that she can buy a motorcycle to use as a taxi.

loans.use: to invest in pesos for a currency exchange business and in Bibles for resale.

loans.name: Beatriz Andrea

texts.es: La señora Beatriz tiene como actividad principal el comercio de joyas de oro y de plata, la señora es cliente de emprender por menos de un año, sin embargo en este tiempo demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad con sus pagos, ahora solicita un monto mayor para incrementar su capital comprando joyas para luego revenderlas obteniendo utilidad, ella desea tener mas ingresos vendiendo joyas, vive en un departamento en el centro de la ciudad junto a su esposo y sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, La Sra. Beatriz desea un futuro mejor para sus hijos por tal motivo se esfuerza mucho para lograr cubrir todas sus necesidades.
texts.en: Beatriz has a business selling silver and gold jewelry.  She has been a client of Emprender for less than a year.  However, over this time she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments.  Now she requests a larger sum to increase her capital so that she can buy jewelry to later resell for a profit.  She wants to have more income from her jewelry business.  She lives in an apartment in the center of the city with her husband and their school-aged children.  Beatriz wants a better future for her children, and for this reason she works very hard to provide them with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy gold jewelry to sell

loans.name: Leydi Beatriz

texts.es: Leydi es la propietaria de una tienda naturista llamada “Natural Verde” en donde vende toda clase de medicina natural y además presta el  servicio de terapias físicas y respiratorias en su consultorio ubicado en el mismo local, donde tiene todos los implementos necesarios para desempeñar esta actividad; Como fisioterapeuta profesional decidió desarrollar su espíritu emprendedor una vez finalizó sus estudios en la Universidad  en el año 2005, ofreciendo servicios domiciliarios de las técnicas aprendidas en su profesión y en la medida en que fue ampliándose su cobertura de clientes, y apoyada por su novio experto en homeopatía, abrieron su consultorio dotado de camillas, nebulizadores masajeadores y demás equipos, negocio que combinó con un punto comercial donde vende productos naturales y  que hoy hacen hoy de su sueño una realidad. Leydi necesita tener constantemente un  inventario de mercancías alto,  porque debe mantenerlo bien surtido especialmente de la mercancía que más rota.  Su sueño más adelante es tener una institución prestadora de servicios y convertirse en una distribuidora mayorista de sus productos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará   medicamentos  naturales para hacerles créditos a clientes especiales, aumentar su capital de trabajo y continuar fortaleciendo su futuro, el cual planea sea exitoso.
texts.en:
Leydi is the owner of a health products store called “Natural Verde” (Natural Green) where she sells all types of natural medicines. She also has an office in the same location where she provides physical and respiratory services. Leydi has all the necessary tools to provide these services. As a professional physiotherapist, she decided to develop her entrepreneurial skills when she finished her studies at the university in 2005. She began offering home services to those who wanted to learn the techniques used in her profession. This gave her the chance to attract more customers. She has the support of her boyfriend, who is an expert in homeopathy, and they opened an office equipped with couches, nebulizers, massage devices, and other types of equipment. Combining this business with a store that sells natural products has allowed Leydi to turn her dream into a reality.

She needs to keep her inventory well-stocked, especially those products that have high turnover. Her dreams later on include having an organization where she lends her services and becoming a wholesale distributor of health products. This Kiva loan is the first she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy natural medicines to use as rewards for her special customers, to increase her operating capital, and to continue building toward the future. Leydi plans to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines in bulk.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda lives in Uganda. She is widowed and has six children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of her grandchildren. Imelda has had a restaurant for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Imelda sells her products from home. She also generates additional income through her rentals. Imelda has requested a loan of 1500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, rice and charcoal. Her main business challenge is seasonality. Imelda lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy another plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, charcoal and rice to make dishes to sell

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr:
Ngoné habites dans un petit village à l’interieur du Senegal avec son marie et ses enfants. Elle a neuf enfants en total entre l’âges de 17 à 34 ans. 

Elle est commercente depuis 17 ans, specialisé dans les produits locals comme les carottes, aubergines et piments. 

Elle a constaté qu’elle peut gagner plus de marge si elle achetes les légumes dans sa localité au lieux de payer les frais de transportation. Ca lui permettra aussi de passer plus de temps avec ses enfants et ses petits enfants.

Avec l’argent qu’elle gagne elle va soutenir ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Ngoné lives in a small town in the interior of Senegal with her husband and children. She has nine children in total, whose ages range from 17 to 34.

She has been a merchant for 17 years, and specializes in local products such as carrots, eggplant, and peppers.

She has noted that she can earn larger profits if she buys vegetables in her area instead of paying for them to be transported. This will also allow her to spend more time with her children and grandchildren.

With the money that she earns, she will provide for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables locally, without having to pay for transportation costs.

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Mr. Than, 48 years old, owns a small shop located along the street where he sells soft drinks and coffee. He typically makes around US $5 in profit each day to ensure that his family has a comfortable life. His wife is a good homemaker and a domestic rice cultivator. He is married with six single children. Three of the children are employed in the garment industry as garment factory workers and have a specific salary each month and the other three attend school. Mr. Than is running his business smoothly because he has skills in public relations, which he uses with his customers. He also faces a problem: his shop is too old and not attractive to the customers. To solve this obstacle, Mr. Than would like to request a loan to decorate his shop, which will allow him to add new customers to his clientele.

loans.use: to decorate his shop.

loans.name: Bruno De Jesus

texts.es: Bruno de Jesús de sesenta años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo en zona rural del país. El posee una venta de leña y es muy reconocido en la zona por su constante actividad comercial, tiene mucha clientela pues vende leña de muy buena calidad y de todo tipo a un excelente precio; ofrece el mejor servicio del lugar siempre recibe a los clientes con una sonrisa en el rostro. Bruno de Jesús es muy carísmatico, lleno de sueños por cumplir, por eso su esfuerzo es constante y duradero. Ahora le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar mayor cantidad de leña y de diferentes tipos. Bruno de Jesús tiene la confianza de que con su trabajo le podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y llevara seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en: Bruno de Jesús, sixty years old, lives with his partner and his son in a rural area of the country.  He sells firewood and is very well-known in the area for his constant business activity.  He has many customers, since he sells very good quality wood of all kinds at an excellent price, and he offers the best service in the area.  He always greets his customers with a smile on his face.  Bruno de Jesús is very charismatic, full of dreams to achieve, so his effort is steady and lasting.  Now he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to purchase a larger quantity of firewood of different kinds.  Bruno de Jesús has confidence that with his work he will be able to give his family a better quality of life, and he will bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to purchase firewood of all kinds

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Magburaka town about 28 years ago. She is married and the couple has 3 children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Aminata sells ready-to-wear-clothes, dishes, spoons, etc. 

With the help of this loan, Aminata and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Aminata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy clothes, dishes and spoons to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, dishes and spoons to add to her business

loans.name: Amowassina

texts.fr:
Amowassina est une femme âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un tailleur. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Amowassina travaille comme revendeuse d’articles de mercerie depuis 2007. Elle vend ans un quartier de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Amowassina a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de mercerie.
texts.en:
Amowassina, age 36, is married to a tailor. She has two children. 
 
Amowassina has been working at selling sewing notions since 2007. She sells in a neighborhood where she lives. She buys her products in Lomé. 

Amowassina has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy sewing notions.

loans.use: to buy sewing notions.

loans.name: Mohamed Alie's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 13,200,000 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay their loan using their monthly salaries.

The leader of this group is Mohamed. Born in the northern town of Kabala, Mohamed is 48 years old. He is married and has three children. Mohamed has requested a loan of 2,500,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Marecil

texts.en:
Marecil is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Marecil has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marecil is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marecil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: María Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba, vive por una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle, en este lugar se puede apreciar hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables y gentiles.

La Señora. María tiene 49 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 10 hijos de los que 6 son casados e independientes, 2 estudian en el colegio y uno en la escuela, 1 trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora realizando fletes, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Doña María se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, realiza esta actividad hace 20 años. También en su casa cría cerdos y gallinas. 

Es socia del banco comunal 6 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de quesos para continuar con el negocio. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos  estudien en la universidad y sean  profesionales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Cochapamba communal bank.  She lives in a community in the Valle parish.  This place is noted for its beautiful landscape and for the fact that its residents work in agriculture and raising livestock, its friendly and cordial people, and the maintenance of its culture and traditions.

María, age 49, is married and has ten children.  Six of them are married and independent.  Two go to high school, and one goes to elementary school.  One works and helps her financially.  Her husband is a professional driver, and he works hauling freight.  She lives in her own house.

María buys and sells cheese, and she has been doing this for 20 years.  She also raises pigs and chickens at her house.

She has been a member of the communal bank for six years.  She will use the new loan to buy cheese in order to continue with the business.

Her dream is for her children to go to the university and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Wilma has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

Wilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino de 46 años de edad habita en Puerto Diaz junto a su familia  compuesta por su esposa y sus 2 hijos.  Desde hace mas de 25 años se dedica a la pesca artesanal, oficio que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeño para ganarse el sustento diario. Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de cambiar las redes de pesca que tiene, las cuales se encuentran en mal estado por el uso diario, lo cual le impide realizar su trabajo eficazmente, y de esta manera poder pezcar mas y obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, pues tanto su esposa como sus hijos son los que se encargan de venderlo a la ciudad y de esta manera obtienen ingresos que le permiten el sustento familiar.

Su mayor sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y crecer mas en su negocio.
texts.en: Faustino, 46, lives in Puerto Díaz with his family which consists of his wife and two children.  He’s been an artisanal fisherman for over 25 years, an occupation his parents taught him when he was a little boy to earn his daily living.  He’s asking for his 4th loan in order to replace his fishing nets that have worn away through daily use and which keep him from doing his work efficiently.  This way he’ll be able to fish more and obtain higher income for his family.  His family supports his efforts because both his wife and his children take care of selling the fish in the city thus obtaining income to support the family.  His greatest wish is to improve his family’s quality of life and to grow more in his business.

loans.use: to replace his damaged fishing nets.

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en: Vuth works as a garment factory worker in Ang Snoul, Kandal, Cambodia. Vuth works in order to raise her two children and support their educations. She normally works 8 hours a day. In the morning, she starts working from 7am-12pm and she starts again from 1pm-4pm in the afternoon. She is able to earn around $100 per month. Vuth wants to upgrade her living and provide her children good opportunities to join the university after they finish high school. So now she is taking out a loan in sum of $600 to purchase some piglets for raising. This loan provides her a chance to start up pig raising business. If this business creates a good profit for the family, she will expand it  in the future.

loans.use: to purchase some piglets for raising.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has five dependants. 

She has sold kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) at Eguafo for the past seven years. Her husband is a farmer. Aba uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase maize for the kenkey. With the new profits, Aba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize for kenkey.

loans.name: Sinoko Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sinoko Group in Western Kenya! 

Mary takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Mary will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

Mary is the facilitator of the Sinoko group. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Sinoko group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vibian

texts.en:
Vibian is a married woman who has two children. She is 40 years old, and resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte: Philippines.

Vibian owns and operates a business venture, making and selling nipa huts to local businesses and community members, and she's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials in making nipa huts. Vibian has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Vibian wants to make improvements of her house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials in making nipa huts.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza is a Ugandan female aged 34 who owns a retail shop in Kagadi, Uganda. She wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and other merchandise for resell. Eight years ago she was doing farming from which she saved money to start a shop that has grown over the years. Inflation is affecting her business so she wishes to convert it into a wholesale shop in the future. She as a mother of four would like to see to that her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and other merchandise for resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks for her business.

loans.name: Marjorie Marisela

texts.es:
La Señora. Marjorie es socia del banco comunal Zhullin, vive en por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es conocida como San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues y es considerada como una ciudad patrimonio arquitectónico y cultural del Ecuador, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan porque ser gente amable y gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Marjorie tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 8, 5 años de edad y está muy contenta ya que se encuentra a días de dar a luz a su cuarto hijo. Su esposo labora como podador de parques y jardines, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Marjorie se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos y en sus tiempos libres vende cosméticos de la marca Avon, actividad que la desempeña hace 5 años. En su casa cría pollos.
 
Este es su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir para la compra de cosméticos para ampliar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es crecer más en su negocio y salir en adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Marjorie is a member of the “Zhullin” communal bank.  She lives in the sector of the same name in the city of Azogues.  This city is known as San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues and is considered to be one of Ecuador’s cultural and architectonic heritage cities.  Its residents are merchants, raise animals and farm and are noted for being nice and kind people; they preserve their culture and traditions.

Marjorie is 28 years old, married and has three children who are 13, 8 and 5 years old.  She is very happy because she’s about to give birth to her fourth child.  Her husband works as a pruner in parks and gardens.  The house they live in is theirs.

Marjorie works taking care of her children and in her free time she sells Avon brand cosmetics, an activity she’s been in for the last five years; she also raises chickens at home.

This is the fifth loan she’s taken out in the communal bank and she is going to use it to buy cosmetics to expand her business.  Her dream is to grow more in business and to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mr. Mey is a resident of Takhmao town. He acts as a local nurse in his neighborhood, generating approximately $2.00 per day, while his wife works for a company in Phnom Penh city. Mey doesn’t have any children yet, even though now he’s 45 years old. He really wishes to have one someday. 

There are currently some broken parts of his house, which are in immediate need of repair in order for them to have a comfortable life. However, Mey doesn’t have enough funds to fix his house. So he decided to ask for some funds from HKL to partially fix his present house. In the future, Mey hopes to own a small pharmacy in his commune.

loans.use: to fix his present house partially.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.en:
Madam A. was born in 1956. Married and mother of four (04) children, she is a perseverant and courageous woman. Still very active but having not a lot of means, she is exercising a small trade of beans in order to contribute to the household expenditures. But since the date her husband was retired, the situation has become very difficult in the family. The small old age pension of her husband (which is ofte late) is insignificant for the household needs. So, it belongs to the woman to take in to pay for the nearly total charges of the household. The income benefits from her small trade are not at the level of this responsibility. With a credit of $ 650, Madam A. will increase the size of her activity and get a substantial income in order to respond to the requirements she is facing. The amount solicited will serve to rent a warehouse, to buy, treat, stock and resell beans in higher quantity.

Madame A. est née en 1956. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle est une femme persévérante et courageuse. Encore très active mais n’ayant pas beaucoup de moyens, elle fait un petit commerce du haricot pour pouvoir participer aux charges du ménage. Mais depuis que son mari est admis à la retraite, la situation est devenue très difficile dans la famille. La petite pension du mari (qui se paie même avec des mois de retard) est insignifiante pour les besoins du ménage. C’est alors qu’il revient à la femme de prendre en charge la quasi-totalité des charges du ménage. Le revenu tiré de son petit commerce n’est pas à la hauteur de cette responsabilité. Avec un crédit de $ 650, Madame A. va augmenter la taille de son activité et dégager un revenu substantiel afin de faire face aux exigences qui se posent à elle désormais. Le montant sollicité servira à louer un magasin, à acheter, à traiter, à stocker et à revendre du haricot en grande quantité.

loans.use: Warehouse renting and beans storage

loans.name: Eya

texts.en:
Eya D. is 47, married, and the mother of four. The needs of this family are soaring, but satisfying them is necessary for its welfare. This is why Ms. D. started selling porridge with the help of a loan from Microfund Togo. Given her good ability to manage, she has been able to repay the loan on time. And recognizing her own energy and mastery of her business, she has decided to increase her number of income streams in order to elevate her family once more.

And so she is requesting a loan of $750 to ensure that she can acquire palm nuts and produce red palm oil out of them. With this new business activity, she believes she can help improve the living conditions of her family even more.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 47 ans, Madame D. Eya est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Les besoins de cette famille sont si croissants mais nécessaires à satisfaire pour son bien être. C’est ainsi que Madame D. Eya s’est lancée dans la vente de la bouillie et après un crédit auprès de la MICROFUND. Par sa bonne capacité de bien gérer ses activités elle a su rembourser au moment opportun. Reconnaissant son dynamisme et la maîtrise de ses activités, elle décide multiplier ses sources de revenus pour relever le niveau de sa famille.

Ainsi, sollicite t-elle encore un crédit de $750 afin d’assurer l’achat et la transformation de la noix de palme en huile rouge. Elle pense pouvoir contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille par cette nouvelle activité.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and make palm oil

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio ha vivido en Baba por 35 años cultivando arroz. En sus tierras también tiene otros productos como el plátano y el maíz, pero el que es su negocio es el arroz. El tiene 4 hijos que ya son adultos y que lo apoyan a su padre en su actividad de agricultura. El y su esposa viven solos en su casa que es de madera y cementa. El quiere seguir haciendo arreglos en su hogar después de hacer su inversión en la agricultura.

English:

Translated by Nuria Ruiz, Kiva Voluteer.

Emilio has grown rice in Baba for 35 years. In his land he also has other crops like bananas and corn but his main sustenance comes from rice. He has four grown up children that help him with the land. He and his wife live by themselves on their house, made out of wood an cement. He is requesting a loan for agricultural purposes but also to remodel his house that needs some fixing.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Rosa de Oro (Golden Rose) Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Rosa de Oro helps the farmers by providing access to machinery, training services and government assistance. The farmers from Rosa de Oro are very close to each other and cooperate to help one another on their farms.

The members of Rosa de Oro will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Rosa de Oro Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Baba compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large mulitnational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Sembrar Arroz

loans.name: Oung

texts.en: Mr. Oung H. is 58 years old and lives in Kampong Chnang with his wife and their 5 children.  He and his wife work together fixing bicycles.  They earn about $5/day in their business.  Two of their children work at a garment factory, and the other 3 go to school and help the family by cooking meals.  Mr. Oung H. will use this loan to purchase more spare parts and tools for his bicycle repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase spare bicycle parts and some tools for his repair business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen lives in her own house with her husband and her youngest daughter in the Agua de la Vida zone of La Paz. Her husband is retried and her daughter is studying tourism, and the loan Carmen is requesting is to purchase a computer and continue helping with her daughter's education until she becomes a professional.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen vive en casa propia en la Calle Coronel Estensoro de la zona de Agua de la Vida de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y su hija menor. El esposo es jubilado, su hija es estudiante de turismo y el crédito que solicitan es para comprar una computadora y poder seguir colaborando con la educación de su hija hasta que sea profesional. Es cliente nuevo; el análisis socioeconómico y el flujo de caja les permite acceder a un crédito, el cual cae en el programa de Fomento, bajo el rubro Educación de nuestra cartera de Créditos.

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Diana pertenece al Banco Comunal Lomas de Yarina,  del Jr. Comandante Suarez nro. 1069 del sector del Arenal  del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como taxista en motocard, apenas tiene un ingreso de S/. 550.00 (US$ 177.00) ingreso que no es suficiente para los gastos de la familia. 

Diana por invitación de su vecina decide participar en los prestamos de Manuela Ramos, desde entonces decide vender dulces, panes, etc.  Ahora tiene un horno hecho a barro con el cual puede elaborar los panes, bizcochuelos, ñuto de yuca, turca (bizcocho de Maíz) y Puchucuy (hecho de maíz, masato), además dada la necesidad, tuvo la iniciativa de vender por medio de otras mujeres, les da una cierta cantidad de panes a precio de costo dándoles el 40% de utilidad.


El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500 (US$ 500 Aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses,  será utilizado para mejorar su horno actual e instalar otro horno de barro, además comprará 1 saco de maíz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de yuca. 

Diana  esta muy contenta de dar oportunidad a otras mujeres para que generen ingresos así como contribuir económicamente para su hogar.

loans.use: Mantenimiento y compra de horno.  Compra de insumos.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
María Guadalupe is the mother of 13 children for whom she has had to fight to maintain healthy and motivated to succeed. Some time ago they lived in a smaller home and due to the size of the family they needed to move out of their neighborhood. After moving, Maria observed that there wasn't a grocery store nearby and decided to begin her business. She began with a small amount of items that she purchased in the supermarket and little by little went increasing her offerings. Thanks to the strength Maria has to take care of her 13 children and manage her store she has found a way to progress. At this time, her husband does not work and is able to help Maria with her store. Maria constantly fights to ensure her business continues.

Nonetheless she currently has little merchandise and is therefore requesting a loan of US$925 to be paid within 6 months. With this money, she will purchase merchandise in order to increase the variety of offerings to her customers in the neighborhood. With your help, Maria and her large family will be able to move ahead and celebrate a Christmas with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe es madre de 13 hijos a quienes a tenido que luchar por mantenerlos sanos y con ganas de salir adelante. Hace tiempo que vivían en una casa un poco más pequeña y debido al gran número de integrantes en la casa tuvieron que cambiarse de colonia. Al cambiarse de colonia María observó que no había una tienda cercana de abarrotes, y fue por eso que se le ocurrió poner su negocio. Comenzó con un poco de mercancía que compraba en el supermercado y poco a poco fue incrementando los productos. Gracias a la fuerza que tiene María de cuidar 13 hijos y atender su negocio es que han sabido salir adelante. Actualmente el esposo ya no trabaja y le ayuda a María en el negocio es por eso que María lucha constantemente porque el negocio se siga manteniendo.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene muy poca mercancía es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para poder tener más variedad qué ofrecer a sus clientes de la colonia. Con tu ayuda María y su gran familia podrá salir adelante y pasar navidad con todos los miembros de su familia.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Heoine

texts.en: Heroine B. is a Trader who sells Video CDs and DVDs. She is married but has no children. Her husband is also a trader, but his daily income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Heroine is working very hard to support with the family’s finances. At the moment she wants to increase her income by expanding her business. She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to purchase more movies (both CDs and DVDs) to meet the growing demand of her costumers for her goods.

loans.use: As an additional capital to purchase more movies (both VCDs and DVDs) to meet the growing demand of her  costumers for her goods.

loans.name: Muon

texts.en: Mrs. Muon Y., age 32, is an artist in a Traditional Cultural village and makes, typically, around $2 each day of income. Her husband is a barber making on average around $5 each day. She has two little children who are too young for school. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase musical instruments to rent to the people in her area.

loans.use: To purchase musical instruments to rent to the people in her area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more materials for her kitchen

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria Trinity is the owner of a general store. She primarily sells food and other products for the home such as sugar, flour, oil, canned goods, cleaning supplies etc. She also sells cosmetics and clothes among others supplies. It has been 18 years since she started her business and she is very pleased with her own achievements.

María is a mother of two older, married children, and has six grandchildren that she adores equally. Her husband traveled to Spain six years ago in search of work, but unfortunately he abandoned her completely and has not sent help since he left because he now has another family.

In spite of the emotional blows that María has endured, she has remained strong for her children and has fought to stay ahead for herself and her family. Her love for her kids and her grandchildren have been her fortress.

Now, María has greater goals. She want to continue progressing and growing her business so that she can save and invest in other local businesses. Today, Maria is asking for a loan that will afford her the opportunity to purchase merchandise in greater quantities and thus with better discounts.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maria T., es dueña de una tienda de ventas de varios productos en general. Principalmente vende comestibles e insumos para el hogar como azúcar, harina, aceite, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza etc., también vende cosméticos, ropas entre otras cosas. Hace 18 años que monto su negocio y dice que esta muy contenta de sus logros.

María es madre de dos hijos ya mayores y casados, tiene seis nietos a quienes ella adora y brinda amor por igual. Su esposo viajo hace seis años a España en busca de trabajo, pero lastimosamente la abandono totalmente, y no le ha enviado ayuda desde entonces, ya que este hombre ya tenía otra familia sin que María tuviera conocimiento de ello.

A pesar de los golpes emocionales que María ha recibido, ella ha sabido mantenerse fuerte para sus hijos, y ha luchado sola para salir siempre adelante. El amor de sus hijos y sus nietos han sido la fuente de su fortaleza.

María hoy día tiene mayores metas, ella desea seguir progresando hasta lograr ampliar su negocio, para ello ha empezado a ahorrar un poco de dinero que el día de mañana lo invertirá en la ampliación del local comercial. Hoy día María solicita un crédito que le permitirá adquirir mercaderías en mayores cantidades y con buenos descuentos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as: drinks, sweets, dairy product, bakery products, meat, sugar, flour, oil and others.

loans.name: Eoeun

texts.en: Eoeun S. is 41 years old and lives in Prey Veng province. Since 1999, she has had her own stand selling fruits and vegetables. She makes US$2.50 per day. Her husband, Son Choeun, is an army officer stationed in the neighboring province of Kandal. Even as an army officer, his daily income only amounts to US$5. They have five children together, only one of whom is old enough to work, and he is a teacher earning US$70 per month. She wants to expand her business so she can further provide for her four children still economically dependent and at home. Her loan would go towards increasing the size of her store and inventory. If she can have access to enough money she will be able to afford fruits and vegetables that normally only higher end sellers can afford, greatly raising her income.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Martha Emperatriz

texts.es:
Martha is married and is 58 years old. She is from La Libertad and finished junior high school. She has 5 children, one of which still depends on her. She lives in the Virgen D. la Puerta neighborhood in the city of Trujillo, Peru. For over ten years, Martha has dedicated herself to selling clothing and renting rooms in her home. She first obtained a loan from Manuela Ramos two years ago which she used to invest in the purchase of clothing for adults. She is a member of the communal bank “San Judas Tadea.” She will use this loan - which she will repay in 4 months - to invest in the purchase of clothing. Martha dreams of improving her living conditions and that her business will grow so that she can some day have a large bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Martha esta casada, tiene 58 años, es natural D. La Libertad, cursó estudios secundarios completos, tiene 05 hijos D. L. cuales una aun depenD. D. ella; vive en la Urbanización Virgen D. la Puerta en la cuidad D. Trujillo – Perú. La señora Martha se dedica a la venta D. ropa y alquiler D. cuartos, lleva mas D. 10 años. Se inició con Manuela Ramos hace dos años concediéndole un primer préstamo D. S/.300, lo invertio en la compra D. ropa para adultos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo”, Con el préstamo D. S/. 400., el cual será cancelado en un plazo D. 04 meses; lo invertirá en la compra D. ropa, para entregar a las personas que acostumbran hacerle L. pedidos. La señora Martha sueña con mejorar sus condiciones D. vida, y que su negocio crezca hasta llegar a tener un bazar muy granD..

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise
